loans.name: Mrs. Phan Pen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan P. is the leader of a group of six entrepreneurs who live in Tareab Duonsar Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. 

Her husband, Mr. Pum Ly, is a construction worker. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy construction supplies for his business. Thus, Mrs. Phan P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy construction supplies for her husband's business. 

She is 38 years old and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend the local school. The youngest is just one year old.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business.

loans.name: Gregoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria L. es una dama muy esforzada que se dedica a su negocio de pulpería atendido en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Desde hace 8 años inició su negocio con pocos recursos y actualmente lo ha logrado suplir de productos los cuales son ofertados en su localidad.

Ella vende todo tipo de productos desde comestibles hasta productos del hogar y es opr este motivo que ella hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos. Una vez mas espera en Ceprodel confiando que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria L. is a very hard-working woman who is dedicated to her convenience store in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León. With very few resources she began her business 8 years ago, and has now managed to provide the products for sale in her shop. She sells a wide variety of things, from food to household products. She uses the loans provided by Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase these products. Once again, she is putting her hope in Ceprodel, trusting that her loan will be granted and she will thus be able to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing products for general store

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle T. is a 39-year-old married mother of a high school student.  Her husband is a fisherman, and she sells the fish he catches at market.  Annabelle has applied for this loan to buy a new fishing boat for her husband to use; she hopes that one day they will be able to own two boats.  Annabelle says she has begun to save money to realize two dreams, one of renovating the family house, and the other of sending her child to college.

loans.use: To buy a new outrigger fishing boat.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry N. lives in Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. She is a beautician who is hired by people involved in weddings, parties, and so on. Since her career is doing well, she wants to buy more cosmetic supplies to support her business. She is a 28-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic supplies to support her business

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora María C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de caramelos y pan siendo comercializados por ella misma en su localidad a diario.

Actualmente ella atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir más productos para comercializarlos y es por esta razón que acude a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y así adquirir sus productos para continuar en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, María C. is dedicated to her business selling candy and bread, products she sells in her area on a daily. Currently she sees the necessity of adding more products to sell, and it's for this reason she came to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan so she can continue her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, bread and other products

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza has owned a small food store in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa  for 7 years. She belongs to Mwenge East group loan (Group code 2025).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items (tomatoes, sugar, rice, carrot, beans and etc) to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.

Eliza is 37 years old, married, and has three children: aged 20, 17 and 10. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her store.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance K. is 30 years old; she is married and mother of one child. Currently her child is in school. She lives at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who deals in assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is, house to house selling. She has been in business for two years and two months now. With her humorous behavior, she has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She has decided to add eggs to her inventory which she supplies to food vendors in the evening.

Constance treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods (cooking utensils). Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more products like cooking utensils and crates of eggs etc. ,which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers. With the loan she believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Unity’.

loans.use: to increase her stock of items such as cooking utensils and crates of eggs

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa R. tiene la edad de 37 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de María es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios comienzan por su familia ya que todos le  brindaban el apoyaban para que  siguiera con este negocio, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa niños, adultos y cosméticos, pero debido a ciertos tropiezos como lo era el viajar todos los días para realizar la visita en la casa de cada uno de sus clientes además tenia que recoger el dinero mensual, por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su vivienda y así poder atender a sus hijos y evitar viajar todos los días. Es así que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para damas, calzado, bolsos y además invertir en golosinas, refrescos naturales y pan. El sueño de María es crecer con su negocio para que sus hijos tengan un medio de supervivencia para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
María Teresa R. is 37 years old, and married. She has two children that are studying. Maria runs a general store, which she's done for the past 6 years thanks to the support of her family. Previously she sold children's clothing, adult clothing, and cosmetics, but due to certain circumstances, such as having to travel everyday to visit each of her clients at their respective houses and collect her money every month, she decided to establish a general store in her home so she could work and take care of her children without having to travel. And so, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase ladies clothing, shoes, bags, snacks, and bread. Maria's dream is to grow her business so that her children can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Mrs. Lolita B., a 55-year-old married mother of five children from Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, began a business in food retailing to be of assistance in meeting the family’s daily basic needs and the children’s school allowances. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives. Lolita’s loan request of PHP 9,500.00, her twelfth, is intended as additional capital for her business.  She dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and for their old age.

loans.use: As additional capital for food retailing.

loans.name: Ma. Janeth

texts.en:
Five years ago, Janeth began selling fish her husband catches from the ocean. They don't have their own boat for fishing because they can't afford to buy one. However, her husband borrows the fishing boat of their neighbor. During days when their neighbor's fishing boat is not available, Janeth has no fish to sell, hence, fishing and fish-selling don't give them regular income. 

Fish is not the most in-demand food of people in Janeth's village, yet it is one of the foods people are buying, more than other kinds of meat. It is so because fish is cheaper and common in their place, which is situated near the ocean. Janeth wishes to have this kind of business as their stable source of income. She wants to purchase their own fishing boat to be managed by her husband, thus making fishing as regular as it can be. 

Initially, Janeth had started her fish-selling business after she became a member of ASHI in June 2009. Since the loan she received is not yet enough to purchase a fishing boat for her husband, she will use it to finance her fish business. With her next loan, plus the savings she could generate out of her newly started business, she will be buying her husband a fishing boat. Janeth's husband is so supportive to all her visions, including her dreams for her children. She is determined to work hard in growing her business so that she can send all of her six children to school until college. By then, she foresees their lives coming out of poverty. 

She is so thankful that ASHI has the same vision as hers and that she has the opportunity to help herself and her family. Her loan will lead her towards success.

loans.use: buying fish to sell

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is 27 years old and single, and she cares for one dependent.

Subira started her own salon business four years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Subira's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy commodities for her business. With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Subira hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her salon business

loans.name: Teresa  De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Teresa T. es una mujer esforzada  que desde joven a trabajado para ayudar a sus padres primeramente y ahora a su familia, procreo cuatro hijos de 13, 15,17 y 23 años los cuales solo uno estudia, su ex esposo es mecánico y le ayuda para la alimentación ya que no están juntos, ella trabaja en servicios domestico pero en la casa que trabaja no tiene perspectiva es por eso en cuando recoja unos ahorro quiere poner un negocio de cosmético para poder estar en la casa y tener mas orden y obtener mejores ingresos, este es su cuarto crédito en Afodenic el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento arena y otros materiales para comienza hacer el embaldosado  y una cera de su casa para estar en mejores condiciones y con una mejor presentación. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios para hacer las mejoras a su casa el cual su familia esta contenta de estas mejoras.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa T. is a woman who puts much effort into everything she does. When she was younger, she had to work in order to help her parents. Now she does the same in order to support her own family. She has four children (ages 23, 17, 15, and 14), of which only one is a student. Her ex-husband is a mechanic and helps with the food bill even though they are no longer together. She currently works as a housemaid, but she doesn’t see any future in that job. When she has enough money saved, she wants to start a cosmetics business from home so that she can be in control and earn a better income.

Doña Teresa is requesting her fourth loan from AFODENIC. She will purchase sand, cement, and other building materials needed to install a ceramic tile floor. This will improve the condition of her home and make it more presentable. She thanks the Institution for providing these benefits so that she can make improvements that are suited for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to install a ceramic tile floor

loans.name: Nghiêm's Group

texts.en:
L. Nghiêm Thị (20201020043) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a 5-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nghiêm xá 03 (3).

L. is married and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, L. owns & operates a butcher shop. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 2,006,000 VND from SEDA. This previous L. was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new L. of 6,944,000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. The L. will be the 4th L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020044) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị S. (20201020045) is a 24-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her handicraft business.

3. Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020046) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her furniture making business.

4. Nguyễn Thị Lý (20201020047) is a 25-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nghiêm Thị (20201020043) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Nghiêm xá 03 (3).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán T.t heo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 19 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  S. hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.006.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nghiêm Thị L. (20201020044) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị S. (20201020045) là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nghệ thuật.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hàng thủ công mỹ nghệ.


3.  Nghiêm Thị Huệ (20201020046) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


4.  Nguyễn Thị Lý (20201020047) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Maria Melba

texts.en: Maria Melba B. is from the village of Bocator, Tangub City. She is 29 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Maria Melba owns and operates an "alimango" (mud crab) fishing business in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Maria Melba joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Melba is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools for her business. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees and to save for future needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools for her business

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
A buy-and-sell business is the kind of business Genara A. manages. She’s 52 years old, from Danao, Panglao, and has 7 children. She has been in this business since 1987, and she wishes that her business would go well.

She would like to borrow the amount of 13,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital for her business. It would help her a lot in solving her problems in financing.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Mr. Chouch Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan group consists of sixteen people and they all live in Dak Por village in Kandal province. Mr. Chouch P. is the village bank president, and has been selected by the group members. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice. He also breeds pigs and chickens to earn money. His wife, Mrs. H. Nakry, is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. As her business is going well, she wants to expand it. This is the reason that Mr. Chouch P., 27 years old, decided to ask for a loan, to buy more grocery goods for to sell. He hopes to increase their income and to improve his wife’s business with this loan. He is father of two children who are still too young to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for selling.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S. is a rattan cupboard seller who is 36 and is a married father caring for two kids who are pupils in the local public school. Since 2006, Chea S. and his wife have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to retail door-to-door across the province. They always take a week or two weeks in selling their products.

Chea S. is now running his business very well because he sells his items at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Chea S. seeks a US$ 800 loan to stock a bigger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

Note: Chea S. was not available at the time, so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To have a bigger amount of rattan cupboards to sell

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Ángela E. vende tortilla  y nacatamales desde hace ocho años, desde horas tempranas se levanta para ir a moler el maíz al molino y comenzar a palmear para el desayuno. Ya que manda a vender ambulante como en la casa para los clientes del barrio. Procreo tres hijos dos casados y uno que es enfermo discapacitado que tiene a su cuido. Como planes es pode mejorar la infraestructura de su casa para dar una mejor presentación en donde palmea las tortillas. Con este financiamiento invertirá en la compra de sacos de maíz para que no le falte inventario para hacer las tortillas, comprar mucha leña ya que se escasea en tiempo de verano, a si como comprar más alimentos para preparar muchos nacatamales y aumentar las ventas. Y poder hacer sus pagos como cubrir sus necesidades cotidianas. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad y el apoyo para poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Ángela E. has been selling tortillas and nacatamales for eight years. She wakes up in the early morning hours to grind the corn and form tortillas by hand for breakfast. Ángela sells her food as a street vendor, as well as from her house, to her customers from the neighborhood. She has three children, two are married and one suffers from a disability and receives care. Her plans include making improvements to her house, especially the area she uses for preparing tortillas.

With this loan, Ángela will buy sacks of corn so that she has enough inventory on hand for making tortillas. She will acquire firewood in large quantities because supply is scarce during the summer. Finally, she will purchase more ingredients for making nacatamales so that she can increase her sales and cover her basic necessities. Ángela thanks the Institution for its support and providing the opportunity to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of corn, firewood, and ingredients for making nacatamales

loans.name: C4352 Berwa Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 49 years old, married with 3 children aged between 10 and 15 years of age. He also takes care of 1 dependent from another family who is 11 years old. Vincent is the president of a group called “Berwa”. This group operates a sewing business in Kimironko which is in Kigali, Rwanda's capital city. Berwa employs 9 people and this is its 3rd successful year in operation. The members of Berwa start their work day at 7 AM and work to 8 PM every day except Sunday.

This group is requesting its first loan from Vision Finance Company and Kiva lenders in order to purchase additional sewing machines to increase their capacity. With this loan, Berwa will sew other attractive clothing styles for sale as well as additional sizes and colors. Through the use of this loan, this group hopes to attract more customers to its business and hopefully earn more profit in the process. Any additional funds earned will go to support their families and loved ones.

loans.use: Sewing machines

loans.name: Leonor Julieta

texts.es:
La señorita Leonor vive en la Provincia de Misque a unas 4 horas de Cochabamba. La señorita Leonor es la segunda hija de su familia, ella trabaja con sus padres y su hermano mayor en la confección de ropa.

Hace poco tiempo que murió su madre, quedándose prácticamente sola, y luchando con una enfermedad de la piel que no la deja descansar. El hermano mayor es casado y tiene ya su familia, ella sigue soltera y hace un tiempo atrás monto su taller de costura. Entre sus planes a futuro está en aumentar su patrimonio y tener una empresa  grande.

El crédito le ayudara a comprar más tela para la confección de ropa y así producir más prendas de vestir, tal como era el sueño de su mama. En especial en esta época cuando la venta de sus prendas de vestir sube considerablemente.
texts.en:
Leonor lives in the province of Misque, some 4 hours from Cochabamba. She is the second daughter in her family; she works with her parents and her older brother in the production of clothing. It's been a short time since the death of her mother, leaving her virtually alone, and struggling with a skin disease that does not let her rest. The older brother is married and has his family; she is still single and a short time ago set up her clothing workshop. Among her future plans are to increase her wealth and to have a large company. This loan will help her to buy more fabric for the production of clothing and thus produce more garments, as was the dream of her mother, especially at this time of year when the sale of garments increases considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric for the production of garments

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
En el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega en el bello país de Nicaragua, la señora Juana N. a sus 79 años de edad ha logrado ser una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada ya que toda la vida ha llevado el sustento a su hogar y se ha destacado por ser muy dedicada en el trabajo ya que a diario ella está trabajando.
Su negocio de venta de ropa actualmente requiere de inversión y por este motivo solicita un crédito para la compra de la ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños y así comercializarla y obtener sus respectivas ganancias. Ella se ha destacado porque tiene varios clientes y son sus sueños continuar desarrollándose en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the central market of Chinandega department in the beautiful country of Nicaragua, señora Juana N., in her 79th year, has become a very hard working woman, since all of her life she has taken care of the maintenance of her home and has excelled at being dedicated at her work, since she does it every day. Her clothing sales business required an investment and for this motive she is seeking a loan for the purchase of clothes for women, men and children, to sell them and obtain the respective earnings. She has achieved this because she has many clients and it is her dream to continue developing the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Esta señora trabaja por sí sola, el negocio de esta venta de atoles,(Atolillo, Arroz de leche, requesón, Sopa Borracha, Mango en miel, Manuelitas), ella trabaja con nuestra institución desde el año 2004, ha obtenido la cantidad de diecinueve créditos, cabe señalara que no todos han sido directamente para el negocio, otros crédito los ha utilizados para el mejoramiento de su vivienda, es madre soltera, con dos hijos, los cuales son menores, a quienes tiene comprarles sus útiles escolares para mandarlos a la escuela.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Lucia works by herself. She sells a variety of porridges and snacks, such as “atolillo” (rice porridge with cinnamon), rice pudding, “requesón” (a type of cheese similar to ricotta), “sopa borracha” (a type of bread pudding made of sponge cake soaked in sherry and rum), mango with honey, and “Manuelitas” (a pancake or crepe stuffed with cinnamon, sugar, and cheese).

Ana Lucia has been working with CEPRODEL since 2004 and has taken advantage of nineteen previous loans. It should be noted that not all of them have been used for her business. Some have been used to make improvements to her home. She is a single mother with two dependent children. Before she can send them to school, she must purchase their school supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her food business & school supplies for her children

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk Y. is 47 years old and she is married. She lives in Chambak Tuem village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Cham Roeun Keo, are farmers who own a plot of land for growing crops. They grow different kinds of fruit, which has allowed them to support their family. 

This season Mrs. Uk Y. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and a water pump, and to pay labor expenses for plowing. Aside from farming, they are recycle middlemen whereby they can earn a small income. 

The couple has seven children, three of whom are laborers, and the other four are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, pesticide, a water pump, and to pay labor expenses

loans.name: Adalgiza Maria

texts.es:
Adalgiza María Márquez G.,  tiene 35 años  de edad vive en Cundinamarca con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 5 y 13 años;  se dedica a la venta de víveres,  ranchos y bebidas y todo lo necesario para que las amas de casa se acerquen y realicen las compras de su canasta familiar, pues en ese sector hay muchos conjuntos residenciales, lo que hace más fácil la rotación de la mercancía que ella vende.
Desde hace   un año inició su negocio con la ayuda de un familiar y gradualmente ha crecido, pero no tiene muchas veces efectivo disponible para acceder a las ofertas con descuentos que hacen los depósitos y que como aumentan tan rápido los artículos y sus productos rotan rápidamente no tiene existencia en deposito que soporte el aumento de los precios. Es por esto que acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para   hacer su primer crédito por valor de $ 1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de artículos como refrescos, lácteos, dulcería y mecatos con esta inyección de capital de trabajo, busca incrementar sus ingresos y sueña mas adelante con que  su negocio se amplíe cada vez mas  y es que la capacidad de trabajo y disciplina de Adalgiza, hace posible que  algún día un llegue a tener un autoservicio.
texts.en:
Adalgiza María Márquez G. is 35 years old and lives in Cundinamarca with her husband and two children, ages 5 and 13. She sells provisions, food, beverages, and all the necessities that housewives look for when they come by to shop. Since her business is located in a highly populated residential sector, she has an easier time of turning over the merchandise that she sells.

Adalgiza started her business one year ago with the help of her family. It has gradually increased, but often there is not enough money to take advantage of discounted deals. Her products sell rapidly but there is not enough capital to restock because of the increase in prices. For this reason, she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to access her first loan in the amount of 1,500,000 COP to purchase soft drinks, dairy products, sweets, and snacks. With this infusion of operating capital, she hopes to increase her earnings and fulfill her dream of succeeding in her business. Adalgiza continues to grow each day and becomes more disciplined in her capacity to work. One day she hopes to open a self-service store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, dairy products, sweets, and snacks

loans.name: Silver

texts.es:
Silver es un joven con muchos objetivos y proyectos en mente, tiene 23 años, es soltero y vive con sus hermanos menores en su nueva casa que acaba de construir con madera y calaminas.

Como ejemplos de superación tiene a sus padres, quienes lo apoyan en cada proyecto que emprende y le enseñaron diferentes oficios que hoy en día practica. Silver se considera “mil oficios” al desempeñarse como agricultor, albañil, carpintero y hotelero desde hace 7 años.
De todas estas actividades, actualmente cuida de su vivero de café y de F. “cresta de gallo”, muy solicitadas en la zona, y paralelamente atiende su negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, ambas labores le dejan ganancias considerables que le permite vivir sin preocupaciones e incluso puede facilitarle ayuda económica a sus hermanos y progenitores.
Dentro de sus planes futuros desea estudiar una carrera profesional acorde a sus actividades, también piensa comprar terrenos para continuar investigando qué frutos de la sierra pueden desarrollarse en la selva con cuidados adecuados.  

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está seguro que no defraudará a su banco comunal, quienes pusieron su confianza en él, por eso señala que invertirá bien el dinero. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita contratará personas que le ayuden a plantar nuevas plantas de café y F..
texts.en:
Silver is a young man with many goals and projects in mind. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with his younger siblings in their new house that he just built, which is made of wood and corrugated roof panels.

His parents are examples of self-improvement, and they support each project that he undertakes. They showed him different trades, which he now puts to use. Silver considers himself a "jack-of-all-trades" since he has been a farmer, bricklayer, carpenter, and a hotel-keeper for 7 years.

Out of all his occupations, he is currently looking after his plant nursery called "Cresta de Gallo" (Rooster's Comb) in which he grows coffee trees and flowers. His products are very sought-after in the area. He is also attending to his room rental business. Both jobs yield considerable profits that let him live without worry. He can even help out both his siblings and parents financially.

His future plan is to pursue a professional degree related to his trades. He is also planning to purchase plots of land so that he can continue investigating which mountain fruits can grow in the jungle with the proper care.

This is Silver's first loan with MFP. He is sure that he will not let his Communal Bank down, since they have put their trust in him. For this reason, he states that he will invest the money well. With the 1,000.00 PEN that he is requesting, he will hire people to help him plant coffee and flower seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire farm workers

loans.name: Faafiu

texts.en:
Faafiu Ah P. is 42 and married with 4 children (ages 4 - 10).  She owns a business venture, selling food products in the local community.  Faafiu has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faafiu needs a loan of WST $1700 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faafiu joined SPBD.This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faafiu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zeb Un Nisa's Group

texts.en:
Zeb un nisa baji is 46 years old. She is a widow and lives in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, which is famous for its historical places and its Punjabi foods.  She has three children: two daughters and one son. Her daughters helps her with her business. Her son works in a factory on a monthly wage.

Zeb became a seamstress after the death of her husband, and now has five years of experience. She not only sews clothes, but also prepares embroidered dresses. She is a regular client of Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. Zeb has successfully repaid her four previous loans to Asasah, and now she is applying for a fifth loan to purchase items (beads, colored thread and clothes) in bulk to expand her embroidery business.

loans.use: to purchase items for her embroidery business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina P., 47 years-old, is a married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and food vending businesses. She lives in Barangay Culipapa Hinobaan, Negros Occidental with her husband Morillo and their 6 children (14 to 27 years of age). One child is married already and has 2 children.

Avelina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Avelina is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can continue her general store and food vending businesses. This will be her 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Avelina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene 36 años  de edad es madre soltera de una niña de 9 años, ella vive en Alba Rancho en la zona rural de la ciudad de Cochabamba al sudeste, vive junto con sus padres y sus hermanos, ella se dedica a la producción de leche al modulo de la zona todos los días.

Sonia es la hermana mayor y por esa razón es responsable de la familia porque sus padres son mayores, hace como cinco meses atrás su madre sufrió un accidente se cayó al salir de su casa en un canal de riego el cual no sentía ningún dolor pero después de un mes empezó a sentir que no podía caminar le dolía la cadera y entonces la operaron Sonia pago todo el tratamiento la operación de su madre ella está en recuperación ya empezó a caminar a volver a realizar sus actividades de esa manera para pagar la operación Sonia tuvo que vender cuatro vacas ella dice que lo más importante es su madre y verla sana es una alegría única para toda la familia a ella no le importa empezar otra vez desde abajo.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya aumentar la producción de leche ya que ahora tiene solo cinco vacas con las cuales ella quiere seguir saliendo adelante porque necesita trabajar para sacar adelante a su hija porque ella quiere que sus hija pueda terminar el colegio y poder hacer una carrera ya que Sonia no pudo terminar la escuela porque desde muy niña trabajaba con sus padres en el campo en la agricultura y en la producción de leche, ella es muy trabajadora y responsable.
texts.en:
36-year old Sonia is a single mother with a 9-year old daughter. She lives in Alba Rancho in a rural area south-east of Cochabamba with her parents and siblings. Her job is producing milk for the local processing plant. As the oldest daughter, she is responsible for her elderly parents. About five months ago her mother had an accident; she fell into a ditch after leaving the house. At the time she didn’t have any pain but a month later she couldn’t walk because of the pain in her hip. Sonia paid for the operation and subsequent treatment. Her mother is recovering and has already begun to walk again and take up her daily activities. To pay for the operation Sonia had to sell four cows, but she says the most important thing is her mother and to see her healthy brings her and the rest of the family much happiness. She doesn’t mind having to start over again. She is asking for a loan to buy soybean husks to increase milk production in her cows. She only has five now and has to work hard to make ends meet and support her daughter whom she wants to finish school and get a good job. Sonia didn’t finish school as she had to work in the fields with her parents and help them with the cows. She is very hardworking and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows

loans.name: Norma Doris

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Norma;  ella tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 12 años de edad, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el turismo, Nuestra socia es de profesión guía de turismo, la socia con todos sus ahorros a puesto una casa hospedaje, La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su casa hospedaje.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our community bank member belongs to the community bank "Renovacion." She lives in the San Jeronimo district in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Norma. She is 44 years old, is married, and has a son who is 12 years old. She alternates her household activities with tourism. By profession, she is a tourist guide. She used all her savings to set up a guesthouse. She is applying for this loan so that she can put it into operation. This community bank member appreciates and values the support offered through the loans and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a guest house

loans.name: Sigfrido Ernesto

texts.es: Sigfrido Ernesto D. T. es un joven de 20 años de edad, el cual es muy trabajador y el cual cuenta con grandes deseos de salir adelante y poder contar con una vida mejor. Vive junto a sus padres y un hermano mayor, con quienes reside en el departamento de Sonsonate. Sigfrido posee una venta de chips, recargas de saldo para celulares de diferentes compañías, y así mismo tarjetas de recargas, el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación en donde vende con sus vecinos, amigos, familiares y personas que transitan la zona, su negocio es muy estable, por lo que desea seguir creciendo en el. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder comprar mayor cantidad de chips, recargas electrónicas y tarjetas de recarga para celulares, así mismo desea ampliar su negocio, iniciando uno nuevo en la casa de su abuela en el cual comercialice los mismo productos. Sigfrido es un joven muy emprendedor y lleno de deseos de superarse y de esta forma salir adelante y así contar con todos los medios para poseer una vida estable y un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Sigfrido Ernesto D. T. is a young 20-year old man, who is hard-working and has a great desire to get ahead and achieve a better life. He lives with his parents and older brother in the Department of Sonsonante. Sigfrido has a business selling cell phone chips, recharges and balances from different companies, and pre-paid phone cards. The business is located in his house, where he sells to neighbors, friends, and people who travel through the area. The business is very stable, which is why he would like to continue to grow it. For this reason, he requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of cell phone supplies. He would also like to make some improvements to his business, and start a new one in his grandmother’s house where he would sell the same types of items. Sigfrido is a very entrepreneurial youngster, with a great desire to succeed. He wants to get ahead so he can have all the means necessary for a stable life and bright prospects for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cell phone supplies.

loans.name: Nargis Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Nargis parveen has lived in Pakistan in a small city known as Chichawatni for more than fifteen years. Chichawatni is near Harappa, which is very famous for its ancient history. 

Nargis parveen has four children and all of them are studying in different classes. Her husband is a salesman and sells eatable items such as nimko, chips, and biscuits. She supports her husband by doing stitching works. She also sells bed sheets, which she purchases from Faisalabad and other big cities to sell in her own city. 

Her husband wants to purchase his products in bulk to sell and wants to expand his business. Nargis Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. She is hopeful that this will make her husband’s business more profitable and, as a result, she will gain more respect in her family.

loans.use: Purchase eatable items for reselling.

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province of Mongolia in their own ger-a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His family has been living in this place for six years. He started his business in 2006 with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT which has increased to 4,000,000 MNT since. The increased profits are due to his good business skills and good customer service. 

Batrentsen has cultivated very good relationships with both his customers and his suppliers. He believes that these relationships are the key to his success. He has worked hard to own a small clothing shop where he sells a variety of clothes. Batrentsen would like to expand his product offering and is therefore requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan. He will use the funds to import a greater number of products from Ereen, a border city of China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort Y. is a seamstress and also sells slippers at Takoradi.  Comfort has received senior high education.  She is married and has two children. Her husband is a technical officer. She helps her husband in the payment of school fee and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra cloth and other materials for her sewing. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a better shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy extra cloth and other materials for her sewing

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor María es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside en el distrito de San José, una zona que tiene a la pesca como principal actividad econímica. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la venta de pescado seco – salado. Ella adquiere con frecuencia pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región (a 45 minutos de la zona en donde vive), eventualmente lo compra también a los pescadores que desembarcan en su distrito. Ella procesa el pescado y lo vende en los diversos mercados de la región. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega que tiene instalada en su domicilio gracias a las ganancias que percibe de su negocio de venta de pescado.

Flor desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado, de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y sus ventas. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo. Con el dinero de este préstamo ella espera brindarle a su negocio el impulso que necesita para salir adelante.

Flor María es una mujer trabajadora y bastante emprendedora. Las ganancias que percibe de sus actividades las utiliza en colaborar con el sustento de los gastos económicos de su familia. Ella espera seguir creciendo como empresaria para asegurarle a los suyos un futuro establey próspero.
texts.en:
Flor María is a 34 year mother who lives in the San José district. The area’s main economic activity is fishing. It belongs to the Lambayeque province, which is over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She has been selling dried and salted fish for ten years. She gets fresh fish often at the regional fishing terminal (45 minutes from the area where she lives). Sometimes she also buys from the fishermen who disembark in her district. She processes the fish, and she sells it in different regional markets. She also has a small store in her house, thanks to the income she gets from her business of selling fish. She wishes to expand her business by purchasing more fish. That way she will be able to increase her production and her sales. In order to do this she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow her to reach her objective. She hopes that the loan will give her business the impulse it needs to get ahead. María is a hard-working and very enterprising woman. She uses the earnings that she gets from her activities to help with her family’s living expenses. She hopes to keep growing as a businesswoman in order to assure her loved ones of a stable and prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish to process and sell

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda S. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 28 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she plants and sells assorted crops. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately $70 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Alfreda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Alfreda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for corn production. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena R. is from the village of San Francisco, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Rowena is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a general store, primarily selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rowena is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. cooks banku and serves it with pepper sauce and fried fish at Abura. Agnes has a junior high level of education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a teacher. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as increased capital, hence expanding her business. She anticipates reinvesting the profit that will accrue from her business.

loans.use: As increased capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Tsetsegee

texts.en: Tsetsegee U. is a 57-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters and two grandchildren in a ger or a traditional Mongolian tent in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Tsetsegee has earned a living by making a variety of knitted and woven products in her home since 2005, when she bought the equipment needed to knit professionally. Her two daughters help her with her work. She produces all kind of clothes made from camel and yak wools. Currently, her business is expanding and she has applied for a loan to buy more equipment and tools. Tsegsegee is a hard-working and honest person and says, "I hope to continue running my business so that I can build houses for my two daughters." She is requesting a loan for 1,200,000 MNT  to buy the knitting machine she needs to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a knitting machine

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
L. Nghiêm Thị (20213020014) is a 48-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling herbs and spices in the local community.  L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, L. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous L. was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  L. is now requesting a new L. of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  This will be the fourth L. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


L. Nghiêm Thị (20213020014) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, L. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  L. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  L. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Suraiya Irshad Ali's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya I. A. is 34 years old and married to I. A. who is 35 years old. They have two sons and a daughter, all of whom are enrolled in local schools and getting an education. Suraiya lives in Lahore which is the second largest city in Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area known as Shalimar. She moved there after her marriage.

Suraiya helps support her family through sewing jobs. She has a good number of clients in her neighborhood and receives regular orders from them every month. I. A. has a business selling construction supplies to different construction companies. He has been in this business for over ten years and is well experienced in his field.

Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah to help her husband improve his construction supplies business. With the loan he will buy construction supplies in larger quantities so he will be able to serve more clients and increase his income.

Suraiya, too, is hopeful that a loan will help her husband improve his business and increase his profits. She is a regular loan client of Asasah; this is her third loan application. In previous loan periods she has maintained good credit and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Helenne

texts.en: Helenne is 25 years old. She is married and has two children, 1 and 5 years old. Her husband works as a photographer. Helenne has operated a business selling clothes for five years. She would like to get this loan to buy more clothes and she hopes to use the profit to buy a house instead of renting. She says that her business prospers because she has raised money to buy a plot of land and a camera. In the future, she would like to have 80% of the total business as profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Johana Rosalia

texts.es:
Johana de 29 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas) en donde empezó a vender en las escuelas papelería (En Ecuador se los llama “bazar”) y varios accesorio a los niños. 

Con los ingresos que fue obteniendo pudo comenzar con una vitrina y varios accesorios. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ahora tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su papelería y así darles un mejor futuro a sus cuatro hijos y su esposo que es operador de maquinas.   

Uno de sus objetivos es tener su negocio bien establecido y darles un futuro a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Johana is 29 years old and lives in the Fort of Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads and hills).  She started selling paper and other accessories to children in schools (in Ecuador they are called "bazaars").  

With the income she earned, she bought a display case and merchandise.  With effort and dedication, she now has a stationary store in the front part of her house where she sells drinks, stationary, and notebooks.  She works from 7:30am until 8:00pm every day.  

With this loan, she would like to purchase notebooks, drinks, and display cases for her stationary store.  She will be able to give a better future to her four children and her husband, who operates machinery.

One of her goals is to have a well established business and give her children a better future so they can be successful professionals.

loans.use: Purchase beverages, stationary and display cases for her stationary store

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 33 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un hijo dependiente, vive junto a su esposo en el sector 18 D. Febrero, una zona urbano – marginal D. la ciudad D. Lambayeque, conocida por sus atractivos turísticos y por tener un comercio que se ha venido expandiendo en los últimos años, actualmente es una D. las ciudades eje en el comercio D. la región, queda ubicada a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Ella adquiere su mercadería , principalmente productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes, en el mercado Moshoqueque (mercado mayorista D. la región) y luego la ofrece a sus clientes, como el negocio es una fuente importante D. ingresos familiares, Ana María trata D. mantenerlo ofreciendo un buen trato a sus clientes.

Su bodega ha ido creciendo y su demanda también se ha estado incrementando. Por ello Ana María desea ampliar su establecimiento con la compra D. abarrotes D. modo que pueda satisfacer la creciente demanda que su negocio viene experimentando, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ana María ya ha tenido un crédito financiado por el fondo Kiva a través D. Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad ella adquirió la mercadería que necesitaba para sacar adelante su negocio y debido a ello se encuentra contenta y bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella a través D. Kiva.
texts.en:
Ana María is 33 years old, married, and has one dependent child. She lives with her husband in the February 18th sector, a marginalized urban area of the city of Lambayeque which is known for its tourist attractions and for experiencing commercial growth the past few years. It is currently one of the business hubs of the region and located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Ana María sells basic necessities and groceries from a store established in her home. She acquires her merchandise, primarily consumer stables and grocery items, at the Moshoqueque Market (a wholesale market in the region) and then offers them to her customers. Her business is an important source of income for her family. Ana María tries to maintain her business by providing good service to her customers.

Her store is growing and demand is steadily increasing. For this reason Ana María wants to expand her store by purchasing groceries so that she can meet the growing demand that her business is experiencing. She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help her meet this goal.

Ana María has already received a Kiva loan from Edpyme Alternativa as part of its “Seed Capital” product. She used that opportunity to acquire merchandise needed for her business to succeed. Ana María is happy and extremely grateful to everyone who helped her through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Sandra Maribel

texts.es:
Sandra Maribel S. T., tiene 30 años de edad, reside en la Aldea Tasajeras junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8,5 y 1 años. Sandra es una persona muy simpatica y muy conocida por sus vecinos. Ella Tiene una pequeña pulpería que funciona en su domicilio, con un horario de atención de 6:00 am 9:00 pm. Su principal ventaja es que no hay otra pulpería en el Aldea y eso le hace que todos sus vecinos hagan sus compras en su pulpería. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar abarrotería para surtir su negocio de más y variados productos de la canasta basica. Su meta es tener un mercadito y que este le permita obtener mayores ganancias para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con el estudio porque ella desea que sean profesionales y también que su de vida mejore. Es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con puntualidad el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sandra Maribel S. T. is 30 years old and lives with her family in the town of Tasajeras. Her family is made up of her husband and three small children who are 8, 5, and 1 year old. Sandra is a very kind person who is well known by her neighbors. She has a small pulpería [grocery store] that she runs from her house from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm each day. Her main advantage is that there are no other pulperías in the town, and therefore all her neighbors come to her store to make their purchases. She needs this loan to buy groceries to stock her business with more products and with a greater variety of daily necessities. Her goal is to have a small market, as this would allow her to earn better profits so that she could continue supporting her children's studies. She hopes that they will be professionals and that their quality of life will improve. This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her repayments punctually.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en:
For the past 20 years, Sulton has worked in agriculture, raising livestock. He raises cattle which he cares for greatly.  Thanks to his herd, he can cover his household expenses. Sulton showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against  various diseases. For Sulton, it is very important to work  and raise his animals, so he is currently seeking a loan  to purchase additional cattle so that in future he can earn more money. We appreciate your support for Sulton’s projects.     

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, to epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor Leonardo vende y compra celulares y también es técnico en la reparación de los mismos; su esposa tiene un snack y se dedica a la venta de comida como ser almuerzos y platos variados. Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar una conservadora y una freidora, que necesita urgentemente para su snack. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para la manutención de su familia.

Vive  en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona de Faro Murillo de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sr. Leonardo buys and sells mobile phones and is also a technician who repairs these products. His wife manages a snack bar and sells food such as lunches and various dishes. The money from this loan will be used to purchase a refrigerator and a deep fryer because his wife needs these items immediately for her snack bar. This is the main source of income for supporting their family.

Leonardo lives in a rental home in the District of Faro Murillo in the city of El Alto. He has one child. This is his first loan with IMPRO and with Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator & a deep fryer for his wife's snack business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James S. is from the village of Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 55 years old. James is married and has one grown child. 

To make a living, James owns and operates a tricycle transport service. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, James joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. James has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the fourth loan taken out by James from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rajae

texts.ar: رجاء في عمر 37 سنة عزباء تعمل في بيع الألبسة الولادية والبيجامات لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عملها وتسعى جاهدا الى تحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي لها حب كبير في عملها فهي دائمة التطور والتجديد تتميز بحب الناس لها في العمل ولها زبائن من ميحطها وجيرانها تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شرلاء ثياب موسمية + بيجامات
texts.en: Rajae is 37 years old and unmarried. She has been selling children's clothes and pajamas for 10 years. She loves her business and aspires to improve her financiA. and sociA. situation. She is passionate about what she does and is constantly seeking ways to improve and develop. Her customers range are her neighbours and the locA. community and they all love her. With this loan she wants to purchase up to date and seasonA. stock.

loans.use: to purchase in-season clothing stock to sell.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: María tiene 64 años D. edad, es casada y tiene un 1 hijo aun a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia y una prima en el distrito D. La Victoria, a unos veinte minutos D. Chiclayo, el capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. Su comunidad es urbana-marginal y cuenta con agua potable y energía eléctrica. María gana su vida vendiendo menestras cocidas. Ella prepara la comida en su casa y la venD. por kilos en el mercado local. Ella tiene más D. 20 años D. experiencia con este negocio. María desea aumentar su negocio con la compra D. más menestras, mote y frijoles en grandes cantidades. Esto le costará menos y será más rentable para su negocio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, María apoya a su esposo, el cual es carpintero, con los gastos familiares. Su mayor anhelo es seguir sacando adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old, married, and has 1 child still in her care.  She lives in her own home with her family and a cousin in La Victoria district, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

María's community is a small, poor, urban community which has access to drinking water and electricity.  María earns a living selling vegetable stew.  She prepares her food at home and sells it by the kilo in her local market.  María has more than 20 years experience in her business.  She would like to increase her business by purchasing more mixed vegetables, corn and beans in large quantities.  This will cost her less and will be more profitable for her business.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  María uses her income to support her husband, who is a carpenter, with their family expenses.  Her greatest wish is to continue getting her family ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for preparing her vegetable stew

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est né le 07 avril 2011. Il créé au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de GUINAW RAIL RAO qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 26 femmes qui sont du même village. Le groupe est également composé d'agricultrices, d'éleveuses et de commerçantes. Les membres sont unis par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d'amitié. 

Madame MAIMOUNA S. (debout tout à fait à droite de la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 26 ans. Elle est célibataire sans enfant. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de cartes de recharge téléphonique. Elle s'approvisionne auprès des représentants des opérateurs téléphoniques pour revendre dans son village. En sus, elle fait la cuisson et vente de beignets dans le village.

Son tout premier prêt avec CAURIE-MF lui permettra de mieux développer ses activité en achetant plus de cartes de recharge et des provisions pour la préparation de ses beignets.

Son objectif est d'assurer le payement de la location de sa maman à la capital (Dakar) tout en cherchant à avoir une épargne consistante dans le Banc Villageois
texts.en: The solidarity group BOKK XALAAT was established on April 7, 2011 on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of GUINAW RAIL RAO, which hosts the group. The group is composed of 26 women who are from the same village. The group is also composed of crop farmers, livestock farmers, and shopkeepers. The group members are united by ties of kinship, community, and friendship. Ms. MAIMOUNA S. (standing at the far right of the photo) is the group’s manager. She is 26 years old, unmarried, and without children. She has a small business involving rechargeable mobile phone cards. She gets her supplies from phone providerss in order to resell them in her village. On the side, she makes and sells beignets in the village. This loan, her very first one with CAURIE-MF, will enable her to develop her business further by buying more phone cards and some supplies for making beignets. Her goal is to make sure her mother’s rent is paid in the capital (Dakar) while trying to build substantial savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards for resale

loans.name: Cadena De Sueños Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "Cadena de Sueños, porque todas las señoras del grupo tienes sueños por realizar al adquirir este prestamo. el grupo se encuentra ubicado en Toluca en el estado de México. La señora Juana G. es una integrante del grupo, ella tiene 29 años, tiene dos dependientes economicos que son sus papás, la señora Juana se siente satisfecha con la oportunidad que le brindan de salir adelante y confiar en ella, ya que podra invertir en materia prima para su negocio de costura de peluches ya que tiene muchos pedidos pues a sus clientes les gusta como trabajo, los modelos que realiza para cualquier evento que haya y siempre entrega todo a tiempo. De esta manera ella quiere ayudar a su familia y principalmente a sus papás quienes siempre la apoyarón y piensa que es momento de devolverles todo el amor y esfuerzo que realizarón por ella, apoyandolos en los gastos que se presentan diariamente, piensa en el futuro poder adquirir un gran taller de costura y poder realizar mayores entregas de peluches.
texts.en: This lender group is called "Chain of Dreams", since access to credit is a dream all members share. This group hails from Toluca in the state of México.  Juana G. is a member who is 29 and supports her parents.  She is excited by the prospect of a loan, which she will invest in materials for making sewn toys such as dolls and stuffed animals, which are popular with customers.  She takes custom orders and always delivers on time.  In this way, she helps her parents and considers this a way to repay them for the years of care and hard work they gave her.  She hopes one day to expand her sewing operation and increase business capacity to produce many more toys.

loans.use: to buy materials to make toys, dolls and stuffed animals

loans.name: Arshiraph

texts.en:
Arshiraph, 38, is a Ugandan man who needs a loan to buy cows for his butcher shop and dry produce for a business that he has operated for 5 years. He hails from the Kyenjojo district, is a father of six, and lives in a semi-permanent house with six people that he takes care of. 

He dreams of acquiring land to set up a good tea garden, and of educating his children. 

He acquired his initial capital from growing bananas and savings from the sale of the same.

loans.use: To buy cows for his butcher shop and dry produce for resale

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
