Rosa, vive únicamente con su esposo, se dedica a atender una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad, existe desD. hace 20 años, lo heredo D. sus padres, y en la actualidad lo atienD. todos los días.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijol, huevos y mas, productos que son demandados a diario por los clientes, esta será una gran ayuda para los clientes ya que encontraran en su tienda, todo lo necesario para el hogar.
Su aspiración es trabajar por tener ingresos que le ayuden a vivir cómodamente con su esposo.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with just her husband.  Her business is serving in a store selling basic household products.  She has owned the store for 20 years and inherited it from her parents.  She currently works in the store every day.

Rosa is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, eggs and other products that her customers ask for daily.  This will be a great help for her customers as they will be able to find everything they need for their households in her store.

Rosa's aspiration is to work so that she can make enough profits for herself and her husband to live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans and eggs

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es: Ana Isabel D. treinta y dos años D. edad vive junto a sus hijos los cuales todavía asisten a la escuela. Ella posee una tienda con la sostiene el hogar, últimamente ha tenido más clientela pues se ha dado a conocer por su buen servicio, calidad D. los productos que ofrece y por los precios accesibles. Ana piensa que el éxito está en manos D. aquellos que tienen el coraje D. soñar y D. correr el riesgo D. vivir sus sueños; y su sueño es ver crecer su negocio para darle una vida mejor a su familia es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos para surtir su tienda como granos básicos, aceite, pan, bebidas, golosinas, papel entre otros. D. esta forma lograra mantener su clientela y atraer a nueva y al mismo tiempo tiene fe que mantendrá la una seguridad económica en su hogar.
texts.en: Ana Isabel is 32 and lives together with her school age children. She runs a small store which provides for her family.  Recently, her customer base has increased as a result of her great service, good product quality and affordable prices. Ana believes that success follows taking concrete action to achieve dreams; in order to grow her business and become more profitable, she seeks this credit from INTEGRAL to buy basic items such as bread, oil, soft drinks, sweets and paper. In this way she can maintain and expand her clientele as well as secure economic well-being for her household.

loans.use: to buy staples such as bread, oil, soft drinks, sweets, paper

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is a hardworking man. For 2 years Suhrob has been running his business of transportation services. He transports people in his local city. Suhrob works hard in order to make a good profit and keep his family in good living conditions. He would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS for purchasing a new car in order to provide his clients with a comfortable and convenient ride.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Nuevas Emprendedoras esta ubicado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, esta conformado por 22 miembros. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo. Son señoras muy organizadas y trabajadoras.
ellas se definen como mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por ofrecer a sus familias un porvenir distinto al que ellas tuvieron que pasar. Están encaminadas hacia un fin común, donde la cooperación y solidaridad van primero.
La Sra. Maria, es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles, como ser empanadas, sopa paraguaya, croquetas y demás. Ella manifiesta que todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para poder preparar los alimentos que va a vender. Dice que tiene mucha demanda ya que sus comidas gustan mucho.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de carne, jamón, queso, pollo, especias y demás insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus alimentos.
texts.en: The committee “Nuevas Emprendedores” or “New Entrepreneurs” is located in the city of Caaguazú, and is comprised of 22 members.  They are now in their fourth loan cycle.  They are very organized and hard-working women.  The women define themselves as female heads of household who fight to offer their families a different future than they themselves had to go through.  They are working towards a common end, where cooperation and solidarity come first. María, the group’s president, sells food products like empanadas, sopa paraguaya, croquetas, and more.  Every day she gets up very early to prepare the food she will sell.  She says she has a lot of demand since everyone likes her food.  She requests the loan to buy meat, ham, cheese, chicken, spices and other necessary ingredients to make her foods.

loans.use: Buy meat, ham, chicken, spices, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Panfila Navarro Group

texts.en:
Panfila is 61 years old and lives in Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Panfila has a business selling snacks such as hotcakes, doughnuts, etc. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Panfila has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to to fully pay for her motorcycle which is used for delivery in her snacks business and when they purchase flour, oil, etc.

Panfila has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she would like to have professionally-qualified children to help her when she and her husband become old.

Panfila is the leader of a 2-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To fully pay for her motorcycle which is used for delivery in her snacks business and when they purchase flour, oil, etc.

location.town: Liloy-Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina de 30 años de edad, convive con jose de 33 años con quien tiene 2 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Josefina, recuerda aquellas tardes de su juventud en las que observaba a sus padres en como se debe cultivar un terreno agrícola, y de ahí en adelante se dedicó a esta actividad. Actualmente cultiva cacao, en ella aplica todas las técnicas que sus padres le enseñaron y con el apoyo de sus  hijos y el de su esposo cada temporada obtiene mejores cosechas. En el futuro ella tiene pensado abrir una tienda de abarrotes ya que por el barrio donde vive no una, y eso le daría mucha ventaja si emprende en este nuevo negocio. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que josefina reitera su compromiso en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles que solicita, contratará peones para que le ayuden a quitar la maleza entre sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Josefina is 30 years old and lives with Jose, age 33. They have two children. Josefina and her family live in their own home in the District of Pichari. She remembers the afternoons in her youth when she watched her parents cultivate their farm land. Now she engages in the same activity. Josefina currently grows cacao and utilizes all of the techniques she learned from her parents. With the help from her children and husband, she is able to obtain a better harvest each season. In the future, Josefina plans to open a grocery store because her neighborhood does not have one. Starting this new business will give her a great advantage.

This is her second loan with MFP. Josefina recommits to being prompt with her payments. The loan of 2000 PEN that she requested will be used to hire workers to help with removing weeds from her cacao fields.

loans.use: to hire workers for removing weeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Veronica has a retail shop that sells canned goods, breads & biscuits. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock to sell.
Veronica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jelagat

texts.en:
Jelagat is 27 years old, married to Enock. She supports a family of four people. She operates a retail shop and has been in this business for a period of two years. She earns a monthly income of KES.7000.

She has applied for a loan of  KES.20,000 from KADET LTD and plans to use the loan to add more stock for sale at the shop like sugar, soft drinks, and washing detergents. 


She plans to use the anticipated profit to purchase more stock and improve the business, buy more sheep for rearing, and a plot of land. This is her first loan with KADET LTD. Her dreams for her future business are to expand and to have a wholesale business to help her family.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more stock for sale

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн проживает в городе Душанбе. Он женат. Ему 37 лет. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу. Хусейн арендует помещение, где открыл ателье. Он в основном занимается шитьем костюмов. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 10 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей и ниток.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 37 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Huseyn provides a service.  He leases a space, where he opened a studio.  He primarily sews suits.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Huseyn is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics and threads.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads

loans.name: Kenou Honore

texts.fr:
Kenou est un homme âgé de 37 ans, il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants.
Kenou est un revendeur depuis 1998, il achète et revend pour ses clients des pneus il emploie une personne dans son activité et  s’approvisionne au marché local du port autonome de Lomé.
Il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des pneus.
texts.en: Kenou is a 37 year old married man and father of two children. Since 1998 he has worked as a re-seller of tires, with one employee. He stocks up at the local market of the Port of Lomé, Togo. He is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase more stock of tires.

loans.use: purchase tires

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 48, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ordialyn, a jeepney driver, and is a mother to their two children. Both children already have their own families. She, together with her husband, is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Avelina oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which pays boundary (daily quota) each day. Aside from this she also manages a small variety store in her place. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 800 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new accessories and spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Avelina hopes to add another Jeepney unit someday and hopes for a better future for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

-Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 32-year-old young woman, and she is married with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Areej wants her family to live in better living conditions, so she wants to purchase new home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for her children, dining room furniture,etc., but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. When Areej gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture which is necessary for home living. This will enable her to provide better living conditions for her family. Areej is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in the FATEN branch.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Wilmer Jose

texts.es: Wilmer José se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Inicio este negocio con sus hermanos, fue con el paso del tiempo que cada uno logro independizarse y Wilmer obtuvo la experiencia para establecer su propio negocio. El motivo del crédito que solicita es para la compra de ropa en general, cosméticos, calzado, ropa interior, sabanas, cuadros entre otros. Sueña con lograr comprar una finca.
texts.en: Wilmer José sells general merchandise. He has been doing this for 8 years. He started the business with his brothers and with the passage of time each brother gained independence and Wilmer had the experience to establish his own business. The reason for asking for the loan is to buy clothes in general, cosmetics, footwear, underwear, sheets, frames and other things. He dreams of buying his own farm.

loans.use: to buy clothes in general, cosmetics, footwear, underwear, sheets, frames and other things.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 41 years old. She is married to Stanley who is a businessman. She has been running a hotel for the past three years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her fifth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Monica will use the loan to buy wheat flour, rice and sugar for her hotel. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, rice and sugar for her hotel.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Khary est âgée  de 29 ans . Elle vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue depuis un an dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente de tissus.  Elle a travaillé pendant des  années pour le compte de sa tante. Actuellement son vœu est de faire ses propres affaires pour pouvoir mieux bénéficier des fruits de son travail. Elle est sociétaire d’un guichet  de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour honorer une commande que ses fournisseurs  lui avaient livré et qui sont destinés a la vente. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses gains financiers.
texts.en: Khary is 29 years old. She lives in Senegal. She has been involved in business the for the past year selling fabric. She has worked for many years for her aunt.  Now she is hoping to have her own business to better benefit from the fruits of her labor.   She is a member of her local UIMCEC branch.  She is requesting a loan of  200,000 XOF to pay for an order made with her suppliers.  The order has been delivered and is ready to be sold.  Her goal is to increase her profits.

loans.use: to pay for an order of fabric for resale

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз замужем и любящая мать четверых детей. Она занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. Дилафруз хочет создать уют и все условия в своем доме и для этого работает усердно. Она хотела бы получить займ в размере 1000 Сомони для покупки двух голов овец. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна вам за вашу доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Dilafruz is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She raises livestock and grows agricultural products.  She would like to expand her business and earn a good profit.  Dilafruz would like to create comfort and a good environment in her home and works diligently for this.  She would like to receive a loan of 1000 Somoni for the purchase of two sheep.  She hopes for your help and is grateful to you in advance for your kindness and help.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
Doña Laura tiene 59 años de edad, desde hace un año y medio se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitacion y gracias a este ha podido sostener a su familia; ya que es madre soltera de cuatro hijos.  

Laura inició vendiendo solo churros, galletas, pan y refrescos pero luego de un tiempo decidió solicitar un prestamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas productos y fue asi como poco a poco fue instalando lo que es ahora su pequeña pulperia.

Ella está solicitando este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas y variados productos de abarroteria como ser arroz, frijoles, condimentos, pollo, carnes, lacteos, embutidos, pan, refrescos, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Laura podrá vender más y sus ganancias seran mejores. 

El mayor deseo de Laura es aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma mejorar la economía de su hogar y llegar a tener un supermercado. Este es su primer préstamo en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Laura is 59 years old, and she has been engaged in running a general store for a hour and a half. Her shop is located in her house and thanks to this activity she has been able to provide for her family, as she is a single mother of four children.

Laura started by selling churros (long fritters made with flour and water), biscuits, brad and drinks only, but after some time she decided to ask for a loan to invest it in the purchase of more products, and so little by little she succeeded in establishing what is now her small corner shop.

She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of more general products of different kinds such as rice, beans, dressing, chicken, meat, dairy products, sausages, bread and drinks among others. Thanks to the support from this loan Laura will be able to sell more and her income will improve.

Laura’s biggest wishes are to increase her sales and to consequently improve the economy of her household, and to succeed in running a supermarket. This is her first loan with FAMA and she hopes to punctually repay her dues.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, dressing, chicken, meat, dairy products, sausages, bread and drinks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 52 years old married to Lucy. They are blessed with two children. He has been running a clothing retail shop for the past ten years with a monthly income of Kes 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Peter will use the loan to buy stock clothes and textiles. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a clothes wholesale shop which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar, rice, and maize flour for his shop.

loans.name: Dionicia Yesenia

texts.es:
Dionisia, vive con su familia, con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella administra un comedor el cual comenzó por iniciativa propia por la necesidad de tener ingresos, este negocio lo tiene en el mercado municipal, su horario es de 11:00am a 2:00pm, en este horario realiza la venta de comida, ella ya posee experiencia en esta actividad.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para hacer comida como carnes de pollo y res, verduras, aceite, condimentos, algunos utensilios de cocina como ollas, cucharas,  para el cocimiento de los alimentos; Este préstamo le permitirá mejorar su negocio, con nuevas herramientas para que el sabor de las comidas sea mejor.
La aspiración de Dionisia es tener un negocio  estable, más capaz para atender a los clientes y con mayor estabilidad económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Dionisia lives with her family, with her husband and three children.  She runs an eatery that she started with her own initiative needing to have income.  The business is in the municipal market and her schedule is 11am to 2pm.  During this shift she sells food and she has experience in this line of work.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy supplies she needs to prepare the food like chicken, beef, vegetables, oil and condiments and a few kitchen utensils like pots and spoons to cook the food.  This loan will allow her to improve her business with new tools so that the flavor of the food will be better.

Dionisia’s hope is to have a stable business which is more capable of tending to customers and to have more economic stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, vegetables, oil and contiments.

loans.name: Hounsikpè's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Hounsikpè (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Hounsikpè est veuve et mère de deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et et tous à sa charge. Hounsikpè vit ensemble avec ses enfants . Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par Hounsikpè . Pour cette raison, Hounsikpè vend de la bouillie de maïs de façon ambulante depuis quinze ans environ. Hounsikpè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Hounsikpè ensemble avec les membres de son groupe sollicite pour la première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et du sucre.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est veuve, elle est agée de 47 ans et mère de quatre enfants. Elle fait le commerce de savons, draps (friperie) depuis 2001. Elle s’approvisionne 3 fois par mois au marché d’Hédzranawé. Avec ce crédit elle veut acheter 2 cartons d’omos, 2 cartons savons kado et 19 unités de draps. Avec les revenus de son activité Afi arrive à faire face aux charges des ses quatre enfants  et être indépendante.
texts.en:
Afi is 47 years old, widowed and the mother of four children. She has been selling soap and sheets (second-hand fabrics) since 2001.

She buys her supplies three times a month at the Hédzranawé market. She will use this loan to buy two boxes of Omo detergent, two boxes of Kado soap and 19 sets of sheets.

With her income, Afi will be able to provide for her four children and be independent.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of Omo detergent, two boxes of Kado soap and 19 sets of sheets.

loans.name: Abahujubumwe Cb Sub Grp A Group

texts.en: Leonille is a group leader, 35 years old. She is married with 6 children aged 7 and 22 years. They all attend schools. The group is called TWEGERANE which means “squeezed” in English. They sell different items and they wish to expand their business for the better future. Valentine is a farmer who sells food stuffs and has been doing in a business for the past 8 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more rice, beans and maize flour for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans and maize flour for sell

loans.name: Loyce Waithera

texts.en:
This business is a member of the Virtuous Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Loyce is a widow with 3 children and 5 dependants. She is a trained nursery school teacher. Through her training she has learnt to be disciplined and committed to her work. She is involved in church activities as a deacon and also the Chairlady of the womenâ€™s guild in the church.

Her preference of real estate (rental rooms) is because it does not take a lot of her time. She started her small project of 6 semi permanent rooms. From her rental income and loans she was able to put up 12 permanent rooms. She does not use her loans in any other way other than in her said project. To date she has 78 rental rooms. Her business has enabled her to bring up her family and also pay school fees for the five children who had previously dropped out of school for lack of school fees.

loans.use: If a loan of USD 700 is granted, she will put up 3 more permanent rooms since there is high demand of rental houses in Ongata Rongai.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.en:
Francisco is a married father of 3 children. For the past 30 years, he has dedicated himself to the autobody business. For many years he worked as an employee for a firm. However, about 12 years ago he decided to start his own business, since what he earned as an employee was not enough to meet the basic needs of his family. He runs the business out of his own home and works hard every day to grow and be able to offer his children the education they require.

He now hopes to receive a loan in the amount of $650 to purchase paint and materials for his work. You have the chance to help him — don’t hesitate any longer and support Francisco and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisco es casado y padre de 3 hijos, el se dedica desde hace 30 años a la hojalatería, pues durante muchos años trabajó como empleado para una empresa, sin embargo hace 12 años aproximadamente decidió iniciar su negocio, ya que lo que ganaba como empleado no le alcanzaba para satisfacer todas las necesidades básicas de su familia. El negocio lo tiene en su propio domicilio y trabaja arduamente cada día para poder crecer y poder brindar a sus hijos la educación que requieren.

El ahora tiene la esperanza de poder recibir un crédito por la cantidad e $ 650 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para comprar pintura y material que requiere para su trabajo. Tú tienes la posibilidad de ayudarlo, no lo dudes más y apoya a Francisco y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mr. Seang S. is 71 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his only daughter.  His wife recently passed away, so now he and his daughter rely heavily on each other for their livelihood.  Seang S. produces wine and earns about $5 per day.  He has been saving his money and plans to combine those savings with the loan to buy a hair salon for his daughter.  He feels that his daughter will succeed as a hair stylist and as he grows older she will be able to support him.  In the future, he plans on continuing to invest in his daughter's shop so that she will succeed.

loans.use: To purchase hair styling shop for his daughter

loans.name: Lydia

texts.es:
Lydia is a widow and has three children who are married. Seventeen years ago, she worked as an operator for an automotive business when her mother died and there was no one who could help her take care of her kids. She quit her job, but she did not have the support of her husband in providing for the children and their education. So she decided to start her own business selling footwear and cosmetics, and in this way she was able to keep her kids moving ahead. The high-quality service she gives her clients and her experience have helped her have many customers.

Lydia wants to thrust some new life into her business, and she's requesting a loan of $275, which she will use to purchase supplies necessary for her to have a bigger stock and cover the demands of her customers. She plans to repay the loan within three months. Her business is her only source of income. Lydia wants to improve her quality of life, and with your help it is possible. She's very grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lydia es viuda y tiene tres hijos que ya están casados. Hace 17 años, trabajaba como operaria para una empresa automotriz, pero al morir su madre y no tener a nadie que le ayudara a cuidar a sus hijos, abandonó su empleo, no tenía el apoyo de su esposo para el sostén y la educación de sus hijos por lo que inició su propio negocio con la venta de calzado y cosméticos, de esta manera pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos. El buen servicio que da a sus clientes y su experiencia en el negocio la ha ayudado a tener muchos clientes.

Lydia quiere darle un nuevo impulso a su negocio para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener un mayor surtido y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, ella desea mejorar su calidad de vida y gracias a ti será posible, Lydia agradece mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John Kadonge is married man, with seven children.
He has a business sellling menswear in a rented shop. Because of the high competition in this type of business, John is planning to increase his sales by using an outdoor selling strategy (selling at kiosks on the street). To do this, he needs to buy a second-hand mini truck to transport the clothes to the different kiosks. John has saved some money which he will add to a loan of  $1200  to purchase the truck. He plans to repay the loan in a period of 8 months

loans.use: Purchase of a truck

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a mother of five children, three of whom are of school age and two who are still toddlers. She has recently had to assume sole responsibility for her children's support due to the devastating loss of her husband. She started her business selling a few products from her doorstep and even though she didn't have any financial support , she has never given up or faltered.

She works every day from the early morning hours and struggles with the lack of reliable electricity that plagues her neighborhood. For that reason, she is in urgent need of purchasing a cooler where she can store her perishable products. She is asking to borrow $200 for this purpose, which will allow her to remain in business and help her continue supporting her family. She has committed to repaying the loan over a period of 6 months and is eternally grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Janeth es madre de 5 hijos, tres en edad escolar y dos de ellos aún son muy pequeños, hace poco tuvo que hacer frente a la carga familiar sola, debido a la irreparable pérdida de su esposo; el negocio lo inició por idea propia en la puerta de su casa con pocos productos. A pesar de que no contaba con un respaldo económico para crecer rápidamente nunca dió marcha atrás y ha ido trabajando todos los días desde muy temprano y combatiendo la carencia del fluido eléctrico en la zona donde vive.Es por eso que se encuentra en la necesidad urgente de comprar una caja térmica para tener los productos bien conservados para su venta. Necesita la suma de 200 dólares para seguir trabajando y luchando por la educación y bienestar de sus hijos, se compromete a devolver lo solicitado en un plazo de seis meses, quedando eternamente agradecida por el apoyo que le puedan brindar.

loans.use: To purchase a cooler

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad went in search of business opportunities to improve the economic situation of her family. She decided to dedicate herself to creating clothing woven by hand, a skill she learned when she was very young. She knows how to create all kinds of pieces by hand as well as by machine, having worked for a time in a factory. This served her well for her goal of acquiring a loom in order to produce her own designs. Her husband also contributes to their family with his work in agriculture.

Soledad has taught her family about team work and participation, so that she has the support and commitment of all the family members. Her businesses have had good results and Soledad's goal is to invest in a greater quantity and variety of wool to continue producing her work, as well as set up a small local shop. Let's help this enterprising family who with Soledad's help, continues to improve their standard of living.

Soledad, va en búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio para mejorar la economía de su hogar, impulsada por el gran amor de madre que alberga en su corazón. Y en esa búsqueda decidió dedicarse a la elaboración de prendas de vestir tejidas a mano; oficio que viene desarrollando desde que tenía doce años de edad; hoy hecha toda una mujer valiente y esforzada ha logrado vivir de su desempeño en este oficio con la producción de chompas, gorros y chalinas, se ha desarrollado con tanto talento en la vida que aprendió no sólo a tejer a mano sino también a máquina y estuvo un tiempo trabajando en una fábrica. Esto le ha servido de experiencia para que a futuro anhele adquirir una máquina de tejer para producir sus propios diseños. Por otra parte la contribución de su esposo es a través de su desempeño en los trabajos agrícolas en los que también Soledad como buena compañera aporta. Ella se ha convertido en la protagonista principal para impulsar a su familia hacia el trabajo en equipo haciéndolos participes necesarios y muy importantes, de esta manera cada uno de los proyectos que desea realizar siempre tiene acogida y mucho compromiso de parte de sus miembros activos. Cada uno de los negocios que se emprendió teniendo a este equipo de por medio ha tenido excelentes resultados y ahora el reto personal de Soledad es invertir una suma de dinero en la compra de mayor variedad y cantidad de lana para seguir produciendo sus coloridas chompitas y también para implementar la pequeña tiendita familiar. Apoyemos a esta familia emprendedora que a través de Soledad sigue adelante.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE WOOL IN  GREATER VARIETY AND QUANTITY TO PRODUCE MORE CLOTHING, AS WELL AS SET UP A SMALL LOCAL SHOP.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
Sarah K. has 4 children and is a tailor, making uniforms and crafts such as necklaces. Sarah also has a business selling water in the trading center. She wants this loan to pay for stock to increase her business.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase supplies

loans.name: Khamidkul

texts.en:
Khamidkul is 34 years old and married with 4 children.

Khamidkul owns and farms a plot of land. Having been trained by his father how to work the land, Khamidkul is quite a successful farmer. He grows wheat and potatoes, as well as breeds cattle. This provides his family with an efficient source of funding and helps improve their standard of living.

Today Khamidkul needs to prepare his land. Therefore, he is requesting 1,000 Somoni (US$300) to purchase mineral fertilizer and potato seeds for planting. Khamidkul thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of mineral fertilizer and seeds of potato

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim K., 28, a widow with no children, sells porridge in front of a nearby school, typically earning around $3 a day.  She currently lives with her younger sister, who works in a garment factory. Mrs. K. wants to borrow $800 to expand her business by purchasing more plates, spoons, etc. in order to sell porridge in larger quantities.

loans.use: She hopes to use this loan to purchase plates, spoons, chairs, a  table, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in a new wagon.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca belongs to the “Mujeres Creativas” Communal Bank located at Jr Maya de Brito S/N in Callería, a town in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 34 years old and is the mother of five children. Her husband is a deliveryman.

With the first loan that Blanca received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in a business buying and selling fish. Now she has her own stand where she sells fish in the market. She gets up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her husband and children and then goes to her stand where she stays until she runs out of fish to sell.

With this loan of $300, which she plans to repay in four months, Blanca will buy 50 kilos of fish like sea bass, boquichicos, sardines and doncella.

Blanca is very happy. Her business is growing and her sales are increasing. All of the effort she is making is to give her children a good education and a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Blanca pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, ubicado en el Jr Maya de Brito S/N, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 5 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra y venta de pescados. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de pescados en el mercado, para lo cual se levanta a las 5 am, para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, luego se dirige a su puesto para vender sus pescados hasta la hora que termine su venta.. Con este préstamo de S/. 800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 50Kg de pescado como corvinas, boquichicos, sardinas, doncella. Blanca esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo sus ventas aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para darles una buena educación y futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel belongs to the Las Brisas Communal Bank, located at Jr. Serafin Filomeno 242 in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 25 years old and single, but her income is not sufficient to support herself so Ysabel borrowed her first loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles and invested in a small business selling chickens. Currently she is running her smally business selling chickens getting up at 3am to put her chickens out for sale from her home up to 12pm. Later she rests to prepare to work the next day. With this loan, which will be repaid within 4 months, she will purchase 70 new chickens to expand her business, increase her sales and profits. With every new day Isabel is becoming a woman who knows how to move ahead with a lot of hard work and dedication for her own well being.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señorita Ysabel pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Serafín Filomeno 242, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 25 años, es soltera, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no son los suficientes para mantenerse, es así que Ysabel con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en el negocio de venta de pollos. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de venta de pollos, para ello se levanta a las 3 am para poner en venta sus pollos en su casa hasta las 12 pm. luego descansa para prepararse para la faena del siguiente día. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 70 pollos para implementar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas y sus ganancias. Ysabel día a día se convierte en una mujer que sabe salir adelante en base a mucho trabajo y dedicación para su propio bienestar.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 26 years old, lives in Saida South, Lebanon, where he owns a hairdresser and barber shop. This is the second loan Ahmad is requesting from Al Majmoua. The first one, in the amount of $500, allowed him to do some decorating in his shop. This time, he needs another loan of $500 to complete the purchase of a second hand car.

loans.use: To complete the purchase of a second hand car.

loans.name: Huoy

texts.en: Mrs. Huoy V. lives in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She sells Khmer cheese (Prohok) which is processed from small fish and it is used to give a nice flavor to Khmer soup in the local market. Mrs. Huoy V. is a widow with two children who are both attending school. Because the price of land is going up fast, Mrs. Huoy V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land for speculation.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for speculation

loans.name: Khasanaga

texts.en: Khasanaga H. is a 59-year-old trader who has had a food store since 1983. He is married and has four children. He lives with his family in the southern village of Saatli region. He is an engineer, but in the region where he lives, it is impossible to find a job related to his profession, so Khasanaga`s main source of income is his food store. He would like to improve the conditions of the store, and for this purpose, he has applied for a 1200 USD loan.

loans.use: Improving conditions of store

loans.name: Martha Elvia

texts.es:
Martha Elvia es originaria de Cd. Solidaridad en Monterrey Nuevo León, ella se dedica a la venta de comésticos por catálogo. <

> Actualmente, solicita un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de tres meses con pagos semanales para realizar el pago de mercancía de venta por catálogo. <

> Martha Elvia es una persona que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, ella tiene 5 hijos pequeños, es una mujer separada de su esposo y ante la necesidad de atender a sus pequeños ,y también de apoyar en el gastos familiar ,optó por desarrollar una actividad que le permitiera contar con una fuenta de ingresos y al mismo tiempo tener la disponibilidad de horario para estar al pendiente de su familia. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyemos a Martha Elvia por ser una persona que ha demostrado salir adelante por si misma! <

>

loans.use: Realizar pago de mercancía para venta de catálogo.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin F. is a young man of 21. He is very enthusiastic and full of energy. His father helped him to start his shop, which sells food, four years ago. In the beginning Elvin simply assisted his father by procuring the merchandise, but once he was of age his father entrusted him with the entire business. It has proven to be quite successful, and the store carries a range of food products and sweets.

Elvin has decided to take out a loan in order to further expand the variety of foods he sells. For this purpose he applied for a loan of $1200. He is counting on your help.

loans.use: To expand the variety of foods for sale

loans.name: Lan

texts.vi: Chị Dương Thị Lan năm nay 46 tuổi. Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ chị Lan đi buôn bán phế liệu còn chồng chị đi đúc thuê thu nhập gia đình không ổn định đời sống khó khăn . Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương và vay vốn để gia đình đầu tư mở xưởng đúc tại nhà.  Đến nay gia đình có xưởng đúc đồng  với 3 Công nhân  cho thu nhập ổn định 3 triệu đồng/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9 triệu đồng để đầu tư mua nguyên liệu phục vụ cho xưởng đúc đồng của gia đình.
texts.en:
Ms. Doung Thi Lan is 46 yrs old. Before joining the fund, she sold scraps while her husband worked as a moulder; the family's income was not stable and they had a difficult life. In 2006, she joined the fund and borrowed money to open a metal casting factory at her home. Now her business has 3 employees and brings in 180 USD per month. For this next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase raw materials for her family's business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Okoye

texts.en: Okoye I. is 26 years old and single. He has a phone booth for making calls and he also sells rechargeable phone cards. He started this business in 2005. He needs the loan amount of $425 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. He says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase  more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.es: Cacilda  tiene 47 años, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos que son solteros e independientes y además la apoyan mucho. La actividad diaria que tiene esta madre trabajadora es la venta D. abarrotes, labor que lo viene realizando desD. hace un año en su casa. Lo que le gusta D. su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes y vecinos, y con una gran disposición para atenderlos con alegría, para que así regresen en otra oportunidad. Esta actividad le está dando muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas, y debido a que se encuentra ubicada en un buen lugar y zona muy transitada, tiene buena venta diariamente. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser puntual en sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita ampliará y ambientará mejor su negocio, para que se vea más atractivo, así será más cómodo para ella y para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cacilda is 47 years old, a widow who lives with her 3 single and independent children who also proviD. her with a good deal of support. This hard-working mother is involved in the daily sale of groceries, an enterprise she has been carrying out for over a year from her home. What she likes most about her work is to be in direct contact with her customers and neighbors, and she attends to them with enthusiasm to ensure they return as other needs arise. This work gives her much economic and personal satisfaction, and due to being in a good location and in a zone that is well-traveled, she has strong daily sales. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is committed to being punctual in making the payments. With the money requested, she will expand her business so that it is more attractive and comfortable, thus better serving her and her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisette Artiga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve store

loans.name: Begmurat

texts.en:
Begmurat D. is 30 years old. He is married with 3 children. Begmurat is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Begmurat has been in agro-business for more than 7 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-taking job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1200 USD which he has committed to repay within 11 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Begmurat appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs Suy C. , age 24, has been raising pigs from her home for eight years. She currently takes care of three children; all of them are still young.  She married to Sinoun, 29, who is a local rice farmer.They live together in Pursat Province. 

In the past, C.’s husband always hired a buffalo from a neighbor to plow his farmland and he now hopes to own a buffalo. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan to purchase a water buffalo to be used for her husband’s farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo for plowing

loans.name: Radjabi

texts.en:
A. Radjabi is 48 years old. She is married with three children. Radjabi sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses. She has been in this business already for 20 years. Radjabi has very good taste and she is ready to advise her customers which textiles to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has repeat customers.

Moreover Radjabi’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. All this allows her to keep her clientele and to make a good income. The income that she derives has allowed her to educate her dearest son to a high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for him, so he will be able to receive an adequate education.

Now Radjabi needs a loan of 800 USD for purchasing new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  new fabrics in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Phall

texts.en: Mrs. Phall S. is 32 years old and she lives in Seirey Douch village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she and her husband, Mr. Him Run, are fish sellers in the local market. In their business, they face an obstacle because they do not have their own motorbike to go to buy fish from the other people to resell; thus, they pay too much money for motor taxi to transport their goods. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Phall S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her business to be easier. She has a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to make her business easier.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 1 hijo, Vilma junto a su esposo son artesanos y realizan trabajos en telar como individuales, pisos, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de la ciudad.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana y urdiembre.
Los sueños de Vilma son construir su casa, e incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Alondras Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives with her common-law husband and her son. Vilma and her husband are artisans who both make weavings and sell them in the city market. Vilma needs a loan of 1500 soles that she will invest in wool and warp threads. Vilma dreams of building her own home and of increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wool

loans.name: Chijoke

texts.en: Chijoke is 30 years old and single. He has a shop where he sells plumbing materials, and is now requesting a loan of 100 000 NGN to purchase more plumbing materials to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plumbing materials to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 48-year-old local restaurant operator. Her husband is teacher in the community where they live. They are blessed with eight children. With income from her business, she has provided for five of her children to graduate from high school.

In her restaurant, she prepares and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain and eaten with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup.

Rebecca says that the price of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. It is her desire to give her children hope and a better future. She belongs to the village bank called God First.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan H. is 36-year-old. She is a family leader who has established a small family in the Province of Battambang, where they have lived for many years. She and her husband are rice farmers in the village. Yan H. has five school-aged children.

Yan H. orders fish in bulk on credit from her wholesale supplier and then sells the fish retail in the local market for a profit. She typically generates a profit of $5 each day, which she uses to meet her family's daily requirements.

Yan H. hopes to earn extra money by using the loan to purchase piglets to raise and to accumulate a large quantity of fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and fish

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G. is from Oroquieta City. She is 51 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business in the services sector providing waste management services. She buys & sells junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Mrs. Thy S. lives in Sare Kruor village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Nean Khim, is a laborer. This couple has six children, two of whom are laborers while three are attending the local school and the remaining one is too young to work or study. Although Mrs. Thy S.’s family members try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need and cannot support their living needs. Thus, Mrs. Thy S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motortaxi driver. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living with this loan. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to be motortaxi driver

loans.name: Bianita

texts.en:
Having many children in their family is a difficult thing to consider, says Bianita. She is sending all of her seven children to school for them to finish even a two-year course in college. She is hoping they will have better jobs.  

Bianita is engaged in a general-store business. With this, she was able to support the education of their children and their daily needs.  She is using all the best strategies and efforts in life that she knows in order to overcome all the trials in life.

To be able to help with her financial crisis, Bianita is now seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP10,000 as additional capital to make her business more progressive. The loan will be of great help to make her business grow and to enable her to gain more income.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a son and daughter, Maxim and Anna. Their family lives in Vasilyevka, Ukraine. Alexander owns a small enterprise selling groceries, cereal, noodles, etc. in the local market. He uses his small truck to transport wholesale groceries to his retail vending kiosk. His business is well known in the marketplace for reasonable and affordable prices and so attracts many customers. Alexander has been in the trade for twelve years and has learned a lot about making his business a profitable one. Presently, he has about 12,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory.

Alexander is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to increase his turnover capital. With this, he intends to generate additional income to be set aside for the education of his children, who will soon need to start thinking about college. As Alexander is an experienced businessman and a responsible father, we believe the current loan will benefit his small venture and assist his family.

loans.use: To increase his turnover capital

loans.name: Erkinjon

texts.en: S. Erkinjon is a 50-year-old farmer, married with four children. His wife is a housewife and this leaves him as sole breadwinner. Erkinjon has been farming for the last thirteen years growing potatoes on his piece of land. At the same time he raises cattle. He would like to adopt new farming technology to boost his agricultural yield. He needs to be able to meet the financial responsibility of educating his younger children who are all in school and to maintain his family but he lacks the capital. Erkinjon requests a 2,650 USD loan to be used for purchasing seeds and fertilizer for growing potatoes. He’ll also spend part of the loan on purchasing young cattle. He is very responsible and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ol O., age 30 and his wife. Soknhoem Um, age 31, live in a small village along national road number four approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. They have been married since 2003 and have one son and one daughter. 
 
Sam-ol has been renting a space of house to garment factory workers for 3 years. Because his house located near garment factory, it’s good for him to operate the business. His wife has been selling grocery for almost 2 years. 

Sa-ol needs to build more rooms to respond his customer’s needs so he is applying for his first loan of $1,200 to make the building.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeun P., age 43, (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Saren Cheum, age 26, were married in 1999 and have two sons. One of them studies in the local school but, unfortunately, the other one died. The family lives along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saroeun has been a traditional musician for two years while his wife has been selling fruit for four years. Saroeun is asking for his first loan of $500 to provide business capital for his wife to enable her to purchase fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To use as capital for his wife's business

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie G. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39-years old. Tessie is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, which sells a variety of different products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over two years.

In 2008, Tessie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan from HSPFI. Tessie is requesting a new loan of $250, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Tessie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en:
Adiya T. is 61 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt housing tent. His oldest son is a buddhist lama, his only daughter is a university student, and his youngest son attends a local secondary school. T. operates a clothes trading business in his town. He sells a variety of clothing items out of a shipping container located near the local goods market. 

T. started his clothing business in 1997 with the working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD). At first, he rented a small stand at the market where he conducted his business. He has been able to use his earnings to buy the shipping container. Today, his business operates at a stable level and he has a good reputation amongst both his customers and the supplier. His working capital now exceeds 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1400 USD). For the future, T. hopes to continue to expand his business and to increase his earnings. He says, "My wish is to educate my children and to expand my business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan to purchase clothes to sell.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Seoun

texts.en:
Seoun S., 37, is married with one school-aged child who is enrolled at a local high school. She resides in Batambong Province, Cambodia, with her husband and child.

To make a living, she sells a variety of soft drinks and cakes, earning an income of $5 a day. Her husband operates his motorbike everywhere in the town, earning an income of $5 a day to help cover the family expenses.

Seoun S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a machine to squeeze sugar cane to produce its juice for sale.

loans.use: buy a machine to squeeze sugar cane to produce its juice to sell

loans.name: Jerebell

texts.en:
Jerebell M. is a 34-year-old woman who dreams of having a long life in order to achieve her goal of meeting her “special someone”. Being single, Jerebell wishes that someday she will be able to meet a partner who will take care of her and will love her for the rest of her life. But for the meantime and while she is still searching she is preparing herself financially by growing her sari-sari store which means a small store that sells grocery items and other basic commodities.

The loans Jerebell has been accessing through ASHI help her business to grow and have enabled her to have savings and her own income to support the needs of her 80-year-old mother. Through loans she can obtain through ASHI, Jerebell envisions her business turning into a big grocery store wherein she can be a wholesaler to the small entrepreneurs like she is now.

loans.use: To purchase goods to increase her inventory

loans.name: Théodora

texts.fr: T. Théodora est née vers 1960 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Théodora vit au quartier Donatin à Cotonou, depuis une dizaine d’année. Mariée à AGBOZOGNIGBE Roger, Théodora est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais seulement deux des enfants vivent avec le couple à Donatin. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Théodora a été à l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis près de 10 ans, Théodora mène comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage et des produits vivriers à son domicile. Théodora s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Théodora est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits à ALIDé. Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés. Théodora sollicite un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer ses activités et de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
T. Théodora was born around 1960 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Théodora has been living in the Donatin district in Cotonou, for about 10 years. Married to AGBOZOGNIGBE Roger, Théodora is the mother of 5 children, all attending school. However, only two of the children live with the couple in Donatin. Théodora and her husband both work to support the family.

Théodora studied up to university level, but for about 10 years, she has been selling firewood and and foodstuffs out of her home. She buys her merchandise in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. Théodora has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has already received 5 loans from ALIDé. These loans have all been reimbursed in a timely manner. Théodora is requesting a 6th loan from ALIDé, with the goal of bolstering her businesses so that she can better respond to the great demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of truckloads of firewood

loans.name: Deida

texts.es:
Deida, es una socia nueva, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 44 años, es madre de tres hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la región, esta actividad la realiza en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la venta de madera. Deida forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Ucayali”.
Ella necesita un crédito de 200 soles, que será invertido en productos como arroz, aceite y otros productos que utiliza en la preparación de los platos típicos como el juane, patarashca y tacacho con cecina.	   
La meta de Deida es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Deida is a new member of the Communal Bank "Las Brisas del Ucayali" ["The Breezes from the Ucayali"]. She lives in the Callería district, Ucayali region. She is 44 years old and a mother of three, two of which are grown up. She sells typical food from the region from the sidewalk by her home. She has her husband's support, who sells wood. She needs a 200 PEN loan, which will be invested in the purchase of products like rice, oil, and other supplies she uses in the elaboration of typical dishes such as juane [rice, hen's meat, olives, boiled eggs and spices, which are enveloped in a leaf of bijao and boiled for around 90 minutes], patarashca [a whole fish, enveloped in bijao leaf and charcoal-grilled] and tacacho con cecina [a mass of roasted green banana, chorizo or jerky, oil, lard, salt and pepper, served with grilled jerky]. Deida's goal is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cooking supplies

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, D. 54 años, vive feliz junto a su esposo Norberto (62), su hija Carla (26), su yerno y sus nietos. Todos habitan en su pequeña casa propia, ubicada en un populoso distrito D. la ciudad D. Lima.

DesD. hace 12 años se dedica al tejido D. chompas en su máquina industrial, al principio lo hizo para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, pero en la actualidad este trabajo se ha convertido en el principal sustento D. la familia. Rosa trabaja para mayoristas y según los pedidos que le hacen, teje toda clase D. chompas D. lana y también D. hilo, D. acuerdo a la temporada y las venD. a buen precio, así obtiene buenas ganancias.
Por otro lado, el trabajo le gusta mucho porque es tranquilo y lo pueD. realizar en la comodidad D. su casa, además esta trabajadora mujer también venD. cerveza en su casa y con en este negocio también le va muy bien, ya que las bebidas tienen bastante acogida durante los fines D. semana. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado ampliar su negocio D. tejidos y empezar a vender ella misma y no a través D. intermediarios.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete una vez más a ser responsable y puntual en cada una D. sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchos proyectos en mente y tiene esperanzas D. hacerlos realidad. Tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra D. hilo para tejer mayor cantidad D. chompas. También quiere comprar ropa para empezar a vender, ya que tiene cantidad D. personas que le solicitan prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54 years old, lives happily with her husband Norberto (62), her daughter Carla (26), her son-in-law and her grandchildren. For 12 years she has worked making sweaters with her industrial machine. At first she did it to help her husband with household expenses, but now this work has become the main livelihood of the family. Rosa works for wholesalers and, according to the orders they give her, she makes all sorts of sweaters from wool and from linen, depending on the season. She sells them at a good price, thus obtaining good profits. On the other hand, she enjoys the work a lot, because it is peaceful and she can do it in the comfort of her own home. Furthermore, this hardworking woman also sells beer out of her house. She is doing really well with this business, as the drinks are well receiving during the weekends. For the future, she is thinking of expanding her knitting business and beginning to sell things herself and not through middlemen. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises once more to be responsible and punctual with each of her payments, since she has many projects in mind and has hopes of bringing them to fruition. She is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in the purchase of linen to knit a larger quantity of sweaters. She would also like to buy clothes in order to begin selling them, as there are already people who have been asking her for clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of textiles and clothing.

loans.name: Aïchetou

texts.en:
Aïchetou G. M. is 26 years old and a trained nurse. She works in the Agoé district of Lomé, Togo and is married with one child.

Mrs. M. runs a clinic and pharmacy called “Cabinet Médical Mawuli” which she began in 2008. She is able to serve a variety of patients in her immediate area.

Mrs. M. is now asking for her first loan from WAGES, which she will use to resupply her stock of medical supplies and pharmaceuticals. Please help Mrs. M. replenish her supply and better serve her patients.

loans.use: To purchase more pharmaceuticals and medical supplies

loans.name: Jesus Te Ama Jov Group

texts.es:
Asociaciones Comunales de Jòvenes es una forma de trabajo que desarrolló Pro Mujer hace unos años, para el apoyo a las iniciativas de autoempleo de los jòvenes, este crédito era para grupos de  cuatro o más jòvenes, que se comprometan junto a sus pdres a mantener la garantía solidaria .  Estos grupos pagan en forman conjunta con asociaciones de socias adultas que se convierten generalmente en mentoras de las y los jóvenes.
