La asociación comunal “Jesus Te Ama”, cuenta con  un grupo de Jóvenes que paga en forma paralela, esta compuesta por 2 mujeres y 2 varones. En la foto son los dos muchachos que tienen gorras y las dos jovencitas de chaqueta azul y chamarra blanca.

Omar C. Q. es el Presidente del Grupo de Jóvenes, tiene 18 años y ya tiene dos ciclos como socio.  Tiene el negocio de  carpintería y lo lleva adelante en sociedad con un amigo desde hace 5 años.  Actualmente elabora catres y veladores, pues son su especialidad.  Con su primer crédito de Bs. 1000.- recuerda haber comprado madera, ahora que su crédito es de Bs. 2000.-el esperar comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo: martillo, cepillo (de manera) y madera que es su materia prima.
Finalmente indica que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es compartir con el/las compañero/as de su grupo.
texts.en:
Asociaciones Comunales de Jovenes is a work model developed by Pro Mujer a few years ago in order to support initiatives for the self-employment of young people. This credit is meant for groups of 4 or more young people that promise, along with their parents, to solidify their guarantee. These groups pay all together, along with adult associations that generally become like mentors to these young men and women. The communal association, "Jesus Te Ama," is composed of a group of 2 girls and 2 boys, who follow this plan. In the photo, there are the two boys with caps and the two girls with a blue and a white jacket. Omar C. Q. is the president of the group of young people. He is 18 years old and has been a member for two loan cycles. He has a carpentry business that he has grown by partnering with his friend 5 years ago. Nowadays, he makes bed stands and bedside tables, which are his specialty. With his first loan of Bs1000 (he remembers having bought wood, now that his credit is Bs2000), he hopes to buy his own work tools: a hammer, a plane, and wood, his most important commodity. Finally, he states that what he likes most about Pro Mujer is spending time with the members of his group.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wood, hammer, plane, varnish

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor M. es un transportista de este municipio el cual con su camión se dedica a la compra y venta de sal donde la distribuye en los departamentos del sur y occidente de Nicaragua el cual con esfuerzo propio ha logrado salir adelante en su pequeño negocio  ya que con los créditos anteriores con nuestra institución   el logro comprar su camión y así dejar de alquilar ya que antes el tenia que alquilar un camión para poder comercializar el producto.
Este crédito lo solicita para realizarle una operación que necesita la esposa de Don Miguel ya que en este instante no tenia los recursos suficientes para pagar la operación.
texts.en:
El señor M. is a trucking contractor from this town. He buys and sells salt and hauls it to the southern and western departments of Nicaragua. From his efforts, his small business has been able to survive. With earlier loans from our institution, he was able to buy his truck and cease renting. Previously, he had to rent a truck to run his business. This requested loan is for surgery that Don Miguel's wife needs. At this time, he doesn't have money to pay for the operation.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of his wife's medical expenses

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 47, sells crab traps for fishing to earn a living. Her business helps a great deal towards sending her children to school. She wishes to for them to complete their studies soon. She has four children, her eldest is 20 years-old. 

She joined Kiva Partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to partner with her business. Currently she is requesting a loan of 25,000 to continually support her business. This is a big help for her to sustain her business and family.

loans.use: To support her business.

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan L. is from the village of Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old. Amihan is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Amihan owns & operates a  specialized retail store buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Amihan has been engaged in her business and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amihan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Amihan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Amihan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Belthilde

texts.en:
Belthilde is 32 years old, married with 6 children who are 3, 6, 8, 11, 13, and 15 years old.  Belthilde is widely known in the business of selling different styles of clothes as well as women's shoes.  Belthilde has been in this business for about 1 year and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day except Sunday.

Belthilde is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing some additional styles of clothes and shoes for sale to her customers.  With this additional business, Belthilde hopes that she will earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting and start saving for her future.

loans.use: The purchase of different styles of clothes as well as shoes for women

loans.name: Fousséna

texts.en:
Madame Fousséna B. is 29 years-old. She is married with three children. Her husband works as a courier for the press.

Fousséna has had her business since 2006. This is her first time taking a loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She has requested 300,000 CFA to purchase spices, canned tomatoes and other items for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase spices and canned tomatoes.

loans.name: Yeison Wisney

texts.es:
Yeison de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. tiene un hijo de dos años. Yeison después de casarse necesitaba mantener a su familia y tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en quintales de arroz y vendérselos a sus amigos. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación hizo de esta venta de arroz su principal ingreso para su familia. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 16h00pm hasta las 18h00pm de lunes a domingo. Cada quintal de arroz lo vende a $ 32.00. Por este trabajo tiene tiempo para pasar con su familia. Por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar quintales de arroz para tener mas ingresos.  

En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Yeison is 24 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called “Orquídeas” (“Orchids,” so named because many orchids used to grow there). He has a two-year-old son. After marrying, Yeison had to provide for his family and invested his savings in sacks of rice to sell to his friends. With hard work and dedication, he has made selling rice the primary source of income for his family. He currently works from 4:00pm to 6:00pm Mondays to Sunday, selling each sack of rice for $32.00. This work enables him to spend time with his family, so he is requesting a loan to buy more rice so he can increase his income. In the future, he would like to have a wholesale shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta Alicia G. de 58 años de edad, reside en Tacuba, ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad tanto alimenticios como para el hogar, Berta es una señora muy alegre y amable, quien debe esforzarse mucho por salir adelante y poder contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna, ya que ella vive sola y su negocio es la única fuente de ingresos con la que ella cuenta. Desde hace 30 años que ella posee la tienda en su casa de habitación, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona y a pesar de que tiene mucha competencia en los alrededores, siempre es preferida por las personas del lugar, ya que es de mucha confianza en toda la zona. Berta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todo lo necesario para surtir más su negocio, comprando granos básicos, detergentes, desinfectantes, pan, leche, huevos, productos lácteos y todo lo que es más necesario y que sus clientes solicitan más en la tienda, así mismo Berta desea poder incluir productos nuevos, los cuales a pesar que tienen poco tiempo de estar en el mercado poseen una gran demanda como golosinas y bebidas, las cuales le asegurarían aumentar sus ventas, lo cual es la prioridad principal de ella, ya que de esta manera podrá contar con una mejor estabilidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Berta Alicia G. is 58 years old. She lives in Tacuba, which is in the Ahuachapán department. She has a store where she sells basic needs products. She sells things like food and household products. Beta is a very happy and friendly woman. She puts forth a lot of effort to get ahead and to be able to have the necessities to live a decent life. She lives alone, and her business is her only source of income that she can count on. For 30 years she has had a store in her house. It is well known in the area. In spite of having a lot of competition around her, the people in her area always prefer her. She is very trusted in the whole area. Berta is requesting a loan to be able to buy everything she needs to better stock her business. She will buy basic grains, detergents, disinfectants, bread, milk, eggs, dairy products, and whatever else is most needed and most requested in the store. Berta also wishes to be able to include new products. Even though they have not been on the market long, there is a great demand for things like sweets and drinks. They will ensure an increase in her sales. That is her main priority. That way she will be able to count on better stability in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en: Shamim akhtar lives in a small city called Chichawatni where her husband sells fruit in the fruit market. She is the mother of five children: four sons and a daughter. Three of her sons work to support the family and the other two children are studying. She is also a working woman who sells ready-made baby clothes. Her husband also drives a rented rickshaw part-time.  Now he wants to buy his own rickshaw to work full time. His own rickshaw will minimize the cost of rent and he will be able to operate it without any time limitations. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy a rickshaw for him.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 36-year-old married man with four children. He sells food supplies, seeds, charcoal, fruits and groceries. He started this business 10 years ago. 

This is Hussein’s second loan cycle with Al Majmoua. He took a loan the first time in order to improve his income to cover his expenses, now he decided to apply for the second loan in order to buy necessary merchandise for his shop so that he can fulfill clients’ needs with a greater assortment of products. He and his family thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy necessary merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchase of auto replacement parts for his business.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Jose;  el tiene 53  años de edad y es soltero, el socio se dedica  a la producción de velas,   el socio elabora todo tipo de velas y tiene su tienda en la calle tambo de montero, el socio necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para la elaboración de velas al por mayor.  El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en  la compra de insumos para elaborar las velas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Jose, he is 53 years old and is single. Mr. Jose makes candles of all types and has his store in the Tambo de Montero street. Mr. Jose needs the loan to buy materials to make candles wholesale. The member needs the loan to buy materials to make the candles.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to buy materials to make the candles.

loans.name: Mobito

texts.en: Mobito N., who is the 50-year-old father of a 21-year-old, lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where he earns a living through rice farming. With the money from his requested loan, Mobito intends to buy fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. He plans to work hard on his farm so he can eventually include vegetables. From this loan, he  expects a good harvest and an increase in business profitability, with the additional income going to his family's daily living requirements and possibly some new business opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita G. is a 63 year-old widowed woman from Libertad, Antique. She is blessed to have two children.  A member of the San Roque center of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Antique North West Branch, Leonita is a very industrious woman determined to achieve a better life.  Despite hardships caused by poverty, Leonita remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her children makes her life quite meaningful.

To earn a living, Leonita raises hogs as a  business. She has been engaged in this business for almost six years. She joined ASHI, a microfinance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2004. During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent performer with respect to regular attendance at meetings, loan repayment, and projects. She is now seeking her sixth loan for the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory of hogs to raise.

With access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, Leonita is hopeful her dreams of giving her children a better future will be achieved and to have an expanded pig farm business someday. Leonita’s desire to offer her children a brighter future fuels her dedication to her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of hogs to raise.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia S. D. M. D. 71 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabajo comerciante D. productos varios, ambos viven en el departamento D. San Salvador. Tanto María como su esposo son dos personas muy trabajadoras quienes cuentan con el enorme deseo D. salir adelante. María es una señora muy alegre, la cual posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el centro D. San Salvador, un lugar muy transito por muchas personas y muy apto para todo tipo D. negocio. Una D. las mayores virtudes D. ella es la D. destacarse por ser muy emprendedora, ya que siempre esta en busca D. alguna actividad para poder obtener ganancias extras para su familia. Gloria solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para aumentar los productos D. su venta, y así contar con frutas D. temporada y más verduras, las cuales las personas solicitan más.
texts.en: María Antonia S. D. M. is 71 years old. She lives together with her husband who works selling various products. They both live in the San Salvador department. María, as with her husband, are 2 very hard-working people who have an enormous desire to improve their lives. María is a very vivacious woman who has a fruit and vegetable store which is located in the centre of San Salvador, a zone visited by many people and apt for this type of business. One of María's biggest virtues is that she stands out as a very entrepreneurial woman, as she is always on the look out for some type of activity to obtain extra earnings for her family. She is seeking a loan from Integral so she can have the necessary resources to increase her products to sell, and in this way have seasonal fruits and more vegetables, which is what her customers ask for more of.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn C. is 48 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a cosmetics business.  She lives in Brgy. La Paz, Bogo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her cosmetics business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 10,000. Jenelyn is requesting a loan of  PHP 15,000 so that she could  purchase more cosmetics to sell.  This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jenelyn aspires to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Jane Jepkorir

texts.en:
Jane Jepkorir C. is 31 years old and married to Barnabas Kemboi Maiyo who is a businessman. They have two children, age four and seven years old. They live in Kapsowar- Eldoret, Kenya.

Jane runs a cereal business and has been doing so for the last eight years. The business is doing well. She is applying for her second loan of Ksh.55,000 from Kadet Ltd to enable her buy ten bags of maize for sale. She was introduced to Kadet Ltd by a friend who is a client. Her cereal business is situated in a pre-urban setup. She has a lot of customers.

She hopes to have an established cereal store in the market. She also hopes to build a permanent house and ensure that her children get the best education.

loans.use: To buy ten bags of maize.

loans.name: Isabelita

texts.en:
Isabelita A. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Isabelita is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Isabelita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Isabelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Isabelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isabelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional bananas to  buy and sell. Isabelita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Isabelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Juana Ofelia

texts.es:
En la hermosa ciudad de Bahía De Caraquez, conocida por sus playas, por su rica gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente, cada quine días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 25 Rosas.

Para la señora Juana los años han pasado muy rápido aun recuerda cuando con algunas amigas decidieron unirse y formar el Banco Comunal, ahora después de tantos años se siente satisfecha por la ayuda que han recibido tanto ella como sus compañeras del grupo, se desempeña como secretaria del Banco, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 17 y 9 años los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela.
 
Ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo. Su forma de venta es  puerta a puerta o por encargo, tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos ya que les da facilidades de pago, ella cobra los fines de semana lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el día con la ayuda de una hermana. La mercadería  compra una vez al mes en Guayaquil ya que allá hay más variedad de productos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pantalones de damas y caballeros, camisetas, blusas y carteras ya que tiene algunos encargos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas y un almacén donde ampliar sus ventas con mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
In the beautiful city of Bahía De Caraquez, known for its beaches, rich food, and quality of people, the 25 Rosas (Roses) Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

For Juana, the years have passed very quickly although she still remembers when some friends decided to band together and form the communal bank. Now after so many years, she is satisfied by the help that she has received as well as by the help her fellow members have received. She acts as secretary for the bank, she is 41 years old, and she is a single mother of two children who are 17 and 9 years old and are in primary and secondary school.

She is a sales woman, selling all types of clothes. She sells door to door and by advance order. She has a lot of customers who order her products because she gives them payment options. She collects payments on weekends which is good because when she's collecting payments she can also make additional sales. She works almost all day on the weekends with her sister's help. She buys her merchandise once a month at the market in Guayaquil because there is more product variety there.

This loan will be used to buy men's and women's pants, shirts, blouses, and wallets because she already has several orders. Her dream is to buy a car that she can use to make sales in. She also wants a store where she can expand her sales to include a larger variety of products.

loans.use: Purchase women's and men's pants, shirts, blouses, and wallets

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Las señora Inés Romana  L. G., vive en Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada con el señor David  Sánchez Cruz, en donde tiene a su responsabilidad a tres hijos y el cuarto que esta por nacer y son: Laura Evangelina de nueve años, la otra es Claudia de ocho años y David de seis años.
Ella ha estado solicitando el préstamo para invertirlo en  la compra de ingredientes para elaborar tamales ya que hay cosas que le hace faltan y por falta de ingresos no lo puede comprar, pero hoy gracias al préstamo lo ha estado logrando.
Inés comenzó con esta actividad ya que su mamá la enseño y desde hace seis años lo viene practicando y le va bien ya que con ellos apoya a su esposo con los ingresos de su hogar.
Con las ganancias  que va obteniendo  compra más ingredientes para su actividad, así elaborarlo más días a la semana y vaya obteniendo mejor resulta con su negocio.
Su sueño es tener una casita más grande en donde pueda vivir con su familia cómodamente, así también tener siempre su actividad que es con la que se apoya para salir adelante.
En el grupo se unió ya que la señora Soraida la invitó a que solicitaran un préstamo del cual pudieran pagar y salir adelante. El grupo se llama el "Amanecer" la razón del nombre es porque la firma de contrato se planéo en la mañana.
Lo integrantes del grupo  son las siguientes:
*Brígida Pérez Estrada: invierte el préstamo en la crianza de pollos de rancho para venderlo en pie.
*Candelaria V. H.: invierte el préstamo en  la compra de productos agrícolas como el maíz.
*Inés Romana L. G.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingredientes para elaborar tamales.
*Soraida Pérez Pérez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de productos naturales, como también veladoras de colores.
texts.en:
Inés Romana L. G. lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas México.  She is married to David Sánchez Cruz.  They have three children (Laura Evangelina, 9, Claudia, 8, and David, 6) and a fourth about to be born. 

She has asked for this loan to purchase ingredients to make tamales since there are things she is missing and a lack of income prevents her from buying them.  Today, thanks to the loan, she is succeeding.

Inés learned how to make tamales from her mother.  Six years ago, she began her business and it is going well since her income helps her husband with the household expenses.  With her earnings, she buys more ingredients to make tamales so she can make them more days a week, and improve her business.  Her dream is to have a bigger house where her family can live comfortably and to always have her business which gives her support to succeed. 

This group was started when Soraida invited them to apply for a loan that they could pay and succeed.  The group is called "Amanecer" [Dawn], because they signed the contract in the morning.  

The members of the group are:

Brígida Pérez Estrada who will invest the loan in raising chickens to sell; Candelaria V. H., who will purchase agricultural products, like corn; Inés Romana L. G. who will purchase ingredients to make tamales; and Soraida Pérez Pérez who will purchase natural products and colored candles.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales, like meat, raisins, and corn flour

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a su hijos en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical que se caracteriza por producir principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón, pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situado a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella cría estos animales en su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que siempre visitan el lugar en donde vive. Ella alimenta a sus animales con alimento balanceado y forraje. Los ingresos le permiten ayudar a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia.

Josefa desea adquirir alimento para sus animales de modo que estos se desarrollen de mejor modo y sean vendidos a mejor precio. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500  nuevos soles con los que espera lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Josefa, 54, is a mother living with her husband and children in the Tambogrande agricultural zone, a semitropical area characterized mainly by fruit crops like mango, passion fruit and lemons.  It’s part of Piura region and is located over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She raises small farm animals at home.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to her neighbors and to merchants who frequent the area where she lives.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced animal feed and forage.  Income allows her to help her husband support the family’s economy.

Josefa wants to acquire feed for her animals so that they will develop better and be sold at a higher price.  She has, therefore, seen the need to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa she hopes will help her reach her objective.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en:
Melecio C. Sr. is from the village of San Rafael. He is 59 years old. Melecio is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Melecio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Melecio has been engaged in his business for over 39 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melecio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melecio is requesting a new loan of 24000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Melecio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Stephen Nderu

texts.en: Stephen has practised mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last 10 years. He is 40 years old, married to Jane Wangui and they have four children. Stephen was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his second loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. Stephen plans to use the loan to buy a dairy cow. In the future, Stephen hopes to embrace technology in his farming methods to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Luz Aurora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHASKA ÑAHUI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Aurora; la socia tiene 64 años de edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia de profesión es enfermera cesante ahora ella  trabaja como asistente de secretariado medico, trabaja de lunes a sábado de 9:00am hasta las 13:00pm y de 16:00pm hasta las 20:00pm en un consultorio por el centro de la ciudad,  la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de seguir delante y con su trabajo ella está realizando algunas mejoras en su casa ya que es algo que quería hacer.

La socia solicita el préstamo para el revestimiento de su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The applicant is a member of the communal bank, ” CHASKA ÑAHUI”, located in the district of Cusco, in the department and province of Cusco.

The applicant is Sra. Luz Aurora, 64 years old, who is married with a son. She is an unemployed nurse and now works as a medical secretarial assistant. She works Monday to Saturday from 9am to 1pm, and from 4pm to 8pm in a surgery in the center of the city. She is a very happy person with a great willingness to progress and continue working. She is carrying out some improvements in her home as it is something that she wanted to do.

She is applying for the loan to redecorate her house.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to meeting her repayments.

loans.use: The applicant requests a loan to redecorate her house.

loans.name: Gladys Wanjiku

texts.en:
Gladys is 27 years old and married to John M..  The couple has two children.  Gladys has farmed in Nduyu Njeru for the last two years.  

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET, Ltd. by her friend.  This loan will be her fourth.  She has repaid all her previous loans in a timely manner.  She plans to use this loan to buy seeds for planting.  In the future, Gladys hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting

loans.name: Kipolonto Ole

texts.en:
Kipolonto Ole M. has been a farmer for the last ten years. He is 40 years old, married to two wives who both are housewives and blessed with 12 children.

He learned about KADET Ltd. from the marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. This is his second loan, which he plans to spend to purchase farm supplies. He intends to use the returns from the loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm.

Kipolontos’ dream is to be the best and best-known farmer in the area. He is an industrious man who can do well if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Chou

texts.en: Mr. Chou was born in 1968. He and his wife, Mrs. Sok, are firewood sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. Currently, they do not have a chainsaw. Thus, in order and improve this business, Mr. Chou would like to ask for a loan to purchase a gasoline chainsaw for cutting wood. This couple has a child who is a construction worker. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to purchase a gasoline chainsaw for cutting wood

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de maíz, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz y luego lo vende en forma independiente en lugares como Andahuaylillas y Juliaca, y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the  “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Andahuaylillas district, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

The assocate is Señora Alejandrina.  She is 49 years of age and single, with 7 children.  The associate alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling corn.  She has farmland where she sows corn and then sells it independently in places such as Andahuaylillas and Juliaca.  Through this business the associate moves ahead with her children.  The associate wants to improve her corn sale business.  The associate requests the loan to buy corn wholesale.

The associate is happy for the loan and she promises to comply with the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor se caracteriza por ser una persona seria pero de buenos sentimientos, tiene 38 años, está casada con Wilmer de 40 años. Esta pareja tiene dos hijos, David de 20 y Javier de 17 años, todos viven en su domicilio propio, ubicado en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. Aparte de ser una excelente agricultora es una buena comerciante porque desde hace 20años en las mañanas, durante las primeras horas del día, vende productos oriundos de la sierra en un puesto del mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma y a las 10:00 de la mañana asiste a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas porque ambos laboran en la chacra, así como en la casa. Asimismo Leonor siembra maíz, papa, arveja y diferentes verduras muy cotizadas en el mercado por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta es recomendar a sus clientes que pueden cocinar mientras le compran algún producto. Ella se muestra contenta con lo que hace, y para el futuro desea ampliar su tienda y abastecerla de mercadería ya que tiene más clientes que acuden a su pequeño establecimiento. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, ye este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se muestra satisfecha con su trabajo dentro de su banco comunal, ya que refiere que aprende de las experiencias de los socios. Leonor, muy dentro de unos meses cosechará arveja, por lo que augura buenos resultados; ya que comprará con el dinero solicitado varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos, y de esa manera asegurar un alimento de calidad y cantidad.
texts.en:
Leonor is noted for being a serious but caring person.  She is 38 years old and married to 40 year-old Wilmer.  The couple have two children: 20 year-old David and 17 year-old Javier.  They live in their own home which is located in the small village of Huaylahuichan.

In addition to being an excellent farmer, Leonor is also a good saleswoman because, for 20 years, in the early hours of each morning, she has been selling products which are native to the mountains in a stall in the 'Mercado Modelo' market in the city of Tarma.  At 10.00am she helps her husband with his farming work because they both work on their farm as well as in the house.  Leonor grows corn, potatoes, peas and different vegetables that are very much sought after by her customers in the market.

What Leonor most enjoys about her work is recommending to her customers what they could cook while they are buying produce from her.  She is happy with what she does and, in the future, she would like to expand her store and stock it with merchandise since she has more customers who come to her small establishment.

Leonor is a member of the "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is very happy with her work within her community bank since she learns from the experiences of other members.  In a few months time, Leonor will harvest her pea crop, from which she expects good results as she will use the money she has requested to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer to spread over her crops.  In this way she will ensure a good quantity of good-quality produce.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla, 31 years old, is married to Nidal who is a taxi driver. They live in Madaba with their five children in a rented house. Khawla started a year ago selling different types of home supplies, as shown in the photo. She does this to help her husband support their family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more goods and open her own home supplies store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more home supplies to sell

loans.name: Americanistas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Americanistas se llama  así porque la mayoría de los integrantes son aficionados al equipo de fútbol America, este grupo esta integrado por 9 personas que de dedican al trabajo diario para el sustento de su familia Lourdes (Venta de ropa), Hortencia (Elaboración de bolsas bordadas), Hilaria y Guillermo (Venta de abarrotes), Sofía (Venta de catalogo), Reyna y Juana (Venta de calzado), Adela (Venta de Herbalife), Juan (Taller de serigrafía).
Hilaria es una de las integrantes de este grupo, esta casada con el señor Navor, tiene una pequeña hija. Ella solicito el préstamo porque quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de aborreces en su casa ya que por donde vive no existe ningún otro negocio de abarrotes y pensó que es una buena opción para pueda tener un nuevo ingreso para la aportación en su familia, con el crédito comprara: jabón, aceite, papel higiénico, detergente, azúcar, entre otros productos. 
Hilaria decidió iniciar este negocio porque con lo que su esposo gana no le alcanza para los gastos y como su pequeña hija necesita de muchas cosas a veces no tiene para comprárselas y espera que con este pequeño negocio obtenga ganancias para así poder comprarle todo lo que su hija necesita.
Hilaria comenta que antes de que se casara ella se dedicaba a la elaboración de pan pero cuando conoció a su esposo dejo de hacerlo.
Su meta es hacer su propia casa ya que donde vive es de su suegra, y lo piensa lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación
Esta muy contenta por el crédito otorgado y agradece por este gran apoyo.
texts.en:
This group is called the Americanistas because most of the members are fans of the soccer team, America.   The group is made up of 9 people who work every day to support their families.  Lourdes (clothing sales), Hortencia (makes embroidered bags), Hilaria and Guillermo (grocery sales), Sofia (catalog sales), Reyna and Juana (shoes sales), Adela (Herbalife sales), and Juan (a silkscreen shop).

Hilaria is one of the members of this group.  She is married to Navor and she has a little daughter.  She is requesting the loan because she wants to start a business of selling groceries in her home since there is no other where she lives,  She thought it would be a good option so she could have another source of income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy: soap, oil, toilet paper, detergent, sugar and more.
Hilaria decided to begin this business because her husband doesn’t earn enough to cover the expenses and because her little daughter needs many things and she isn’t able to buy all of them.
Hilaria says that before she was married, she made bread but she stopped once she met her husband.
Her goal is to have her own house since now she lives with her mother-in-law and she plans to succeed with effort and dedication.
She is very happy with the loan offered and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: To buy grocieries such as detergent, toilet paper, sugar, oil, etc

loans.name: Leida Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal De Colorado se reúne cada quince días en Colorado del  Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Leída, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tuvo seis hijos pero dos de ellos fallecieron, los cuatro que tiene ya son mayores de edad, pero una de sus hijos  aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer, tiene un tanquero y una volqueta.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica a la venta de material pétreo y de agua en tanquero, nos cuenta  nuestra amiga que por el sector por donde ellos viven no hay agua potable y el aprovecha para venderles a la personas que necesitan de este liquido vital. Trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7h30 hasta las 18h00 y los domingos cuando sus clientes lo necesitan. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva dedicado a este negocio ya por más de 15 años y le ha ido muy bien ya que son pocos los tanqueros que distribuyen el agua por su localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar agua y material pétreo. Está en el banco comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que les ha dado el banco.
 
Su sueño es comprar otro tanquero ya que el que tienen está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The communal bank "De Colorado" meets every 15 days in Colorado in the canton of Montecristi.  This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts.  It is famous at the national and international level for its straw (Panama) hats.  

Here we meet Leida, 66, who is in a marriage that produced 6 children.  Two of her children have passed away, and the other 4 are adults.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband is a driver; he has a tanker truck and a dump truck.  

Leida is a very good wife who is taking a loan for her business selling gravel and water by the tankload.  Our friend tells us that in the area where she lives they don't have potable water, so her husband has an opportunity to sell this vital liquid to the people who need it.  She works Monday through Saturday from 7:30am until 6pm, and on Sundays when needed.  She tells us that her husband has been doing this work for more than 15 years, and it has gone very well since there are very few tanker trucks available to distribute water in her area. 

This loan will be used to buy water and gravel.  Leida has been in her communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the benefits she receives as a member.  

Her dream is to buy another tanker, since the one they have is a bit rundown.

loans.use: to buy water and gravel

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a farmer in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya. She has been farming for three years, producing maize, eggs and layers which she sells at the local market. She has one farmhand and is married with seven adult children.

Mary has requested a loan of 72,692 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says this will supplement her poultry income and enable her to  expand her farming business. She intends to upgrade her dairy breeds for better output. 

Mary says lack of efficient artificial insemination services and vaccination for the cows are proving to be great challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory has owned and managed his answering service/business center, Golden Touch Answering Service, for three years. The business, which provides answering services 24 hours a day/ 7 days a week, mainly caters to doctors and other medical groups with on-call hours. Gregory’s business has been very successful with 55 accounts and over 250 doctors who participate. Gregory is very dedicated to his business and recently decided to work a second job at a bakery to earn more money to invest into his business. He currently has one part-time employee whose availability is dependent on demand and cash flow.

With this loan from ACCION USA, Gregory will be able to pay another part-time employee. He hopes his growing staff will increase efficiency and create a greater client base.

loans.use: to hire another part-time employee

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 58, is a vendor of farm produce, a business in which he has been engaged for seven years. He also sells secondhand clothes. He generated his initial capital from farming. His primary hardship is price fluctuation. 

He has a vision of expanding his business so that he can provide for the education of his children. He and his wife live in Kasese, Uganda, and have seven children.

Jackson has requested this loan in order to buy maize and beans to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to offer for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 40-year-old, married man with two children living in his own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. He longs to educate his children up to university. For 6 years Peter has been selling spare (bicycle) parts and this has facilitated him in providing basics to his family. He has the challenge of bad debts. His dream is to set up a garage in town. Peter intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

The other person in the photo, wearing a white shirt, is a loan officer. This was done to gain the confidence of the client who was hesitant to be on the website.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for bicycles

loans.name: Desida

texts.en:
Desida is 38 years old and married with 3 children.

Desida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying & selling charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Desida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business of buying & selling for 3 years and also earns an income from candy making.

Desida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a business-lady who operates a salon.  She also runs a boutique for extra income.  She started that business four years ago.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya she has been able to access financial resources, hence improving her business.  She hopes to open other branches of her business in the future.  She also dreams of opening a hair-dressing school.  Joyce has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy bags and clothes.

loans.use: buy bags and clothes

loans.name: Lount

texts.en: Mrs. Lount, age 25, is a married woman and the mother of two single children. Two of the children are attending the local school. She is a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Most of the people in this region work in agriculture, raise livestock and have a fishing business. Presently, Mrs. Lount and her husband work in the fishing sector. They have been doing this since 2000 and make a profit of about $6 USD per day to use for their daily expenses. Presently, the family has a problem with their fishing business, as some fishing tools are broken. To solve this situation, Mrs. Lount and her husband would like to ask for a loan to buy nets and a new motorboat to replace the old and broken equipment.

loans.use: to buy nets and a new motorboat

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es ama de casa y vive en una localidad en donde las personas son de una sola religión y su templo es grande y bonito, ella vive  en unión libre con el señor Lucas y con quien procreo cuatro hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.
    Solicito el presamos para invertirlo en la compra de mantas, hilos de colores para elaborar camisas y blusas, en donde lleva practicando  20 años y ella se siente muy contenta ya que le va bien con su venta.
    Quien la inspiro a  esta actividad fue su familia  ya que también desea apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa  y así sacar adelante a su  pequeña familia  quienes depende de ellos dos.
    Lo que más desea  es que con el préstamo  y  su actividad pueda ahorrar y comprar una maquina  que utiliza para bordar y tenga más mercancías en el mes.
texts.en:
Josefa’s a housewife.  She lives in a community where all the residents belong to the same religion; their temple is large and beautiful.  She lives in a common law relationship with Lucas and has four children with him; all are still her responsibility.

She asked for the loan to buy fabric and colored thread to make shirts and blouses.  She’s been in this occupation for 20 years and she feels very happy because she does well with her sales.

Her family inspired her into this activity because she wants to help her husband cover household expenses and move her small family, who depend on the two of them, ahead this way.

What she most desires with the loan and her activity is to be able to save up to buy an embroidery machine to have more merchandise during the month.

loans.use: to buy fabric and embroidery thread.

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven is a 48-year-old married woman with four children. Two of her children are attending school.  Ven is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and beans. She has been involved in this business for 19 years. After her crops mature, she retails them in a local market at a reasonable price. She usually earns approximately $1.60 each day. 

In order to sustain her business, Ven is asking for a loan from Kiva to purchase crop seeds and fertilizers and make a payment for rental land. With the increase in her income, she would like to save money to expand her business and support her children until they graduate high school.

loans.use: to purchase crop seeds and fertilizers and make a payment for rental land.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. She has been selling cosmetics and home products for the past 5 years. In parallel, she has been working in a locA. school since 2005 in order to supplement her income. She cooperates with her husband, who works as an architect, to be able to pay the family expenses. Today, she is asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. beauty products to sell.  In the future, she is planning to have her own beauty shop.

loans.use: buy beauty products

loans.name: Fabio Ricardo

texts.es:
La educación física es vital para las personas ya que les ayuda a mantenerse en forma y sobre todo a mantenerse muy saludables. En el municipio de Telica departamento de León, el señor Fabio es profesor de educación física y deporte en un pequeño colegio del municipio donde adiestra a muchos niños en esta educación. Cabe señalar que se dedica a esa labor desde hace 19 años. Actualmente es casado y con 3 hijos a los que mantiene.

El señor Fabio necesita mejorar sus condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como, cerámica, cemento y pago de mano de obra para realizar las mejora en el piso principalmente y así continuar con su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Physical education is of vital importance as it helps to maintain fitness and above all good health. In the municipality of Telica, in the department of León, Señor Fabio is a physical education and sports teacher in a small school in the municipality, where he trains many children. It is worth mentioning that he has been doing this job for the past 19 years. He is currently married and he has 3 children to support.

Señor Fabio needs to improve his living conditions as his home is in a bad state. Therefore, he has decided to turn to Ceprodel to apply for a loan to purchase construction materials such as tiles and cement and also to pay for the labor to undertake the improvements so that he can continue with his day job.

loans.use: to pay for construction materials such as: tiles, tile glue and also labor.

loans.name: Shefaa

texts.en:
Shefaa is a 43-year-old married woman who has eight sons and daughters. She started a small home retail business a few years ago to help her husband and family financially. In the last few years, Shefaa has decided to focus more on her business and has started to think of improving and expanding it. As a result, she has added another item, blankets, to the clothes that she sells.
Shefaa has applied for this loan to buy more of these products at wholesale prices. In the future, she wants to have her own retail store and have another section in it that sells home products, too.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Jean Paul 2 Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est crée depuis le démarrage du banc villageois.
 Il est composé de 15 femmes, habitant dans le même village. Elles pratiquent comme activité l'embouche ovine et caprine.
Mame Diarra (debout à droite de la photo) est la responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Les 8 enfants de sa coepouse sont aussi à son charge.
Elle fait de l'embouche, une activité qu'elle maitrise parfaitement pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.
Son prêt reçu lui permet d'acheter des brebis et des caprins pour les élever et au bout de 6 mois les vendre.
Ses recettes lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Jean Paul 2 group was created at the same time as the inauguration of the Banc Villageois. The group is made up of 15 women who all live in the same village. The women are all engaged in sheep and goat fattening.

Diarra (standing on the far right of the picture) is the group´s leader. She is 34 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is also taking care of her co-wife´s 8 children.

Diarra has been practising animal fattening for many years and is very experienced in this area. This loan enables her to buy some sheep and goats so that she can fatten them for 6 months before selling them. Her income will allow her to take care of her children´s needs.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Valmir

texts.en:
After moving from Brazil 10 years ago, Valmir started working part-time informally cleaning houses and decided to make a home-based business out of it. Since the recession started, Valmir has struggled financially and no banks would lend to him despite his good credit history in the past. Besides the cleaning business, he has two part-time jobs and is working to give his family a better future. He heard about Accion USA through a local paper and decided to call—now he’s happy he did because the business is getting the cash flow it needs in order to formalize it. Valmir hopes to build his business and make it successful again.

This loan will help Valmir pay for new cleaning supplies and purchase more commercial and residential cleaning contracts. It will help him expand his clientele and offer better services to the community.

loans.use: To pay for additional cleaning supplies and new contracts.

loans.name: Edwin Kipchirchir

texts.en: Edwin is a single man. He describes himself as a strict man. He has been providing motorcycle transportation services for the last two years. In addition, he also sells timber. His motorcycle business faces a challenge of the high cost of fuel. He will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy timber for selling. In the future, Edwin wants to run a carpentry workshop.

loans.use: To buy timber for selling.

loans.name: Organizando Metas Group

texts.es: el grupo organizando metas esta compuesto por cuatro integrantes  siendo la responsable Maryury quien se esfurza por sacar adelante su negocio, es madre soltera de dos niños, uno de ellos cursa la escuela el otro no aun esta pequeño.  la joven trabaja de lunes a domingo  desde las seis de la mañana elabora sus tortillas y pone a cocer los frijoles para ofrecerle a sus clientes su productos.
texts.en: The "Organizando Metas" group consists of four members and is led by Maryury. She works hard to keep her business going and is a single mother of two children. One of her kids is in school and the other is still too young to attend. She works Monday through Sunday and starts making tortillas and cooking beans at 6 AM to offer her products to the customers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business such as beans, firewood, corn, bread, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Alisati

texts.en:
Alisati is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past one year, Alisati has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Alisati has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more food for sale, and will help Alisati to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young brother. Alisati hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up another restaurant. 

Alisati is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to stock more food for sale

loans.name: Catherine Oké Walé

texts.fr: Catherine Oké Walé est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Alfred. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Catherine Oké Walé vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Catherine Oké Walé assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Catherine Oké Walé n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses différents besoins et aux besoins de sa famille, Catherine Oké Walé vend depuis une vingtaine d’année du maïs et des épices. Catherine Oké Walé  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Catherine Oké Walé sollicite pour une sixième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des épices et du maïs.

loans.name: Reverien

texts.en:
Reverie is 27 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 3 and 5 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 4 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to buy a land and he wishes to make a big shop for selling beans and maize.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane’s desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her age (50) and the obstacles she has experienced, she doesn't reduce her efforts to achieve her objective - what she sets out for, she gets. She is so humble and honest and a very hardworking smallholder farmer on this planet Earth. 

Jane is a mother of lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. She hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. 

Jane started farming and has been doing farming for the past ten years. Through those years, she has gathered so much experience that all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Jane practices dairy and mixed farming on her farm and, through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the key to success. 

Jane is a farmer who is very enterprising and she is seeking a loan of KES 100,000 to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, Jane wants to take advantage of those and reap more profits. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help women like Jane to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Jane hopes that, through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Jane’s dreams and projections are that, by the end of next year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. 

Through this she will be able to assure her children of a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. 
Help this smallholder farmer with dreams and goals to realize! Come on--make a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Norma Leticia Gonzal

texts.en: I've had my business for two years.  Before my salon I worked for a private company and when I retired I invested the money in my own business. At the moment Iâ€™m working towards getting more clients and in order to do so I need to get good quality products to satisfy them.  The earnings of the salon help me with my family.

loans.use: Buying dyes, nail treatments, nail polish and a hair drier

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia dedicated herself to the sale of semi-new clothing more than one year ago, and the business is going well. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy more merchandise and in that manner increase her sales with greater variety of styles, sizes, and models. The loan will be repaid in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Sonia se dedica a la venta de ropa seminueva desde hace mas de un año y el negocio a marchado bien, ella solicita un prestamo por $ 800.00 para comprar mas mercancía y de esa manera incrementar su venta con mayor variedad de estilos, tallas y modelos, el prestamo pretende pagarlo en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz D/O S. Ahmad Shah lives in District 13 of Kabul City. She is married and has four family members. She and her son have a fresh fruit cart. In her first loan cycle, she bought fruits for her son to sell from the cart so they could earn money for their family's daily needs. She plans to continue in the loan program so she can establish a shop for her son which will allow more room for goods and increase their sales. She thanks AFSG for providing loan opportunities to her.

***Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband or relative of the female entrepreneur.  In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman to the internet but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.***

loans.use: To purchase fresh fruit

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prum S., 32 years old and is a mother of 2 children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a grocery stand at her home and typically makes  about $4/day, while her husband makes around $2 from working at a private company as a bus driver. In order to increase her family's saving as well as satisfying her clients' needs, S. is humbly requesting a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase more grocery items for her inventory. In the future, she is thinking about being able to expand her stand with the variety of products to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items to invest in her stand

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: "LAPO has been a source of financial help to my business since 2005," says Mrs. Vero E., who lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells planks, as do the other 5 members of her community association.  She is  53 years old, and married with 5 children. She has been in this business since 1996 and needs the above loan to buy more wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Ana Bertha

texts.es:
Berta is a go-ahead woman, and relentless. She is the mother of 4 children whom she loves deeply. They are the driving force that makes her strive, along with her husband, for a better life. They have a locksmith’s shop they set up in home. Berta and her husband have devoted many years to their business. She had to learn the tools of the trade, made it fast, and made it well. In time, her kids also learnt it. And they have helped to make it grow. So, all members of the family work together, but they need more machines to keep productivity up. They want to get more clients, so the kids could go to technical school.

Berta is asking for a loan of $US 175, to get a compressor to be used for finishing the pieces made in the shop. Your help may give them the extra push their business needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Berta es mujer emprendedora y muy luchadora, madre de 4 hijos los cuales son su adoración y motor que la impulsa para seguir trabajando con su esposo en el taller de cerrajería que tienen ubicado en las instalaciones de su hogar al que le han dedicado años de trabajo. Bajo este contexto ella ha tenido que aprender el oficio de un cerrajero y se viene desempeñado muy bien en esta labor, el conocimiento de este trabajo también lo adquirieron con el tiempo sus hijos y en la medida de sus posibilidades contribuyen con el exitoso desempeño del taller de sus padres. A pesar de tener un gran número de mano de obra se ven en la necesidad de comprar maquinarias para ayudar a agilizar su producción y así obtener mayor número de clientes, a fin de que sus hijos puedan retomar sus respectivos estudios en la escuela técnica de su ciudad. Hoy Berta solicita la suma de 175 dólares para adquirir una máquina comprensora con los que podrá darles excelentes acabados a cada una de las piezas que fabrican en el taller. Con tu colaboración podremos hacer que logre tener una maquinita para que el progreso de sus hijos se haga realidad en poco tiempo.

loans.use: Buying a compressor to be used in the shop

loans.name: Ivonne Nilda

texts.es:
Ivonne, is a multifaceted and enterprising woman. She has great initiative to work and dedicates herself to what she learns. In spite of the difficulties she has faced, she has a strong will, inspired by her two children, to improve the quality of life for her family. Now, because her husband is very ill and unable to get out of bed, Ivonne has found herself responsible for maintaining the house and the family. She needed to put into practice something she learned from her family and friends, embroidery of handicrafts which she sells from her home. Even though it's very hard, she manages the hours needed for her work and her family. She feels satisfied that she can maintain the family. Her goal is to expand her shop and buy the materials needed to make her crafts. She is requesting a loan for this and needs your kind support to help her reach her goals.

Ivonne, es una mujer multifacética y emprendedora, estas cualidades son merecidas en su personalidad porque ella tiene ese gran ímpetu e iniciativa para trabajar y desempeñarse plenamente en lo que le encomienden. A pesar de las circunstancias difíciles que le ha tocado vivir tiene una inmensa fortaleza inspirada en sus dos hijos para sacar a flote a su familia, ahora aún más debido a que su esposo se encuentra delicado de salud y la enfermedad se ha tornado grave ya que no puede liberarse de su postración de una humilde cama.Por estas circunstancias apremiantes Ivonne ha asumido la dirección de su hogar y la manutención es directamente su responsabilidad. Esta necesidad ha hecho que ponga en práctica lo que una vez aprendió de sus familiares y amigos; el bordado de fustanes, la elaboración de artesanías llamadas mates burilados y la atención personalizada a las solicitudes de sus clientes en su pequeña tienda ubicada en casa. El tiempo muchas veces suele ser corto para, Ivonne, pero no la desanima pues ahora se ha adecuado para distribuir las horas del día en la atención de su familia y el de sus negocios. A pesar de la penosa situación por la que atraviesa su familia ella se siente satisfecha de poder sostener a su familia aunque con mucho esfuerzo; su inmenso deseo es implementar su tiendita y comprar para las demás actividades que realiza las materias primas necesarias para continuar con la elaboración del resto de sus productos y por esta razón solicita un préstamo para cumplir con lo que se ha propuesto. Recuerda que Ivonne necesita tu desinteresado apoyo para ver sonreír pronto a su familia otra vez.

loans.use: TO BETTER STOCK HER SMALL SHOP AND BUY MATERIALS NEEDED TO CONTINUE MAKING HER HANDICRAFTS.

loans.name: Uni

texts.en:
Uni A. is a 27-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya. She is a widow with one child. Her business was doing quite well until about a year ago when her husband died and she became the sole income earner in her household. The rent and upkeep of her shop became too costly, so Uni decided to scale down and move to this tiny kiosk pictured here.

Her hard work, determination, and perseverance have led Uni to her success. She manages her stall during the day and sells second-hand clothes to her well-established clientele in the evenings. Her profits pay the household expenses as well as school fees for her child.

Uni plans to use the funds from her loan of US $600 to move to a bigger space She will invest part of the loan in buying cereals (grains) to supplement her current business, increase her stock of groceries, and save the remaining amount for emergencies.

loans.use: Increase her stock of groceries, pay rent for a bigger space, and augment her business with cereal (grain) sales.

loans.name: Aybeniz

texts.en: Aybeniz is a 36-year-old local resident of the town of Saatli. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. She breeds cattle together with her family. (Her mother is shown in the picture). They have engaged in this business for 25 years. She raises calves and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. She also sells milk and other diary products. She wants to buy two more calves to add to their livestock. She has applied to the Normicro Saatli branch for a loan in amount of $600.

loans.use: To increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Hospital East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aminah N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Aminah is 30 years old and is married. Her husband sells wholesale matooke. She has 3 children ranging from age 5 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Aminah makes approximately UGX 50000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more linen clothes. Aminah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX in order to buy another sewing machine and the loan was paid back on time.

Aminah is joined in her small group by Monica B., Zamu M. and Madina K.. Monica B. has a business in charcoal selling and wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal. Zamu M. is currently operating a business in poultry farming and wants a loan to purchase poultry feeds. Madina K. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to increase inventory.

loans.use: To add to tailoring business

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a member of "The Carnations" communal bank and lives in Picota in the San Martín region of Peru. She's dedicated to making popular regional dishes as well as accompaniments like grilled plantains, which she does out of her home until customers line up for the food every afternoon. She's been doing this for 19 years because she likes the work and wants to make headway with her only daughter by her side. With hard work and perseverance she learned to balance her time well between running her business and her home.

With the $375 loan, which she plans to repay in six months, she will purchase chicken, pig intestines, plantains, yucca and firewood so she can keep up her work.

Delia is a very enthusiastic and happy 55-year-old. She is happy and comfortable with what she has accomplished and is still doing. In the future she wants to incorporate cold products into her business, which her daughter will run when she is older.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Delia Chistama S. pertenece al Banco Comunal. “Los Claveles”, vive en la Región San Martín ,provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la preparación al carbón de vísceras de cerdo, asimismo a la venta de anticuados que los acompaña con plátanos verdes asados, todo esto en su propia casa que esta ubicada en el Jr. Grau 1ra cuadra, de la localidad de Picota, hasta donde llega cada tarde gran cantidad de clientes. Hace 19 años que se dedica a este negocio y lo hace por que le gusta y quiere sacar adelante a su única hija que esta a su lado, con la constancia y perseverancia supo manejar bien su tiempo tanto para administrar su negocio como su hogar. Con el crédito recibido de S/ 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en un plazo de 6 meses, comprará pollos en jabas, vísceras de cerdo por kilos, plátano en racimos, yuca en kilos, leña en tercios para que así no le falte a la hora de preparar, Delia es una mujer entusiasta y alegre con sus 56 años, se siente tranquila, cómoda, feliz de lo que ha logrado y lo sigue haciendo, en el futuro quiere poner un negocio de venta de refrigerios para que su hija cuando sea mayor lo administre

loans.use: Purcahse ingredients like plantains, yucca, etc. to make her dishes / Con el prestamo comprara platanos, yucas ,etc para la elaboracion de sus productos

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata S., age 34, is married and takes care of four children. She has been a member and an assistant at the village bank of Boucotte Centre in Ziguinchor for three years. Her business consists of buying bissap (a flower use to make beverages), peanuts, and beans to resell. The income derived from her commerce enables her to improve the well-being of her family. Aminata wants to strengthen her business. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Aminata S., 34 ans, mariée, 04 enfants en charge est membre et assistante au banc villageois de Boucotte Centre à Ziguinchor depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter du bissap, des arachides et des haricots pour les revendre. Les revenus tirés de son commerce lui permettent d’améliorer le bien être familial. Aminata veut renforcer son activité. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy bissap, peanuts, and beans to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for hairdressing services

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em L., age 24, has been selling groceries in front of her house since 2007. Each day she can make $8 in revenue. Her husband, Em Vutha, age 43, is a car mechanic, earning $10 per day. This couple has two children and both of them are too young too attend school. Em would like a loan to buy grocery inventory in bulk so that she will be able to fulfill her growing demand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery inventory.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru:
Matluba G. lives in Yavan. She is a housewife. She takes care of a household which includes calves. In order to make and sell sour dairy products, she wants to buy a milk cow. It will give her the chance to use the milk and to sell it for low prices. To do this, she needs 4,000 somoni. Therefore she plans to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Грезова Матлюба жительница города Яван. Домохозяйка. Разводит домашнее хозяйство , где имеет бычков.
