Для производства и продажи кисло-молочных продуктов хочет купить корову для того , чтобы получать молоко. Это даст возможность использовать молоко и продавать продукцию по низким ценам. Но для этого необходимы деньги в размере 4000 сомони. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying a milk cow

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan C. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit dans une famille monogame au quartier Pelengana Nord de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali).
Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités génératrices de revenus pendant  des années auprès de sa mère adoptive, elle décida il y a maintenant  5 ans de se spécialiser dans l’achat vente des chaussures en cuirs, des sacs pour femmes et maintenant la vente de miche de pain.
Pour obtenir des ressources financières additionnelles, elle décida de faire recours au programme crédit de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso (depuis maintenant 3 ans) afin de mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Après avoir bouclé trois prêts de groupe (prêt solidaire) avec une association de son quartier, elle est à son  deuxième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 1 000 miches de pains, 40 sacs à main et 40 paires de chaussures
Elle s’approvisionne en sacs à mains et en chaussures à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des artisans spécialisés dans la maroquinerie. Par contre elle s’approvisionne en pain auprès d’une boulangerie avec laquelle elle a signé une convention d’exclusivité. Les sacs et les chaussures sont vendus à domicile et au grand marché de la ville de Ségou (au comptant, à crédit, en ambulant ou de façon fixe) surtout les lundi jour de foire (où elles réalisent le plus de vente). 
Disposant d’installation spécialisée pour la vente du pain, elle vend sa marchandise à des hommes et des femmes (principalement des villageois) qui viennent s’approvisionner pour aller revendre dans leurs villages respectifs. 
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, contribuer aux charges de la famille et investir le reste dans les affaires. Son rêve est de devenir une commerçante import export dans le futur.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan C. is 33 years old and a married mother of 4. She lives in a monogamous family in the Pelengana Nord neighborhood in the city of Ségou (fourth economic region of Mali). After having attempted several business for years with her adoptive mother, she decided 5 years ago to specialize in buying and selling leather shoes, women’s handbags, and loaves of bread. In order to secure additional resources, she decided to turn to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program (3 years ago) to be able to better satisfy the needs of her growing clientele. After having secured three group loans with an association in her neighborhood, she is now on her second individual loan. All of the preceding loans were properly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy 1,000 loaves of bread, 40 handbags, and 40 pairs of shoes. She gets her handbags and shoes from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from artisans specializing in leather goods. She gets her bread from a bakery with which she has signed an exclusivity agreement. The bags and shoes are sold at home and at the big market in the city of Ségou (for cash or credit, traveling or on the spot) usually on Mondays, the market days (when sellers sell the most). Taking care of the special setup to sell bread, she sells her goods to men and women (principally villagers) who come to stock up in order to resell in their respective villages. She hopes to earn 30,000 CFA francs monthly, which will be used towards making loan payments and contributing to her family’s expenses – the rest will be invested in her business. Her dream is to become an importer-exporter in the future.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell bread, shoes, and handbags

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela is 34 years old and married with 5 children who are 1, 6, 8, 10, and 12 years old. Her husband helps her by cultivating potatoes and helping her look after the children. The couple grows and sells their potatoes in the Chapisirka region of Cochabamba in central Bolivia. They have been doing this for many years and have a lot of experience in the area. Marcela owns the land they farm on, as well as 10 donkeys, which she uses to transport potatoes.

Whenever there are no potatoes to harvest (which can happen for a variety of reasons), Marcela buys potatoes in bulk and then resells them. Since she has so much experience, she knows where to get the best prices. She will use this loan to buy potatoes in bulk at the market price.

Though there is stiff competition in potato sales, since Marcela lives in an area with many potato farmers, she has been able to dominate a portion of the potato market so her sales are steady. This will be her sixth loan with AgroCapital. She paid off all of her previous loans on time, though it should be mentioned that she did pay some of her installments behind schedule due to some problems with potato planting.
texts.en:
Marcela is 34 years old and married with 5 children who are 1, 6, 8, 10, and 12 years old. Her husband helps her by cultivating potatoes and helping her look after the children. The couple grows and sells their potatoes in the Chapisirka region of Cochabamba in central Bolivia. They have been doing this for many years and have a lot of experience in the area. Marcela owns the land they farm on, as well as 10 donkeys, which she uses to transport potatoes.

Whenever there are no potatoes to harvest (which can happen for a variety of reasons), Marcela buys potatoes in bulk and then resells them. Since she has so much experience, she knows where to get the best prices. She will use this loan to buy potatoes in bulk at the market price.

Though there is stiff competition in potato sales, since Marcela lives in an area with many potato farmers, she has been able to dominate a portion of the potato market so her sales are steady. This will be her sixth loan with AgroCapital. She paid off all of her previous loans on time, though it should be mentioned that she did pay some of her installments behind schedule due to some problems with potato planting.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes

loans.name: Zilha

texts.en: Zilha J. is 52 years old and lives in a suburb of Doboj. She is not married and the only income that she has is from her business with poultry. This is seasonal work and she earns only enough to pay her daily costs. Zilha is not able to save much money, and every time she has to buy chickens she has to borrow money or take a loan. She has taken out loans with WWI in the past, and and now she requests a loan of 600KM ($450 USD). Zilha will use this loan to buy little chickens and turkeys for fattening and reselling.

loans.use: To buy chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua M. has received no formal education. She is married and has 2 children, and her husband farms for a living.

Efua has been selling sells yams since 1998. She sells her yams to retailers, who resell them in a smaller quantity at Praso market in Elmina, Ghana.

Efua uses her income to pay for utility bills and other expenses. Efua will use her loan to purchase larger quantities of yams that are less expensive from another area further from her home. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to help her husband build a house for the family.

loans.use: Buy yams less expensively

loans.name: Yarty

texts.es: Yarty es una jovencita de 19 años, soltera que vive con su madre y hermanos. Sus padres se dedicaban a la agricultura, ella por motivos de estudios tuvo que migrar a la ciudad, estos últimos años sus padres y sus hermanos decidieron vivir con ella en la ciudad, por ello que Yarty incursionó en el comercio de abarrotes hace 5 años, y hasta ahora hizo mucha clientela que consumen sus productos. Ahora está estudiando secretariado por las tarde, en horas de la mañana atiende su bodega y en la tarde se lo encarga a su madre, a pesar que su negocio no le da grande ingresos, nunca les falta dinero, por eso le agrada, porque le permite ser independiente. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, pagando de manera puntual sus cuotas. Con el dinero solicitado va incrementar la compra de útiles escolares, acondicionará un lugar especial para ese rubro en su tienda.
texts.en:
Yarty is a young lady who is 19 years of age, single, and lives with her mother and brothers. Her parents dedicated themselves to farming and she, for educational reasons, had to migrate to the city. These past few years, her parents and brothers decided to live with her in the city. Due to this, Yarty embarked into the sales of groceries five years ago and to this day she has a good customer base that buys her products. Currently, she is taking secretarial courses in the afternoons and in the mornings she tends to her store. Her mother cares for the business in the afternoons. Despite the fact that the store doesn’t generate a great income, they never lack for money and she enjoys her enterprise because it allows her to be independent. This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has paid all her installments in a timely manner. She will invest the funds she is requesting into school supplies, and will set up a special area in her store for this endeavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase school supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con su pequeño hijo quien estudia y la quiere mucho. Ella  se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de productos de belleza como: perfumes, talcos, cremas en sus distintas variedades, etc., ya  que es  una mujer muy activa y con deseos de superación. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es buscar la forma de convencer a sus clientes para venderles sus productos, dar una muy buena atención es lo primordial, nos dice. Esta actividad le es rentable porque ella se ha ganado con este trabajo una gran gama de fieles clientes, por lo que le va muy bien hasta el momento. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, siendo una mujer muy responsable y cumplidora con sus cuotas de pago. Con el dinero requerido comprará una vitrina para colocar sus productos de belleza y exhibirlos con seguridad.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 33-year-old single mother who lives with her young son who studies and loves her very much. For the past three years she has worked selling beauty products such as perfumes, talcum powders, various types of creams, etc. She is very active and eager to improve her circumstances. She enjoys marketing her products to her clients and providing the best customer service, which is key, according to her. Her business is profitable because she has grown quite a gamut of faithful clients, so it is going well to date. This is her third MFP loan and she has been very responsible and reliable with her payments. With the requested funds she will buy a glass case to house her beauty products in order to display them more securely.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a glass case to display products

loans.name: Mrs. Sorphorn Chhearn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province make up the village bank, and they will use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. Sorphorn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and she is a farmer who grows corn on a small piece of land. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have any animals to plow the field, so she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field for cultivaT. corn. Her husband, Mr. Nheob Leang, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sorphorn C. is 34 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisT. of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field for cultivating corn.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: T. is 25 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she owns a plot of land. She usually grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year, a skill she learned from her grandparents. She is a good mother to one child who is still young. T. is married to Mr. Sok, age 25, and he is working together with his wife, farming. To help do the hard physical labor with the farming business, T. is asking for a loan to buy a water buffalo to plow the field. (T.'s husband appears in the picture because she was not available.)

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo for plowing the field

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đường năm nay 31 tuổi,  chị đang sống cùng 2 con tại huyện Hưng Nguyên tỉnh Nghệ An. Chồng chị, 33 tuổi, hiện đang  đi lao động  xuất khẩu tại nước ngoài.  Còn chị làm nghề thợ may và chăn nuôi tại nhà. Do thiếu vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và mua vải về cắt may nên năm 2006 chị Đường đã tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương. Đến nay  sau 2 năm tham gia Quỹ với việc  sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị đang ngày càng ổn định  hơn với thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng. Với mức vốn 8.000.000đ dự định xin vay trong vòng vốn tới chị sẽ sử dụng để mua trâu và sửa sang chuồng trại phụcvụ cho chăn  nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đường, 31 years old, lives with her two children in Hưng Nguyên district, Nghệ An province. Her husband, 33 years old, has gone to work overseas. She works at home as a seamstress and raises animals. Because she lacked enough money to buy animals or cloth, in 2006 Mrs. Đường joined the TYM Fund. Now, after two years participating in the Fund and using her loans effectively, the financial situation of her family is steadily becoming more secure, with a monthly income of 5,000,000 VND (297 USD). With the 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) that she has decided to request in the next round of lending, she plans to buy a water buffalo and repair the enclosure she uses to raise animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a water buffalo, repairing animal enclosure

loans.name: Habibar Rahman Group

texts.en: H. R. is the group leader of H. R. group. There are five members in this group. Each of them would like to take out a loan for their own business, for a total amount for their group of 50,000 Afghani. H. R. and Rahela want to take out loans for tailoring businesses. Tamana and Kamala will use their loans for their brother’s general store, and Shafeq Ahmad wants the loan for his bookstore. All of them want to expand and grow their businesses.  With the money they receive, they are confident they can make a good profit and run their businesses in a good way. They are happy about the loan process and want to say to Kiva lenders that it will support the entrepreneurs a lot.

loans.use: To expand and grow their businesses.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es: Santusa es madre soltera, tiene 46 años y vive en su propia casa junto a sus 4 hijos; Glenda de 22, Paola de 19, Anais de 18 y Diego de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios. Santusa tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, vende de todo, pero su principal fuente de ingresos son por la venta de menestras, su puesto es uno de los más concurridos del mercado, ya que las menestras que vende son muy deliciosas, además que las ofrece a un precio muy accesible. Lo más difícil para Santusa es permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta tratando de contrarrestar el intenso frió que hace dentro del mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es conversar con sus clientes, esto hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo. Santusa espera mejorar su negocio e implementarlo mejor para brindarles una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, al igual como lo hizo en su primer crédito. En su banco comunal es una socia muy querida, ya que siempre está preocupada por el bienestar del resto de sus compañeras. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Santusa is a single mother. She is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her four children: Glenda (22 years old), Paola (19), Anais (18), and Diego (11). Her children are the driving force behind all her efforts and sacrifices. Santusa has a stall in the Santa Bárbara market in the city of Juliaca. She sells all sorts of things, but her main source of income is from selling a variety of vegetables. Her stall is one of the busiest ones in the market, since the vegetables she sells are very delicious and offered at a very affordable price. The hardest thing for Santusa is to stay in her stall all day, trying to stave off the intense frio there inside. She's been working at this for 10 years, and what she likes most is talking to her customers, which makes her long workdays more enjoyable. Santusa hopes to improve her business and be able to offer her customers a wider variety of products, and increase her income. This is her second loan with MFP, and she plans to make all her payments on time, as she did with her first loan. She is very beloved among the members of her community bank, since she's always concerned abut her partners' wellbeing. She plans to use the money requested to increase the quantity of merchandise available at her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia B. is 36 years old. She is married and has four children, one son and three daughters. She says one of her children is currently learning a trade. The rest are in junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the busy commercial town called Ejura, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Afia works to help her husband financially support the family. Her husband is a farmer and she is a baker. Afia bakes bread. She supplies the greater proportion of her product to retailers and beverage sellers. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from nearby wholesale markets. She sells some of the bread at a table in the local market. Afia has been in business for twenty years and wants a loan so that she can purchase bags of flour and the other ingredients (margarine, sugar, etc.) in bulk. She is hopeful to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase bulk flour, bulk ingredients for bread making.

loans.name: Taïba

texts.fr:
S. Taïba est de nationalité béninoise et est née vers 1977. Taïba est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Taïba vend devant sa maison la bouillie de maïs accompagnée de beignets faits à base de farine de blé. Le maïs a doublé de prix et le prix de la farine de blé a aussi grimpé. Les moyens financiers dont dispose Taïba ne lui permet de s’approvisionner suffisamment en maïs et farine de blé. C’est pourquoi Taïba sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé pour soutenu son activité. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
S. Taïba is a Beninese national born around 1977. She is married and the mother of two. She sells porridge in front of her house and serves with it beignets made of wheat flour. Corn has doubled in price, and the price of flour has also been climbing. The financial means available to her doesn't allow her to stock up sufficiently with corn and wheat flour. This is why she's requesting a loan from ALIDÉ, so as to support her business. ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 50-kg sacks of corn, a 50-kg sack of wheat flour, a 50-kg sack of sugar, and a 25-liter drum of peanut oil

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

  Шухрат 1969 года рождения, женат  имеет 4 сыновей. Он работает в адвокатом в Кайраккумском суде. До этого он с матерью жили в городе и когда ей предложили работу в кишлаке они согласились.  Имея большой дом и двор они  пользуясь моментом  сразу приобрели пару овец.  Шухрат посоветовавшись с матерью приобрели также несколько коров.  Сейчас он более 3 лет кредитуется и доволен условиями кредита.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Shuhrat is thirty years old and is married with four children. He is a lawyer at Kayrakkum Court. Previously he and his mother lived in town but she was offered a job in a village and accepted it. With a large house and yard, they purchased a couple of sheep and cows. Shuhrat has been our client for three years and he is content with the loan conditions.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of  3 cows

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 60 years old. Estrella is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Estrella owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice for sale. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Estrella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Estrella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Estrella is requesting a new loan, of 5,000 PHP, to be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and labor for cultivating the area. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Estrella from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Chuc's Group

texts.en:
Chuc T. Nguyễn was born in 1960. (no: 010117120001). She lives in Phan Xa village, Uy No, Dong Anh, HaNoi. She has a girl. Her husband is a construction worker. She has a store at home where she sells water, fruit, coca cola, tea, etc. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She is a group leader. She has taken part in micro finance for three years. This loan cycle she needs 5.886.000 VND to buy goods to sell. There are seven other Fund participants in her group:

Mông Thị Nguyễn was born in 1968. (no: 010117120003). She sells soft drinks at home. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy more goods to sell. Phương M. Nguyễn was born in 1985. (no: 010117120005). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5.450.000 VND to buy clothes. Quyên Thị Lương was born in 1975. (no: 010117120026). She has two children. She wants to borrow 3.270.000 VND to repair her house. Thúy Thị Đặng was born in 1976. (no: 010117120004). She has two children. She sells bamboo shoots. She wants to borrow 2.398.000 VND to buy more bamboo shoots to sell. Luân Thị Nguyễn was born in 1972. (no: 010117120006). She has three children. She sells pork in the market. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to invest in her shop. Thêu Thị Nguyễn was born in 1980. (no: 010117120007). She has two children. She wants to borrow 3.270.000 VND to buy goods (cakes, sweets, smoker, fruit, etc) to sell. Hợp Thị Trần was born in 1978. (no: 010117120002). She has two children. She wants to borrow 5.886.000 VND to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell

loans.name: Djantoyerela 1 De (Djantoyerela De Zoha) Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA 1, au nombre de dix, sont toutes mariées, avec en moyenne  de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à  zoha, un village de la sous-préfecture de Fakola, préfecture de Kolondièba dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. 
Avec l’ouverture du  prêt de campagne de Soro Yiriwaso, qui correspond avec leur activité étant paysannes, ces femmes ont saisi l’occasion. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne, tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour, les frais de labour, de sarclage, l’achat de semences, d’engrais et d’herbicides. Elles veulent cultiver 20  hectares  en arachide, riz et mil.
Ces femmes espèrent sur une production moyenne de 2 tonnes par hectare soit 40 tonnes. Une partie de la récolte sera vendue dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires et le reste  sera destiné à la nourriture..
Le bénéfice de  la vente sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt, prendre en charge les frais scolaire, la santé des enfants et acheter les trousseaux de mariage des filles.
texts.en:
The women of the DJANTOYERELA 1 group, 10 in all, are married, with an average age of 35, 4 children each on average, and they live in polygamous families in Zoha, a village in the Sous-Prefecture of Fakola, Prefecture of Kolondièba in the third region (Sikasso) of the Republic of Mali. They met due to bonds of kinship and neighborhood.

When Soro Yiriwaso began to give rural loans which correspond to their work as farmers, these women seized the opportunity. They are on their fourth rural loan, and all three preceding ones were correctly reimbursed.

They want to use this new loan to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, and herbicides. They want to plant 20 hectares of peanuts, rice, and millet. These women hope to have an average harvest of 2 tons per hectare, or 40 tons in all. A part of the harvest will be sold in the various weekly markets and the rest destined for consumption.

The profit after their sales will be used to reimburse the loan, cover school fees, for the health expenses of their children, and for buying wedding trousseaux for their daughters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: plowing, seed, fertilizer, herbicide, and weeding

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 28 years old and is married with two children, aged 11 and 9.  She has a business selling cooked food in Colonia Caco, a small agricultural and fishing community located 24 hours’ riverboat journey up the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and eventually joins the Amazon to the north.  Estela’s husband works in a saw mill.

Estela has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal loan group “Las Mariscalas.”  She invested her very first loan of 200 soles (about $65) in purchasing products for her food business.  She will do the same with this loan of 1000 soles, and plans to buy sugar, rice, noodles, tuna fish and other basic food items.         

Estela’s goal is someday to have her own restaurant in the city of Pucallpa.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, and tuna for a food business

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 30 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their three children. Haidar has been working as a constructor since 1999. Haidar requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
Haidar is special in his work because he does a good work and is punctual. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because he of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business by purchasing more sophisticated tools.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en: Virginita M. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 46 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Virginita owns and operates a fish vending business, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Virginita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to as additional capital for her fish and shrimp vending business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio E. is a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver in Banga, South Cotabato. He is 39 years old with 3 children. He owns a motorcycle which is his main source of income. He also has 1 sow.

He would like to request a loan of Php 8000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy motorcycle parts and a pig. The loan will be helpful for him to sustain his business and provide the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: motorcycle parts and a pig

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. lives and does business in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.  She is 55 years old.  Her husband Benjamin, 59, works on a school maintenance crew.  One of their six children is now in college.

Erlinda has been selling rice cakes and homemade peanut butter for five years.  Then she opened a general store almost two years ago.  Combined, she earns more than P18,000.00 a month.  She has hired one store assistant.  

She became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the summer of 2007.  She recently applied for a P18, 000.00 loan with CCT as additional capital for her business.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Chy

texts.en:
As everyone knows, fish is the main vital fresh food for everybody, in particular families who depend on fishing and fish-selling, from Tunle Sap River, where the best place is for fish sheltering. Mrs. Chy R., one among those people, currently depends on selling fish at the local busy market. She sells fish that she either gets from her husband’s fishing or buys from her wholesale supplier.

Chy R. is a humble mother who has been blessed with four school-aged children. Chy R. has requested a loan to purchase more equipment to supply her husband's fish-catching business.

loans.use: To purchase more equipment to supply her husband's fish-catching business

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata S. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Fortunata is married and has three adult and school age children. To make a living, Fortunata owns & operates a business making "puto" (cassava cakes) and other delicacies for sale. Fortunata has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fortunata joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fortunata has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Fortunata is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fortunata from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Atieh

texts.en:
Atieh is was born in 1979. He is married and has 3 children who all live in Gaza City, Palestine.

Atieh owns a pastry shop where he sells all sorts of cakes and pastries. He always looks for ways to improve his business and therefore has been able to grow a good base of loyal customers. He opened the pastry shop because he enjoyed making and selling pastries and wanted to have an independent work life. In the future, he plans to expand and improve his work.

The loan he is asking for, USD 3000, is to purchase raw materials and thereby diversify his inventory of goods.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for his bakery

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La Sra  Zulma se dedica a la compra y ventas de joyas y carteras , ella es soltera con un hijo ya mayor , hace 16 años que se dedica a este rubro , ya que antes trabajaba como vendedora en una distribuidora.
 Ella  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas joyas ya que llega fin de año y tiene que tener variedad de mercaderíass.En el futuro  desea ampliar mas su negocio y abrir un local propio .
texts.en:
Zulma buys and sells jewelry and handbags. She is single with one grown son. She has been in this line of work for 16 years, and previously worked as a saleswoman for a distributor. She needs this loan to purchase more jewelry, as it is close to the end of the year and she wants to have a variety of merchandise. In the future, she would like to further expand her business and open her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry and handbags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Chynar's Group

texts.ru:
Алымбекова Чынар – лидер данной группы. Чынар вместе со своей семьёй живёт в г. Балыкчи. Балыкчи входил в список бурно развивающихся городов республики. Здесь было построено много этажных домов, заводы работали, и город славился также рыбным промыслом. Однако последние годы экономического застоя сделали своё дело. Производство прекратилось, и жители начали покидать город. Чынар было нелегко, ведь надо было ещё четверых детей расти. Они с мужем решили остаться и искать поприще в городе. Вскоре Чынар удалось начать торговлю на рынке. Она начала торговать мукой и кормом. Муж Чынар начал работать таксистом. Сейчас они благополучно продолжают воспитывать своих детей. Старшая дочь учится на первом курсе в лицее. Вторая дочь – студентка колледжа. Восьмилетний сын уже ходит в школу. А младший, ему шесть лет, пока дома. За пятнадцать лет в бизнесе, Чынар многого добилась. Она вместе с мужем смогла купить дом, чтобы там организовать торговую точку. Также она смогла приобрести автомобиль. В данный момент её ежемесячный доход от торговли мукой и кормом для скота составляет от 10,000 ($220) до 15,000 сомов ($340). Старшие дочери уже подросли и после занятий, активно помогают матери вести торговлю. Сейчас Чынар нуждается в кредите. Она надеется получить кредит с целью вложить средства в оборот для покупки 10 мешков муки и 15 мешков корма для скота. В будущем Чынар хочет расширить бизнес и открыть продуктовый магазин. 

Партнёры Чынар по группе:

Жакиевой Кулуйпе пятьдесят семь лет. Муж Кулуйпы – пенсионер. Вместе вырастили одного сына. Кулуйпа также находится дома и живёт одной пенсией. Она давно хочет купить стиральную машину, однако требуется много времени, пока она соберёт деньги. Поэтому она надеется получить этот кредит. 

Токоевой Айнабу сорок три года. Муж Айнабу работает водителем на одном предприятии. У Айнабу двое детей. Один из сыновей работает монтёром. Второму всего два года. Айнабу изготовляет бозо (национальный напиток)  и сдаёт его в магазины. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить кухонный гарнитур. 

Исмаиловой Розе пятьдесят семь лет. Роза занимается скотоводством. Сейчас у неё есть одна корова с телёнком и семь овец. Муж Розы – учитель физики в средней школе. Роза обратилась за этим кредитом, с целью купить ещё одну тёлку с телёнком для откорма. Она хочет достроить дом и для этого ей нужно иметь как можно больше скота для продажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Chynar A. is the leader of this group. Chynar lives in the city of Balykchi together with her family. Balykchi used to be included among the fast-growing cities in the republic. Many multi-story buildings were built here, factories were operating, and the city was also known for its fishing industry. However, recent years of economic decline did their deed. Manufacturing stopped, and the citizens started leaving the city. It was difficult for Chynar because she still had to raise four children. Her husband and she decided to stay and find work in the city. Soon, Chynar was able to get involved in retail sales at the market. She started selling flour and livestock feed. Chynar’s husband began working as a taxi driver. Now, they successfully continue raising their children. The oldest daughter is in her first year of school. The second daughter is a college student. Their eight-year-old son already started school. And the youngest son, who is six, is home for now. Chynar achieved a lot during the fifteen years in her business. Together with her husband, she was able to purchase a house in order to organize a retail outlet there. She was also able to buy a car. Currently, her monthly income from flour sales and livestock feed ranges from 10,000 som ($220) to 15,000 som ($340). The oldest daughters have already grown up and actively help their mother with the sales after school. Now, Chynar needs a loan. She is hoping to obtain a loan in order to increase goods turnover and purchase of 10 bags of flour and 15 bags of livestock feed. In the future, Chynar wants to expand the business and open a food market. Chynar’s partners in this group are: Kuluypa D. is fifty-seven years old. Her husband is retired. Together they raised one son. Kuluypa also stays at home and relies solely on her pension for income. She has wanted to purchase a washing machine for a long time; however, it will take her some time to save money for this purchase. This is why she is hoping to obtain this loan. Aynabu T. is forty-three years old. Her husband works as a driver for one company. Aynabu has two children. One of the sons works as an electrician. The second one is only two years old. Aynabu prepares “bozo” (a traditional drink) and sells it to stores. She needs a loan in order to purchase a kitchen set. Roza I. is fifty-seen years old. She is involved in animal husbandry. She currently has one cow with a calf and seven sheep. Roza’s husband is a physics teacher at a secondary school. Roza requested this loan in order to buy one more cow with a calf for raising. She wants to finish building her house and, to achieve this goal, she needs to own as much livestock for sale as possible.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover by purchasing 10 bags of flour and 15 bags of livestock feed

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn M. is 39 years old, married, and lives in Kouk Roka village, Takeo province. She has two children who are students in the public school.  She and her husband, Mr. Bol Ouch, are farmers who earn a living by growing crops on their three-hectare field. In order to support their farm, Mrs. Sokhorn M. is applying for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR from Kiva partner, AMK, to purchase a water machine. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer and gasoline to maintain the field.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine, fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina B. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Catalina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $115 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Catalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen owns a rice field. She’s 26 years old and is into rice farming in Agusan del Sur. She started her business way back in 2005. With the income she receives from her farm, the financial problems in sustaining the needs of her family are met.

Helen joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to obtain a loan for her farm. She requested 12,000 Php as additional capital to finance her business. With this amount, she can buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ainakul's Group

texts.en:
Ainakul S. is the leader of this group. Her husband’s daily routine starts early in the morning, with taking the manure out of the shed, giving water to the cows and milking the cows. As any person living in a village area, she runs a small household and even though they live in the area which is known for its harsh winters, they are perfectly used to local weather conditions. 

Ainakul is a mother of three children. All the children go to school. Her eldest son is fifteen. After school, he helps his parents look after the cattle. However, Ainakul tries not to burden her children with anything concerning housework as she believes that her children should be spared of all that to have more free time for studies. Ainakul is forty-five years old and feels herself in sufficiently good health and does not feel tiredness until evening. Now they are feeding a calf which they bought for $230. Ainakul’s dream is to give her children good education, help them get on their feet and improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband is currently a member of a farm and also works as a procurement manager of a high school. Now Ainakul needs a loan to buy four sheep for feeding and resale. 

Ainakul’s partners are: 

Burul S., 57, is the wife of a school worker. She has a sixteen-year-old daughter. Burul is busy with cattle that they keep at home. Burul has applied for this loan to buy more cattle. 

Nazgul A., 34, is the wife of a computer science and math teacher. Nazgul has three little children and currently does not work as she has to look after the kids. Now they keep three calves and need a loan to buy some sheep. 

Aibek K., 23, is married. His wife goes to college, and Aibek has to provide for both of them. Aibek works at school and wants to start a new business as an additional source of income. He hopes to obtain this loan and buy sheep for feeding. His wife will help him. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for feeding and resale

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar is 23 years and lives with his parents and a sibling in Hovd province, Mongolia. His father works for a private company and his sibling attends a local secondary school. Currently, Batbayar operates a consumer electrical products and auto repair service. He is certified as a television repairman and an electrician, and has been working in his chosen profession  for three or four years. 

In addition to his electronics repair business, Batbayar has been operating an auto repair service since 2009. He is a very hardworking person, and has many plans for the future. Batbayar says, “My dream is to one day open my own auto and electrical products repair center.” 

He is requesting a 450,000 tugrug loan to purchase machinery and spare parts for his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ayinla

texts.en: Ayinla sells smoked fish and ice fish, this serve as her means of livelihood and she has been in the business for the past 7 years. Ayinla is very happy with the growth of her business but she still want to increase it. She is married with 6 children and she is 40 years. Her husband sells vehicle tyre and lives together in Lagos. She asking for the loan amount of NGN70, 000 to purchase more smoked fish and ice fish to sell. She thank all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more smoked fish and ice fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca T. vive en la comunidad de Poloma que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus verdes campos, llenos de cultivos de maíz, papas, etc., su gente es trabajadora, luchadora y siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de leche hace 35 años, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de Cuenca, también cría animales como: gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, como lo hacen todos los que viven en el campo, los vende solo cuando tiene  alguna necesidad; también tiene una pequeña tiendita la cual abre solo cuando se encuentra en casa, y lleva 6 años trabajando en la misma.

Doña Blanca tiene 47 años de edad, es una mujer libre ya que se ha separado de su pareja, ha concebido 2 hijos, su primera hija de 23 años de edad, quien trabaja y apoya económicamente en el hogar, su segundo hijo de 12 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad; gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado tener su casa propia.

 Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace varios años y los créditos le han beneficiado para todos sus negocios, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda, su meta es remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca T. lives in the community of Poloma, which is part of El Valle Parish. This parish is known for its green fields full of corn, potatoes, and other crops. The people are hardworking and always determined to find a better future for their families.

Blanca has been selling milk for 35 years and distributes her product throughout the city of Cuenca. She also raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and hogs just like everyone else who lives in the country. The animals are sold only when necessary. She manages a small store whenever she is at home, which has been in operation for six years.

Doña Blanca is 47 years old. She is a free woman since she is already separated from the husband with whom she had two children. Her oldest daughter is 23 years old and works to help support the household financially. The second child is 12 years old and attends school in the city. Thanks to the effort invested into her work, Blanca was able to acquire her own home.

Blanca has been a member of her Communal Bank for several years and the loans she has taken have benefited all of her businesses. With this new loan, she will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store. Her goal is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, eggs, sodas, and other products for her store

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa D. is from the village of Northern Pob. Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Elsa is widowed and has 5 adult children. Elsa owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. is 56 years old and a widow with six children.  She is a villager who lives in Pong Teuk Tboung village, Takeo province. Mrs N.  is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to grow rice. She works very hard to support her family. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs N. is also a cake seller in the local market. She is able to earn a small income to help the family. In order to increase income and to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Vannak N. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig food for her new business. Of her children, two work in security, one is seamstress in a garment factory and  the other three are students who also help in their mother's  businesses.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig food

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Иброгимов Тохир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Тохир имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает женскую обувь на рынке "Тиджорат". У него большая семья и ему приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он намерен закупить новый ассортимент сезонного товара.
texts.en:
Tohir I. lives in Yavan. He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. Tohir has a high school education. He has been working in sales for more than six years. He primarily sells women’s footwear in the market called Tidzhorat. He has such a large family that he must work very hard to feed them. He is taking out a loan to increase sales. He intends to buy a new assortment of seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase handbags & belts

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El  socio es el  Sr. Victor; el tiene 40 años de edad  y es soltero,   el socio es odontólogo y también se dedica a restaurar obras, el socio también estudio artes plásticas y es otro de sus pasatiempos favoritos y el cual también le genera ingresos económicos; El socio viene trabajando en la restauración de obras desde hace 12 años y para lo cual ahora requiere un pequeño presupuesto para restaurar 2 cuadros. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la restauración de dos obras.         

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “United for Success” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Victor; he is 40 years old and single. The member is an odontologist and restores artwork as well since he studied visual arts too, this is one of his favorite pastimes and it also gives him another source of income. Mr. Victor has restored works of art for some 12 years and he now needs a small budget to restore 2 paintings. The member needs the loan to restore 2 works of art.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payment of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to restore 2 works of art.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph K., a 48-year-old single video show operator in Mikindani, Mombasa supports his two children and has been in this business ten years. His income has been great and now he is requesting his second loan from KADET to open another video show shop.  Joseph anticipates a boost in business after this investment and thus the profit will be used to invest in any other business field which he finds appropriate.  In the future he would like to sustain his family and see his business grow.

loans.use: To open another video show shop

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina E. is an active entrepreneur managing a sari-sari (variety) store business. Her previous loan from ASHI has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase more inventory for her store. With the loan, Crispina has witnessed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted more customers with additional stock.

Prior to ASHI, Crispina had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Crispina finance the education of her four children. Since joining ASHI, Crispina has experienced positive changes in her life and uses the additional income to support daily expenditures of their family. Crispina hopes her business will continue to flourish so she can provide long-term financial stability for her family. 

Therefore, she is now requesting a KIVA loan, this time for 14,000 PHP, to purchase more inventory of food products for her store. This will allow her to grow her business further so that her children can fulfill his dreams of completing a college degree and experience a life that’s full of satisfaction.

With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, Crispina is hopeful that her business endeavor will provide steady income and improvements in her family’s quality of life that is currently far below the umbrella of poverty. Crispina’s hopes that her business will expand for them so they will have savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory of food products of her store.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Félix de 60 años, que es chofer; y sus 5 hijos mayores y 2  nietos; cada día se esfuerzan juntos por trabajar y  salir adelante. Desde hace 6 meses, instaló en el patio de su casa un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, y desde entonces obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Las 4 máquinas de videojuegos que tiene son alquiladas y se reparte las ganancias mensuales con el dueño. Como el negocio ha crecido en poco tiempo, requiere con urgencia refaccionar el patio de su casa, donde se encuentran las máquinas, pues las imperfecciones en el piso no dejan utilizar bien los videojuegos  a sus asiduos clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque dice que es tranquilo y lo puede desarrollar desde la comodidad de su casa, y lo más importante es que no descuida las labores del hogar. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio y comprar 2 máquinas de videojuegos para trabajar de manera independiente. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Diana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para refaccionar el patio de su casa, así como el pago de mano de obra del albañil, de esta manera  espera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Diana, age 59, lives in her own house together with her husband Félix, age 60, who is a driver, along with her 5 grown children and 2 grandchildren. Every day, they combine their efforts to work and get ahead. Six months ago, Diana established a business renting video games on the patio of her home. Since then, she has obtained a steady income which has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. The 4 video game machines she has are rented, and the monthly earnings are shared with the owner. Because the business has grown within a short time, she urgently needs to renovate the patio of her home, where the machines are located, because the imperfections in the floor do not allow her best customers to use the games effectively. Diana likes her work very much, because she says it is pleasant work, and she can do it from the comfort of her home, and most importantly, she does not need to neglect her work within the household. In addition, since she is an enterprising woman, she has plans to expand the business in the future and buy 2 video game machines so she can work independently. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time, since she does not want to disappoint the people who made this funding possible, which will permit her to keep working in her quest for progress. Diana plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying materials to renovate the patio of her home, and also paying masons for their work, and in this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Buying materials to renovate the floor of her patio [where her business is located] and hiring masons

loans.name: Auxilladora

texts.en:
Auxilladora I. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 59 years old. Auxilladora is widowed. She is a seamstress but focuses most of her time now farming and managing her sari-sari store. She cultivates her land to plant and harvest rice crops from it. She is hoping to have a better yield so she could earn more.

Auxilladora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Auxilladora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Auxilladora is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Donna

texts.en:
Donna O. is from the village of Brgy. Buliwao, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 31 years old. Donna is married and has 2 school-aged children. 

To make a living, Donna owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Donna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Donna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Donna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Donna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rhynna

texts.en:
Rhynna A. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 26 years old. Rhynna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready to wear clothing and used clothing in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhynna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional clothing products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothing products tobuy and sell

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto  a su familia en el caserío El Romero, una zona agrícola de pobladores humildes y trabajadores que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace más de dos años, el cuenta con animales menores los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel  de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Con esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Andrés desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Andrés is a 31 year old father living with his family in El Romero, a farming area of humble and hard working residents located in Mórrope district over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has worked for over two years raising small farm animals.  He raises them in his back yard.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who tend to visit the area where he lives.  This activity is what he supports his family with.

Andrés would like to acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to expand his business and sales.  He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help him reach this goal.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa  a 43 ans et est mariée.  Elle a 3 enfants.  Elle fait le commerce de céréales notamment  le maïs  et  haricot. Elle s’approvisionne à Kpalimé et  à Assahoun  et cumule 5 ans dans cette activité. Dans cette activité, elle a déjà  remboursé plusieurs crédit. Elle espère acheter  10 sacs de Maïs et 8 sacs d’haricot.
texts.en: Kossiwa is 43 years old and married. She has three children. She sells cereals, more specifically corn and beans. She stocks up in Kpalimé and in Assahoun and has five years of experience in this area. She already repaid several prior loans. She hopes to buy ten bags of corn and eight bags of beans.

loans.use: Purchasing corn and beans

loans.name: Gladys Wanjriu

texts.en:
Gladys Wanjriu M. is 33 years old, married to Peter Karanja, and they have three children. She has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last six years.

Gladys was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend, and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

In the future, Gladys hopes to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma D. is from the town of Panglao. She is 36 years old. Gemma is married and has three children aged five, three and one. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products to the local community.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is currrently in a business of selling alcohol. She is 27 years old and married to a policeman They have 3 children and 2 go to school. Rose hopes to buy a plot of land with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy stock more alcohol beverages to sell.

loans.name: Margrate's Group

texts.en:
Margrate is a resident of Ghafary town, which is located in Faisalabad. Faisalabad is Pakistan’s third largest city and well known for its textile industry. Her home is a small one containing two rooms. She moved here a year ago with her family.  She is a 48-year old housewife who stays at home and does her household work. Margrate is the mother of 3 sons who work in a telecom company for a low income. 

Her husband has a business repairing shoes. He operates his business from a bazaar and is well known for his good service. He can repair every type of shoe and make it usable. Although his business requires much struggle, he is a satisfied person. 

Margrate has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her husband’s business.  He wants to buy leather, thread and scissors, etc., which will help him do his job better and make more income.  Margrate is hopeful that the loan investment will make her husband’s business more profitable, which will result in a better standard of living for her family.  She is a new loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy leather, thread and scissors for shoe-repairing business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. She is 30 years old and married to a plot distributor, with four children and all of them go to school. Stella borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. She hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: Stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Basila

texts.ar: باسيلا سيدة تبلغ من العمر 56 عاماً، متزوجة ولها 4 اولاد. تعمل في بيع الالعاب والهدايا لها 5  سنوات في عملها وهي سعيدة به كثيراً،أعز شيء على قلب باسيلا هي عائلتها فهي كل اهتمامها تسعى  دائما الى مساعدة أفرادهاعلى تطوير أنفسهم. تحب العمل ولها زبائن من محيطها ما يميزها هو الانفراد في هذا العمل تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل العاب وكراسي بلاستكية للأطفال لها تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث انها تتلقى الدعم من العائلة والمحيط العملي
texts.en: Basila is 56 years old and married with four children. She works selling toys and gifts and has 5 years experience in this. She loves her family and they are her sole priority. She always wants to help her family by seeking progress for herself. She loves her work and has customers from her local area. What distinguishes her is the uniqueness of her business and with this loan she wants to purchase new stock, such as toys and plastic chairs for children. She has a good credit history with Al-Majmoua  and has the support of her family and local residents.

loans.use: to purchase new stock, such has new toys and plastic chairs for children

loans.name: Precentacion

texts.en:
Precentacion E. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 52 years old. Precentacion is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Precentacion owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, rice per kilogram, shampoo, soap, breads, biscuits & beverages in the local community. Precentacion has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Precentacion joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Precentacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Precentacion is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Precentacion from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en la  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lizeth: es soltera, la socia tiene 26 años de edad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de choclo con sus mamá, la socia tiene terrenos agrícolas con su mamá,  la socia ayuda a su mamá a sembrar y cosechar junto a su hermana y ellas llevan a vender al mercado al por mayor y menor, ella desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos y ayudar a su mamá.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Virgen Natividad". It is located in the province of Urubamba and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Lizeth.  She is single, 26 years old, and she has a business in buying and selling her mother's corn. She has agricultural fields together with her mother. She helps her mother sow and she harvests together with her sister. They take the product to sell at the market in wholesale and retail. She requires a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and to help her mother. 

She is very thankful for her loan and she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of seeds and fertilizers, and to help her mother.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham tiene 29 años de edad el estudio una carrera técnica y dice que ya no continuo con sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos, el esta casado con la señora Jessica la cual le ayuda a atender la tienda de bisutería y regalos, ellos tienen dos niñas una de 5 años la cual estudia el preescolar y la menor de dos años. Don Abraham esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pulseras, aretes de pedrería, anillos, gargantillas, corsetería, juguetes y regalos ya que tiene un local desde hace 5 años el cual renta muy cerca del centro de su población. El quisiera meter un poco de plata y surtirá su joyería y las cosas que vende en la cuidad de México ya que aya le dan un buen precio y así ganarle un poco mas a las cosas que vende, dice que la problemática que enfrenta es que desgracidamente hay mucha competencia. La meta que tiene don Abraham con su negocio es tener mas sucursales donde venda lo mismo y tener sus propios locales ya que las rentas salen un poco caras y ahí son perdidas de ganancias.
texts.en:
Abraham is 29 years old and studied a technical career, but he says he did not continue with his studies due to lack of funds.  He is married to Jessica who helps tend to the jewelry and gift shop.  They have two daughters, a 5-year-old who is in pre-school and a 2-year-old.  

Abraham is requesting a loan to purchase bracelets, beaded earrings, rings, necklaces, underwear, toys and gifts.  He has had the place for 5 years which he rents very near the center of town.  He wanted to put in a little money and take his jewelry and other items to sell in Mexico City. He sells them at a good price and will earn a little more than his costs.
