He says the problem he faces is that, unfortunately, there is plenty of competition. Abraham's goal with his business is to have more branches which sell the same items and have their own premises.  The rents are a bit expensive and contribute to lost profits.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, es empleado y al mismo tiempo vende medicinas, vive con su esposa, no tienen hijos, él trabaja como seguridad y vende medicinas en catalogo, parte de sus clientes son sus compañeros de trabajo.
Actualmente necesita comprar un lote de medicinas, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de cancelar un nuevo lote de medicamento y diversificar sus productos.
Su sueño es tener una casa propia, donde vivir con su familia de una forma digna.
texts.en:
Miguel is employed and also has a business selling medicines. He and his wife do not have children.

Miguel works as a security guard and also sells medicines through a catalog. Some of his customers are his coworkers. He currently needs to buy a shipment of medicines. With this loan, he will have the opportunity to place a new order of medicines and diversify his products.

His dream is to have a house of his own so that his family can live in a decent manner.

loans.use: to pay for a new shipment of medicines.

loans.name: Diosa

texts.en:
Diosa is 45 years old, and is a married woman with eight children. Her husband is a farmer.

Diosa buys bananas, cassava and sweet potatoes from farmers and then sells the products at her town's local market. Diosa has been in this business for two years. She earns about 2,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month from it. She has applied for a loan and plans to use it to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as banana and cassava.

Diosa hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell, such as bananas and cassava

loans.name: Berta Rosalva

texts.es: Berta Rosalva de 38 años de edad, reside con su hijo e hija en su casa. Los dos hijos de Berta se encuentran estudiando y tienen la esperanza que algún día lograrán ser grandes profesionales y podrán ayudar a su querida madre que con gran esfuerzo  les ayuda a continuar sus estudios. Ella se dedica a la venta de minutas en los lugares más concurridos en la zona donde reside. Gracias a Dios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes ya que se caracteriza por ser amable y por siempre tener ricas e higiénicas minutas  y sobre todo con buenos precios. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones y con mejores oportunidades a las que ella tuvo. Esto la ha impulsado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para comprar la materia prima necesaria para seguir manteniendo su negocio activo. Con el crédito piensa comprar variedad de jarabes, sal, limones, hielo, etc. De esta manera espera mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Berta Rosalva, 38, lives with her son and daughter in her house.  Berta’s two children are in school and they hope someday to become great professionals to help their beloved mother who has worked so hard to help them continue with their schooling.

She sells flavored ice drinks in the most popular areas where she lives.  Thanks to God she has managed to win over the trust of many customers since she is noted for her kindness and because she always has delicious, hygienic drinks at, above all, good prices.  Her dream is to see her children in better conditions and with better opportunities than she had.  

This has impelled her to make the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy raw materials needed to keep her business going.  She will use the loan to buy a variety of syrups, salt, lemons, ice, etc.  She hopes thus to improve her and her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of syrups, salt, lemons, ice. etc.

loans.name: Budondo Development Group

texts.en:
Feibe, aged 56, is now eight years down the road in her farming business in Jinja. The happily married mother of eight says she began this business with savings from her taxi transportation business. She still operates her taxi business although much of her emphasis now is on the farming business. 

Feibe also deals in cattle. The cattle sales business which she began recently has started picking up steam and she reckons she will earn a lot from it in the not so distant future. She mostly grows and sells beans, maize and bananas. Recently she has begun selling milk too. This business generates her profits to the tune of 150,000 shillings weekly. With this loan, Feibe says she is going to purchase more cattle to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle to resell

loans.name: Ivannia

texts.es: Ivannia, tiene la edad de 27 años, está en unión libre, ella vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposo que son sus mayores prioridades. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de materiales para hacer la crianza de pollos. Con le dinero el también pretende compra los alimentos y todo lo necesario para establecer la crianza de estos animales. El pretende establecer una  producción buena para satisfacer la necesidades del mercado local y asi generar ganancias para su familia Es el primero  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ivannia, 27, is in a common-law marriage and they live with their 2 children; they are her greatest priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy products for raising chickens.  With the money she will purchase food and everything necessary to start up a poultry business.  She plans to set up enough production to supply the local market and thus generate income for her family. 

 This is the first financing she has received from FUDECOSUR.  In the past she has had loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR offered better facilities and much lower rates.

loans.use: To buy food to fatten the chickens.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Laydy Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Laydy es socia del banco comunal Los Talvos, vive por una comunidad aledaña a la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y nos regala una hermosa vista de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, agricultura y mucha de su gente labora en la ciudad de Cuenca en diferentes áreas de trabajos.

La Señora. Laydy tiene 21 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija de 3 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

Nuestra socia trabaja en un gabinete de belleza, es profesional y esta actividad la aprendió en tres años ya que estudio en una academia, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su suegra, su crédito lo va a invertir para comprar algunos  materiales e instrumentos de belleza para iniciar con su propio gabinete.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su propio gabinete y continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Laydy is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Talvos” and lives in a community next to El Valle Parish. This place has cold weather and picturesque views. The people engage in trade, raising animals, and agriculture. However, many of them also work in the city of Cuenca in various jobs.

Sra. Laydy is 21 years old, married, and has a three-month-old daughter. Her husband works as a mason. They live in their own home.

Laydy works in a beauty salon as a professional stylist. She learned her trade three years ago at an academy. Laydy works Monday through Saturday from 9am to 7pm.

She was invited to join the Communal Bank by her mother-in-law and is now taking out her first loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of a few materials and beauty implements so that she can start her own salon. Her goals are to open her own salon and to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and beauty implements.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria tiene la edad de 75 años solo estudio hasta el tercer grado de primaria ya que en ese tiempo sus padres no tenian los recursos economicos para darle mas estudios, ella es viuda y solo tiene un hijo el cual ya esta casado.

Ella nos platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar y desde que falto su esposo a tenido que buscar la manera de salir adelante y a iniciado a vender tortillas, tacos y tortas, ella nos platica que cada tercer dia prepara una canasta llena de tortas y tacos y sale a ofrecerlos de casa en casa con sus amigos y conocidos de la comunidad y nos dice que gracias a Dios termina toda su venta, y sus ganancias las usa para comprar lo que ella necesita y reinvertir en la compra de insumos para la elabacion de su venta.

Tambien nos platica que algunos dias sus vecinos le hacen pedidos de tortillas a mano y se levanta desde muy temprano para ir al molino y despues para elaborar sus tortillas y poder entregar sus pedidos y de esta manera ganarse un poco de dinero extra, ella necesita este credito en la compra de maiz, pan, jamon, carne, mayoneza, lechuga, cebolla y leña para poder realizar sus actividades.

Ella nos dice que solo desea tener vida para seguir trabajando y salir adelante y envia un saludo a la fundacion un agradecimiento a la confianza que le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 75 years old and only completed school up to third grade since her parents didn’t have the money at the time to pay for more schooling.  She is a widow and only has one son who is married.

She tells us that her parents taught her to work at a young age and since her husband passed away, she has had to find a way to get ahead.  As a result, she has started to sell tortillas, tacos and sandwiches.  Every three days she prepares a basket of sandwiches and tacos and sells them house to house to her friends and acquaintances in the community.  She tells us that thanks to God, she sells all of them and uses her earnings to buy what she needs and to reinvest in the purchase of supplies to make her sales.

She also tells us that her neighbors sometimes put in orders for handmade tortillas, so she gets up very early to go to the mill and later make the tortillas and deliver the orders so that she can earn a bit of extra money.  She needs this loan for the purchase of corn, bread, ham, meat, mayonnaise, lettuce, onion and firewood in order to run her business.

She tells us that she wants to live to continue working and getting ahead.  She thanks Fundación Realidad A.C. for the trust they have given her.

loans.use: to sell food.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Mr. Phoeurn is 24 years old and lives in Orn Long Veng District, Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is married and has three children. He and his wife work hard together and depend on the income from the farming business to support their family's needs. They work as farmers; rice is their primary crop. Due to the rainy season and the lack of money, Mr. Phoeurn would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizer. He and his wife earn approximately 3 USD per day, but he is hopeful that, with a loan, he will be able to increase his income and be a better provider for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old businessman married to Joyce who is a farmer. He has been employed as the primary income earner and owns a retail shop as the secondary business for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Francis will use the loan to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice and cooking fat for his shop

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is 74 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nicanora is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nicanora has been fattening pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lizbeth Mireille

texts.es:
Lizbeth es una mujer divorciada, madre de tres hijos que tienen 16, 14 y 11 años. Los cuatro viven en la parroquia de "Río Verde" del Cantón "Santo Domingo". Santo Domingo es cantón y ciudad de la nueva Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, que era parroquia rural de Quito,  Santo Domingo está entre la costa y la sierra del Ecuador, punto de enlace entre Quito, Guayaquil, Portoviejo,  y otras ciudades importantes. Situado en los flancos externos de la cordillera occidental, así como en la planicie costeña inferior a los 1000 msnm, es la zona de mayor pluviosidad del país. Tiene una gran riqueza hidrológica: existen cinco cuencas y micro cuencas importantes. Es una zona climática lluviosa subtropical, posee una temperatura promedio de 22 °C.

Ella tiene un negocio de confección de ropa. Por la mañana ella es profesora en un colegio del cantón y luego ella trabaja en su taller de costura. El ser padre y madre de sus hijos ha sido duro ya que ella es quien solventa económicamente las necesidades de su hogar y por esta razón tiene dos trabajos. Aprovechando la temporada de entrada a clases ella quiere invertir en telas para uniformes y de esta manera aprovechar la gran clientela de la época. Así podrá tener mejores ingresos y así sus hijos podrán seguir estudiando.

El sueño que Lizbeth tiene como madre es de poder ver a sus hijos realizados tanto profesionalmente como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a divorced woman and a mother of three children, ages 16, 14 and 11.  The four of them live in the Río Verde parish in the Santo Domingo canton.  Santo Domingo is a canton and city in the new Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, which used to be a rural parish of Quito.  Santo Domingo is between the coast and the mountain range in Ecuador, a connecting point between Quito, Guayquil, Portoviejo and other important cities.  It is situated on the outer edges of the western mountains and in the lower coastal plain at 1000 meters above sea level.  This area has the highest rainfall in the country.  There is a great abundance of water as there are 5 important river basins and micro basins here.  It is a rainy, subtropical zone and the average temperature is 22 °C.  

Lizbeth has a business making clothing.  In the morning, she is a teacher at the local school and then she works in her sewing shop.  It has been difficult being both mother and father to her children as she provides the only source of income to cover the household expenses and because of this, she has two jobs.  Since it is the of the start of the school year, she wants to purchase fabric to make uniforms and take advantage of the large number of customers during this season.  This way she will be able to increase her income so her children will be able to continue studying.  

Lizbeth's dream as a mother is to see her children achieve success professionally as well as in their personal lives.

loans.use: purchase fabric to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Munochot

texts.ru: Муночот разведенная. На воспитании имеет двоих несовершеннолетних детей. Семью она кормит выручкой с продажи на рынке верхней женской одежды. Раньше Муночот помогала маме и после того как она развелась с мужем и осталось одна с двумя детьми она решила начать свой собственный бизнес. Она работает с “Имон интернешнл ” более 6 лет и имеет отличную кредитную историю. Так как наступает зима, она хочет увеличить ассортимент своих товаров за счет, полученного займа. Приобретение новых товаров поможет Муночот в получении хорошей прибыли от выручки.
texts.en: Munochot is divorced.  She is raising two adolescent children.  She supports her family with the profits from the sales of women's outerwear at the market.  Previously, Munochot helped her mother, but after she got divorced from her husband and was left with two children, she decided to start her own business.  She has been working with "Imon International" for over six years and has an excellent credit history.  Due to the onset of winter, Munochot wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise by using this loan.  Buying new merchandise will help Munochot with making a good profit from the sales.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a divorced woman with five children who are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Nzara has operated a café for the past twelve years.  Her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the lack of enough help in her café when she is working. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 25,000 KES, Nzara wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her café. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it does not have complex legal requirements to qualify to get loans.

loans.use: buy wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her cafe

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Carlos Alberto  se dedica   a laborar como agente de seguridad en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace siete año. Es casado y con dos personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Carlos Alberto ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para invertirlo en un pequeño negocio que tiene de comida una parte y resto para compra  de materiales de construcción tale como  bloque, hierro,  para poder realizar un anexo de cuarto, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto works as a security guard at a state institution in the municipality of Managua; he’s been in his job for seven years.  He’s married and has two people in his care and he is his family's provider.

Carlos Alberto has called upon Ceprodel to request a loan to invest part of it in a small food business he has and the rest to buy building materials and supplies like concrete blocks and rebar to add a room which will improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Jason has a shop that sells snacks like the native Filipino original binangkal. He has had this business for four years. He requested a loan for 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Jason has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jason hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: La señora Sandra a sus 30 años de edad es madre de un hijo de 9 años de edad. La señora Sandra se dedica a la producción agrícola, tiene tres vacas lecheras y un caballo en el cual transporta mercancía; este trabajo lo alterna con el oficio de operaria agrícola en un cultivo de flores. El trabajo del trasporte de mercancía lo hace con la ayuda de su hermano. La señora Sandra desea comprar otra vaca lechera con el fin de poder aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera brindarle a su hijo y hermano una mejor calidad de vida y educación, la señora Sandra no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de su hijo y tiene ella sola que responder por las obligaciones y bienestar de su hogar. A futuro la señora Sandra desea tener un mayor número de animales y generar empleos directos en la zona.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra, 30, is the mother of a 9 year old son. She is a farmer and has three milk cows and a horse which she uses to transport merchandise. She alternates these tasks with her work as an employee in flower cultivation.  She does the job of transporting merchandise with the help of her brother.

Sandra wants to buy another milk cow with the goal of increasing her income and thereby providing her son and brother with an education and a better quality of life.. She cannot rely on her son’s father for support and is alone responsible for her household expenses and welfare. In the future she wants to own a larger number of animals and generate local jobs in the area.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: За время отработки первого кредита по линии Кива, Нурбюбю показала себя ответственным и дисциплинированным человеком. Кредит позволил Нурбубу расширить ассортимент мебели и увеличить количество клиентов, повысив тем самым продажи. В целях дальнейшего расширения своей деятельности, Нурбюбю обратилась в компанию "Бай - Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом на покупку нескольких кубов леса, фанеры и станка. Это позволит Нурбюбю оптимизировать процесс заказов на мебель, так как сырье уже будет в цехе, что сэкономит время и ускорит производство необходимых образцов.
texts.en: During the process of the first loan through Kiva Nurbubu showed herself to be a responsible and disciplined woman. The loan allowed Nurbubu to expand the variety of furniture and increase the number of customers, thus increasing sales. In order to further expand the business Nurbubu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som to buy a few cubes of wood, plywood and machinery. This will allow Nurbubu to optimize orders for furniture as the raw materials will already be in the shop which will save time and speed up production of the necessary samples.

loans.use: to purchase materials for furniture manufacturing.

loans.name: Berniece

texts.es:
La señora Berniece, tiene 53 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 17, 29, 30 y 35 años de edad, vive en la colonia las Torres, Choloma, Cortes.

Hace 20 años que doña Berniece se dedica a la elaboración y venta de espejos con marco de aluminio de varios tamaños,  de 2x3 pulgadas hasta 8x10 pulgadas.
Ella es muy trabajadora a este negocio le dedica 10 horas diarias.  Distribuye este producto a clientes fijos que tienen negocios en el mercado local.
Para mantener este negocio a solicitado financiamiento a ODEF, este préstamo es el numero 48 y es para invertir en materia prima como compra de vidrio, aluminio y alambre para elaborar espejos.
Con  las ganancias a logrado darle educación básica a sus hijos, también esta motivada por ampliar el negocio y aumentar los ingresos para reparar  su casa.
texts.en:
Berniece, 53, is a single mother.  She has four children who are 17, 29, 30 and 35 years old.  She lives in the Las Torres neighborhood in Choloma, Cortes.

Berniece has been making and selling aluminum framed mirrors in various sizes from 2x3 inches to 8x10 inches for the last twenty years.  She is very hardworking and spends ten hours per day at work.  She sells her products to regular customers that have businesses in the local market.

To stay in business she’s requested financing from ODEF.  This is loan #48 and it will be used to buy raw materials like glass, aluminum and wire to make mirrors.

With profits earned she managed to provide basic education for her children.  She’s also motivated to enlarge the business and increase income in order to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like glass, aluminum and wire to make mirrors.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school.  She has been working hard to manage her small market, which sells food. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay her child’s school fees. She hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

She is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training. The ELA program has increased Juliet's future prospects by helping her to learn how to save her money.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap, 27, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in agriculture for over three years, and has extensive experience and successes in her career. She is involved in growing rice and raising poultry to sell to generate income for the family. Her husband helps her run the business. 

Sopheap's husband has an old motorbike that he uses to sell grilled eggs around the village. Because the old motorbike breaks down too often, Sopheap is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a new motorbike so her husband can easily carry his grilled eggs to sell. By doing so, her family's finances will be improved. In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike to for her husband to carry grilled eggs to sell

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) from Muñoz branch and currently owns a motorized tricycle for already 21 years as one of her source of income. She is currently blessed of having 3 children and a hardworking husband, Ignacio who is working as a driver.

Mercedes has many plans for her family. She wants to have enough savings for them and sustain their daily needs. However, vehicle maintenance is one of her challenge in the business since she’s lacking supporting capital. She’s thinking of ways on how to get one that’s why she decided to apply for a Php 10, 000 loan. The amount will be used for buying another unit of motorized tricycle and the spare amount will be added to her current savings account. 

Mercedes  is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: The amount will be used for buying another unit of motorized tricycle and the spare amount will be added to her current savings account.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.en: Don Melecio is a tailor who produces menâ€™s suits and other clothing. He has 6 children who he cares for all by himself because of a wife that abandoned the family. His dream is to support his children so that they may receive a college education that will help them make a better life from themselves. Although he has over 25 years of experience the lack of capital does not allow him to produce at higher quantities. He is terrified of the loan sharks but is confident he can handle the loans.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Angèle

texts.en:
Angèle A. is a young woman and the mother of three. Her husbands, a carpenter by trade, does not have his own workshop and therefore lacks the income to cover household expenses. This is the situation under which Ms. A. has set up her truck farming activities cultivating food along the banks of the river that flows along her village. Her project is highly successful, but it needs a lot more work and financing to turn her business into a professional one, thus producing a greater benefit. To do this, she needs substantial financial means. And so she is requesting a loan of $650 to buy a motorized pump to facilitate the work. This will augment her production of produce to meet customer demands. The success of her plans will also allow her to increase family revenues and to improve living conditions at home.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Angèle est une jeune dame, mère de trois (3) enfants. Son mari, menuisier de profession, n’a pas un atelier de travail et par conséquent ne dispose pas de revenu lui permettant d’assumer les charges du ménage. C’est dans ce contexte que Madame A. a aménagé les abords du fleuve qui longe son village pour cultiver les produits maraîchers. C’est un projet très florissant mais qui mérite beaucoup de travail et de financement. Elle a l’ambition de rendre son activité professionnelle pour plus de rentabilité. Pour cela, il lui faut des moyens financiers importants. Elle sollicite à cet effet un crédit de $650 qui va servir à acheter une motopompe pour faciliter le travail. Ceci va augmenter la production maraîchère pour la satisfaction de la clientèle. Le succès du projet permettra également d’augmenter le revenu familial et d’améliorer les conditions de vie dans le ménage.

loans.use: To buy a motorized pump

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is 45 years old, married, and has five years experience selling foodstuffs. Her son helps her buy and sell her stocks of food. She manages the cash, organization, cleaning, and packaging of the goods. She is requesting a loan so that she can offer more products to her customers. Participating in the loan program will enable her to increase her sales and earn more money to support her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase her stock of foodstuffs and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy at wholesale and sell at retail

loans.name: Nemecio

texts.es:
Nemesio works as a bricklayer from Monday through Saturday. His wife takes care of the work of the home, and all his children are independent. His home is located in the Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined for the construction of stairs. As we can see in the photo, his stairs are made of wood and it is dangerous to climb them because they are deteriorating over time. His work allows him to accept this loan, since he has construction experience and he himself will build the stairs on the weekends.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Nemesio trabaja como albañil de lunes a sábado, su esposa realiza labores de casa, y todos sus hijos son independientes. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz. Es tercera vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la construcción de gradas, como podemos ver en la foto sus gradas son de madera y es un peligro para poder subir ya que con el tiempo se fue deteriorando. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en construcción y será el mismo quien construya las gradas los fines de semana.

loans.use: Construction of stairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her kale business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. She comes from a family of 7 brothers and 5 sisters. Her family is very poor and sometimes they sell coconuts and cocoa along the roadside or around town. When Sina got married 20 years ago, her husband came from a family who relied mostly on vegetable farming. Sina heard of SPBD through women of the village, and this is her second loan with the program. She is very thankful for the chance to develop her business and help financially support her family.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
It’s difficult to know if customers frequent Esther M.’s bar to drink beer or to receive one of her big, beautiful smiles. Esther established the business in 2006 and it generates a monthly profit of about US$ 150. She requires a loan of US$ 550 to purchase additional stocks in bulk. Esther is married to husband Melkiori, with whom she has one child, daughter Gloria.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer and soft drinks in bulk

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak S., 47, works with her husband on their farmland growing rice and can generally make only about $2 each day in revenue. Mrs. Prak S. has six children. One of them is self-employed as a carpenter making tables, chairs, cabinets and variety of wooden furniture; one is currently unemployed and the rest are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Prak S. is currently requesting a loan to enable her to purchase a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her unemployed child to drive in order to generate additional income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk-Tuk (motorcycle taxi) for her unemployed child to generate additional income for the family

loans.name: Asha's Tunyanyuane Group

texts.en:
Rose K. is 40 years old and married with four children, ages 21, 17, 14 and 10. Rose owns a small grocery store that she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

In the past, Rose has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members who have businesses in marketing, food vending and managing a saloon.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve and accomodate her business premises

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es:
Senora Sarita is a member of the communal bank called La Familia, located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali, Peru. She is 46 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband works as a driver. With the first loan she received, she invested in a business preparing and selling food. Today she continues to run this business, getting up at 7am to prepare breakfast for her family, and then dedicates herself to her business during the day.

With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals as well as the fruits she needs to prepare her drinks. Sarita is a hardworking woman who has been able to help improve the quality of life for her family. She is grateful for the help she has received for her business.

La señora Sarita pertenece al Banco Comunal La Familia, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Eduardo del Águila Tello Mz A Lt 25, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 46 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es motocarrista. Sarita con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un negocio de venta de comida. En la actualidad ella cuenta un negocio de venta de comida para lo cual se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de su hijos, y de su esposo,luego se dedica a la venta de sus comidas en una aserradero hasta las 3 pm. Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará productos alimenticios para la preparación de sus comidas y frutas para la preparación de sus refrescos. Sarita se considera una mujer trabajadora que supo salir adelante con sus hijos y con su esposo ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS NEEDED TO PREPARE THE MEALS SHE SELLS, CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS AND PROVIDE FOR HER FAMILY'S WELLBEING.

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Gervasia P. has been the leader of this group for six months now, and they are currently applying for their second loan with Esperanza International. Her plans for the future are to continue expanding her sewing business and to buy a new sewing machine. Gervasia's parents passed away when she was four years old and she has had a very hard life, but she thanks God that she is still alive and now can provide a better life for her children. When she is not working she enjoys reading and watching television, and her favorite foods are beans and meat.

Thank you for supporting this group!

loans.use: To buy more material and to save for a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach R., 48, is a widower and rice miller who lives in Kampong Cham province with one of his children. He typically makes $3 a day and is supported in part by his children.

Because his children are the biggest sources of his income, Lach R. wants to help them. With a loan of $1,000 from CREDIT, he wants to buy a motorbike to transport his children to and from work. This will cut down on public transportation costs that are a big part of family expenses. He also wants to buy some gas for the motorbike and some rice. He hopes to make a profit from the rice by buying it with the husk attached and taking it off for resale.

Lach R. has an entrepreneurial mindset and is always seeking ways to diversify his family’s income. In the future, he hopes to replace his old rice mill, because he believes that a new one will increase his income further.

loans.use: To buy rice and a motorbike

loans.name: Koami Sylvain

texts.fr:
Born on 20 February 1965, Mr. Koami Sylvain T. is married and has five people in his care. He ensures the minimum needs of his family thanks to the meagre monthly revenue he draws from the sale of petrol, an activity he has pursued for five years.

To increase his income in order to improve his family's standard of living, he is asking for a loan. This amount will allow him to increase his purchasing power and will serve as the working capital required to secure and maximize his income.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Né le 20 février 1965 Monsieur T. Koami Sylvain est marié et a cinq personnes à charge. Il assure le minimum vital à sa famille grâce au maigre revenu mensuel qu’il tire du commerce de pétrole ; profession qu’il exerce depuis cinq ans.

Pour accroître son revenu afin d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de sa famille, il sollicite un crédit. Ce fonds lui permettra d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat et lui servira de fonds de roulement nécessaire à la sécurisation et à la maximisation de son revenu.

loans.use: To buy equipment and petrol

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es:
Marianela is a member of the Community Bank Palmeras.

Marianela is single and 32 years old. She studied the major of hotel management and she also studied cooking and mixing drinks. Marianela sells clothes, jewelry, shoes, and accessories that she offers to friends and relatives. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. On occasional opportunities, she prepares food for different events, family agreements that she contracts.

Marianela needs a loan of 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of shoes. Marianela's dreams are to have a hotel business where she offers all the services needed by tourists and help the neglected elderly.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Marianela es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras.

Marianela es soltera y tiene 32 años, Marianela estudio la carrera de administración hotelera, además estudio cocina y preparación de tragos, Marianela vende ropa, joyas, zapatos, accesorios que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. En algunas oportunidades prepara comida para diferentes eventos, compromisos familiares que le contratan.

Marianela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatos. Los sueños de Marianela es tener una empresa hotelera que brinde todos los servicios necesarios al turista y ayudar a los ancianos abandonados.

loans.use: Marianela needs a loan of 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of shoes.

loans.name: Santa Andrea

texts.es: La Señora Santa Andrea A. Álvarez de 55  años quien es originaria  del cantón Panquix municipio y departamento de Totonicapán. Acudió a las oficinas de ASDIR para poder obtener un financiamiento  para la compra de mercaderías específicamente se dedica al Comercio (tienda), el cual es un oficio que heredó de su padre quien laboró en la misma hace ya varios años. En un principio se dedicaba también al comercio en su  tienda  pequeña   ya que en estos últimos años fue creciendo su negocio  que por  lo tanto   de este crédito que solicita le servirá para comprar más mercaderías que surtirá su tienda de otros productos básicos el cual le traería muy buenas ganancias en su actividad de comercio,   con el financiamiento pretende mejorar la economía de su familia que también podrá  aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Santa Andrea is 55 years old and originally from Panquix, Totnicapán. She went to the offices of Kiva partner ASDIR to be able to obtain a loan to purchase specific supplies for her store, which she inherited from her father after he labored there for many years. She started out working in the small shop and in these past few years it has been growing, which is the reason she is requesting this loan to purchase more supplies that will stock her store with more everyday products. She has been making good earnings with her work, and with the loan she expects to improve her family's finances and also be able to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for store

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Mr. Sopheak C., 36, and his wife, Mrs. Sophoin Choub, 30, live on an island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of their children study in a local school.

Mr. Sopheak has been a silk weaver since 2006, a skill he learned from his wife. Mrs. Sophoin has been a silk weaver since she was young. The couple sells their finished products to a man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Besides being a weaver, Sopheak is also a mason.

He is requesting a loan of 300 to purchase silk materials for his weaving business.

loans.use: Purchasing silk material for weaving

loans.name: María Del Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío inició el negocio para ayudar un poco a su esposo en los gastos de la casa y tener un empleo que le diera  ingresos necesarios para darles mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Comenzó hace 1 año su negocio, ante  la necesidad de tener un empleo sin descuidar la  a sus  hijos 
Fue que decidió empezar a vender blancos por catalogo, poco a poco fue adquiriendo  clientes y actualmente esto le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por 3,000MXN que pagara en 6 meses para  comprar colchas y cortinas y así poder tener un poco más de surtido de mercancía.
texts.en:
Rocio started the business to help her husband a little bit with the household expenses and to have some employment that will give her the necessary income to provide her children with a better quality of life. She started with her business 1 year ago when faced by the need to get a job without neglecting her children.

She decided to start selling home furnishings like bedding, curtains, etc. from a catalog. Slowly, she has been gaining customers and currently she is able to get better earnings.

She needs a 3,000MXN loan, which will be paid in 6 months, to buy bedspreads, drapes, and curtains and have a better variety of merchandise available.


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo A. y su esposa María Inés Esquivel son originarios de San Luis Potosí, México; pero tiene 10 años viviendo en Nuevo Laredo y 9 años dedicándose a su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Sin embargo, a su negocio le falta más variedad de mercancía y además desean iniciar la venta de alimentos congelados t así obtener ingresos adicionales para su hijo que actualmente es estudiante. 
Por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Guillermo A. and his wife, María Inés Esquivel, are originally from San Luis Potosí, México. They have been living in Nuevo Laredo for ten years, however, dedicating themselves for nine of the years to their business selling groceries. Regardless, their business is lacking a wider variety of products. In addition, they would like to start selling frozen foods to earn extra income for their son who is currently a student. For this reason, they are requesting a loan so they can purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a member of the Cielo (Sky) Village Bank. He is 30 years old and lives with his partner and their two children. Hector works as a taxi driver, and transports passengers within the city of Ayacucho as well as to other nearby villages. He has been working as a taxi driver for eight years. Hector also conducts guided tours of local tourist attractions like the Wari ruins and the town of Quinoa; he gives his tours in Spanish and in Quechua. 

Hector was held up by highway robbers last August while returning from a town outside of Ayacucho. The robbers took the papers to his car as well as some of his car parts. He currently has some outstanding debt as a result of the cost of replacing these parts. 

Hector is requesting a loan of 750 soles to buy a new battery for his car. His dream for the future is to repay his outstanding debt and to build his own home.

loans.use: Buy a new car battery

loans.name: Fatimo

texts.en: Fatimo L. is 52 years old and married with four children. Fatimo lives in Bodija, Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells provisions like noodles, bathing soap, detergents, toothbrush, etc. She hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Khanam Gull Group

texts.en:
Khanam Gull is the group leader of the Zaya Jan group. They live in district 10 of Kabul Afghanistan. There are two members in this group and each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. 
Khanam Gull wants to take the loan for her husband’s business of general store   he wants to buy necessary material for his shop. And Hanefa wants to take a loan for his husband’s business of of taxi driver. He is working seven days a week to develop his business and cover his families expanses. They want to progress their business and to have a high monthly income to support their families in a better way.

loans.use: their very happy with this loan

loans.name: Agathe

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! Agathe M. is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company.  She has owned a shop selling clothes, shoes, and bags in the Nyarugenge neighborhood of the capital city for two years.  She works daily from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm and earns approximately 400,000 Rwandan Francs per month before expenses ($800 USD).  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back over a period of eight months to increase her stock at her shop.  Specifically, she intends to purchase more shoes and bags because they are popular items.  

Agathe is 35 years old, married, and has four children.  Her children are two, three, five and eleven years old.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of shoes and bags

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 49 years old and married with seven children. She sells provisions and drinks to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She hopes to expand this business. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Tân Phan, 57, lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has three adult children. To make a living, T. works in a family member's business venture running a general store in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Tân has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2004, Tân joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services in order to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Tân has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Tân is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by this TYM Fund borrower. Tân plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is divorced with 4 children and has received an education through primary school. Since 2008, she has worked as a trader selling soft drinks and other food supplies at Bronybina near Elmina. Mary uses her income to pay for school fees and bills. She will use this loan to purchase more soft drinks in crates and other food supplies to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to save and to work on completing part of her house.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks in crates and other food supplies to sell.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe  tiene 59 años de edad está casado con Leonidas Gómez, de 46 años,  quien le ayuda en el negocio en la atención a los clientes.
Inició el negocio hace más de cinco años por iniciativa propia, percatándose de que no había una despensa en el barrio, lo cual le va muy bien y ya cuenta con clientela formada.
Tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y el otro menor de edad que vive con ellos.
 Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías en general  tales como azúcar, harina, yerba, arroz, fideos, panificados y otros.
texts.en:
Felipe is 59 years old, and married to Leonidas Gómez, who is 46 years old and helps Felipe attends to his customers. Felipe began his business over 5 years ago on his own accord, after realizing that there was no grocery store in his neighborhood. His business is going very well, and has a stable customer base. Felipe has two children: one adult, and a minor who still lives with Felipe. Felipe requests a loan to purchase merchandise, such as sugar, flour, yerba mate, rice, noodles, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store, such as sugar, flour, rice, and noodles.

loans.name: Aggrey

texts.en:
K. Aggrey is a 48-year-old businessman. He deals in timber in a mass market area in the town and has been doing this business for ten years. He has four children of whom two are in university.

He is requesting the loan to bring more timber from the forest and from neighboring countries like the Congo. Since he has a residential house, he is targeting to construct other houses for rent on the same plot to generate more income.

loans.use: To bring more timber from the forest and from neighboring countries like the Congo

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia A. is from the town of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old, married, and has six adult children. Lucia owns and operates a vegetable and spice business, primarily planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lucia is just starting this business. In 2009, Lucia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is 25 years old. She is a married mother of one child (girl) who is currently in school. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in their community. She trades in fresh fish sales, a business she has done for a year now. She takes stock of fresh fish from Kumasi. She sometimes buys on credit and repays her suppliers in a week’s time. She says she buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has increased her market share and lots of people buy from her stand in the market. She needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. She dreams big, to provide support to her husband in taking care of their home. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Sofia Mercedes

texts.es: Sofía Mercedes V. A. tiene la edad de 56 años. Tiene la actividad económica de alquiler de sillas. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente laboraba como docente, pero debido a su edad avanzad tuvieron que despedirla. Por lo que Sofía tenía que buscar un medio de vida  para su hijo porque ella realizaba las dos funciones de padre y madre a la misma vez para su hijo. Fue por esto que decide establecer este negocio de alquiler de sillas, inicio solamente con 50 sillas, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos fue incrementando sus productos. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de sillas, mesas plásticas y además ella viaja hasta Managua porque el mucho más favorable. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Sofia Mercedes V. A. is 56 years old. For a living she has been renting out chairs for 7 years. Previously she worked as a teacher but becase of her advanced age she was laid off, but as she is responsible for her son being father and mother at the same time, she needed to find another way of providing for him economically. Therefore she decided to set up the chair rental business. She started with only 50 chairs but with the help of the loans the number increased. The money requested is for work capital to buy chairs and plastic tables. She also travels to Managua as it is more favorable. It is her wish to continue with her business as it is her only source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Maria es casada, tiene 52 años y 5 hijos, Maria tiene una Calderia en un local alquilado, en donD. venD. caldo D. gallina, bebidas, y los días domingos venD. comida típica, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. fideo, arroz y sal.
Los sueños D. Maria son mejorar su negocio, tener un local propio y que su hija culmine sus estudios.

loans.use: Para la compra de fideo, arroz y sal.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Dabadakondji à Lomé. Elle est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants. Elle a appris la couture, mais elle a compris que c’est plus rentable pour elle  d’exercer le commerce des produits de mercerie à savoir les popelines et divers tissus. Sa boutique se situe à côté d’un grand centre d’apprentissage de la couture à Lomé, ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes affaires. Elle a une clientèle bien assez fournie. Actuellement elle a besoin de renouveler une partie de son stock ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter de petits rouleaux de fils de différentes couleurs, 15 rouleaux de popelines et différents tissus de mercerie.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Dabadakondji district in Lomé. She is married and the mother of four children. She learned how to sew but has come to understand that it’s more profitable for her to do commerce in sewing supplies, namely poplins and various fabrics. Her store is located next to a large training center for sewing in Lomé, and this enables her to do a good business. She has a rather well-off customer base. Currently, she needs to renew part of her inventory; for this reason, she’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy small spools of thread of different colors, 15 rolls of poplins, and different fabrics.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Emmaculada

texts.en:
Emmaculada is engaged in buying and selling of used emptied bottles in their whole village of Cabisera 17-21 through the aid of their motor vehicle. Aside from this, she is also purchasing ten kiloa of longganisa once a week as additional source of income. For the continuous improvement of her business, she is now requesting to borrow a loan of PHP10,000.  This amount will be of great help in maintaining her buy and sell business and so with their motorcycle that they are also using as their service.  

Emmaculada is 32 years old.  They live in Cabisera 17-21 of ILagan, Isabela.  She is married to Jerivic, a tricycle operator and they have two children.  The eldest is now 15 years old, presently studying in high school. Their youngest is just nine months old. Emmaculada never lose hopes even if sometimes there are trials that come along their way. According to her, she always surrenders her problems to our loving God who never left them.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Genedina

texts.en:
Genedina is 42 years of age and is married to Dominador S., who works as a farmer. They have five loving children, namely: Julie Ann - 21 years of age, a cashier in a restaurant; Mary Jane - 19 years of age, at college level; Arnel - 18 years of age, a 4th year high school student; Sheryl Ann - 14 years of age, an out-of-school youth; and Mary Ann - 4 years of age. They live happily together at Pulo, San Francisco, Cauayan City, a rural and plain area. Their house is near San Francisco Elementary School, and in front of the Roman Catholic church.

Genedina has managed the vending of fruits and vegetables in their village for almost eighteen years and her daily net income is PHP 400. She wants to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 from lenders as additional working capital for her business since she wants to buy additional products to sell.

Genedina wants to maintain her small business in a productive way in order to help her family’s finances.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou C. is from the village of Lauigan, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marilou is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business in the retail sector making operating a variety store.  Her main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling variety of products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her variety store

loans.name: Zar Ghona

texts.en:
Zar Ghona is daughter of Q. D.. She is married with three children. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. Her two sons and one daughter are students at school. She is 45 years old.

Zar Ghona wants to take an individual loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business and wants to make her new shop larger and buy new machines for her business. She expands and progresses her business and she has more clients in the business.

Zar Ghona thanks AFSG and all Kiva lenders for the small loans process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: expand and grow her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia O. is from the village of Tru-Cut in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Antonia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Antonia owns and operates a food stall where she sells fruits and vegetables in the local community. Antonia has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Antonia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Antonia's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide financial support to her extended family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong S. is 52 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Takeo province. She and her daughter, who we see here, make a living by weaving scarves. On a typical day, they earn about $3 by working together. Mrs. S.'s husband is a farmer and makes $2 a day. She has applied for a loan for $1,200, which she will use to buy silk that she and her daughter will weave into scarves and sell at the local market.

loans.use: To buy silk to weave into scarves

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua is 41 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Two have finished junior and senior high school respectively, while the rest are still in primary school. To support her household, she sells cereals like maize and groundnuts in the community market to her loyal customers. She says that the sales of these products is very lucrative, and with her nineteen years of experience she will be able to increase her market size with the support of loan assistance. She takes delivery of stock from the nearby communities. Therefore, she wants a loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially the children's education and business expansion. She would be grateful for your loan support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut and beans.

loans.name: Marnith

texts.es:
La señora Marnith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos. 

Marnith, decidió implementar su negocio de ventas de salchipapas, se inicio desde muy joven por iniciativa propia y ya lleva años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario tiene buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados. 

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, vende en las noches. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como: aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para remplazar a sus utensilios antiguos, así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Marnith, se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, como implementar más su salchipaperia al mismo tiempo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marnith belongs to “Las Orquídeas II” Community Bank, located in Tarapoto District, San Martín Provence, San Martín Department. She is single, 27 years old, and has no children. Marnith decided to set up a business selling salchipapas (french fries with fried hot dogs). She started it on her own at a very young age, and now has years of experience in this activity. She is located in her own house, in a well equipped environment, where she serves her clients. She tells us that she regularly has good sales because of the flavorful seasoning that she puts on her food. Today she continues in the same business, and she is very happy with her job that she does day after day, selling during the night. She personally helps her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of 1,000.00 soles she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of her food such as: gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, chicken, and vegetables. Also, part of the money will be invested in new utensils to replace her old ones so that she can better attend to her clients. Marnith, feels full of life, and desires to continue moving forward. She has many dreams and goals in her life, such as expanding her business while also appreciating the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa P. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a general store where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elsa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Norn

texts.en: Mrs. Norn M. is 60 years old and she lives in Trapeang Kak village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chrin Oun, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare field where they grow crops to earn a living for their family. In order to change their living conditions, Mrs. Norn M. decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 piglets and pig food for pig breeding. She hopes the loans will increase the family's income. Mrs. Norn M. is a mother of two children, one of whom is employed in the garment factory, while the other one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy 10 piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 46 years old, separated from her spouse and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan Gloria has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria Yolanda

texts.es: La  Sra. Gloria Yolanda V. M. es de estado civil casada, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, se desempeña como profesora de primaria  también cuenta con una pulpería para la obtención de otros ingresos, este crédito lo solicito para la compra de mercaderías alusivas a la época de verano y alguna mejoras en el local del negocio.
texts.en:
Gloria Yolanda V. M. is married and has two, school-age children. She is an elementary school teacher but also has a grocery store as an additional source of income. She will use the funds to buy seasonal summer products and to make some physical improvements to her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise and make some improvements to her grocery store.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is the mother of ten children and she supports them by selling fish around her community. She started this business a long time ago and this is the only way she can support her family.

Anecita sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to have additional capital for her business. She asked for a loan of 5,000 Php. This will be helpful in improving her business and will not be burdensome to repay since it has a low interest rate.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita M. is a 41-year-old married woman with five children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Brgy Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Amelita has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 10 years now and earns a living by running a general store business. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and, at the same time cut fuel costs, and save money in the long run.		

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products:
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit.  To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients.  In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes.  The solar lantern offers a free, environment-friendly renewable source of energy, that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.   

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 33 years old, married with two children who are 7 and 18 years old.  Beatrice is a self-employed businesswoman wholesaling sacks of Irish potatoes, and she has been in this business for a long time.  The hours of her business are from early morning until late in the evening hours.

With the problem of not being able to satisfy the demand of her customers, Beatrice is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which will allow her to increase the quantity of Irish potatoes she can sell.  With this additional quantity, Beatrice expects to earn more profits, which in turn will allow her to be financially stable and continue taking good care of her family.

loans.use: A large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 45 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica Martha, es la bisutería con perlas, es especialista haciendo  rosarios y denarios, cada una es distinta de otras creaciones. Todos sus modelos los ha logrado fotografiarlas y hacer este catálogo que muestra, con la que ofrece a sus clientes y con mucha facilidad le hacen algún pedido. Su comprador potencial, es la iglesia y algunos mayoristas del mercado central. Años atrás trabajaba sola,  actualmente su hija y otras personas trabajan con ella, de ese modo sus pedidos son entregados a tiempo. Se siente a  gusto con lo que hace, ya que no descuida sus labores domesticas; lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella es no contar con materiales en stock,  perdiendo así varios contratos. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su mercado y después construir su casa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete a pagar todas las cuotas oportunamente. Con este crédito que solicita, comprará cruces y alambres por kilos, de ese modo pueda abastecer todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Martha is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and 2 kids in their own house. Martha makes costume jewelry with pearls. She specializes in rosaries, and each one is a unique piece. She photographs every one and has compiled a catalog of all her designs to help her customers order them. Her potential customers are the church and wholesalers at the central market. She used to work alone, but now her daughter and others work with her so she can complete the orders in time. She enjoys what she does because it allows her to work without neglecting her family duties. She has been doing this for 12 years, and the most difficult part is to keep materials in stock, which has caused her to lose orders in the past. She wants to expand her market and then build a house. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows it will help her increase her working capital. She promises to pay back her installments on time. She will use the money to buy crosses and wire wholesale to help her fill her orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crosses and wire to make rosaries in order to finish a set of orders

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua
Delia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, Delia se dedica a L. venta D. ropa y cosméticos por catálogos D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. sus clientes que son amigos y familiares, L. mayoría D. sus ventas son al crédito. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cremas, perfumes, labiales.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank Imasumacc, which means How Lovely in Quechua.

Delia is married and has 1 child. Delia sells clothes and cosmetics from catalogs, filling orders from her customers that are her friends and family. The majority of her sells are on credit. Her loan will be invested in buying crèmes, perfumes and lip gloss. Her dream is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cremes, perfumes and lip gloss to sell

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian C. is from the village of Gingoog City. He is 40 years old. Christian is single and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Christian owns & operates a business venture providing hairdressing & beauty services to local community members. Christian has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Christian is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the materials needed to provide hairdressing services. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Christian from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
