HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has been operating her charcoal business for the past thirteen years and sells from home to her neighboring community. She is happily married with five children who all attend school. Her husband is a contractor by profession and he contributes to his family's basic needs. Elizabeth lives in her own house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and vehicle maintenance and repair.

With this 40,000 KES loan, Elilzabeth wants to buy five sacks of charcoal. Additionally she operates a taxi business and pick-up van for light transport. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of high transportation costs. She hopes that someday she will register her own company and become a big supplier in the market. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is a 28-year-old man from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. Ala is a hard-working single man who takes care of his elderly parents and looks after his younger brother. 

Ala started working as a barber eight years ago when he found a well-located shop and took a training class.

Ala decided to replace his old barbering tools with new ones. He also wants to buy supplies for his job, such as creams. Ala came to FATEN and took a $1,000 dollar loan for this purpose.

In the photograph, Ala appears in his shop.

loans.use: Purchase tools and supplies for his barber shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase products for her business such as basic grains, sodas, personal products, soaps

loans.name: Willy Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TESORITO”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Willy;  El socio tiene 32 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, es comerciante él se dedica  a la venta de productos naturales, desde hace 1 año; el socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la implementación de su stand.  
    
El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “Little Treasure” this bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Willy, he is 32 years old, he lives with his partner and has 2 children. He is a merchant and has sold natural products for a year and Mr. Willy needs the loan to help his business. The member needs the loan to invest in merchandize for his stand.

The member is grateful and values the loan given to him through this medium and is equally committed to meet with the payments of his quotas in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member needs the loan to invest in merchandize for his stand.

loans.name: Davaahuu

texts.en: Davaahuu T. is a 48-year-old widow and lives with her grown daughter in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Davaahuu operates a dairy trading business in her town.  She started this business in 2006 with working capital of 45,000 MNT which has since grown to 1,800,000 MNT. Over the years of running her business, Davaahuu has gained a reputation among her customers as a reliable supplier of quality dairy products. She has also been able to gain a lot of business knowledge and experience during this time. Her business earnings have enabled her to purchase a new car for her son. She is a very honest and hardworking businesswoman and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to prepare more dairy products in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To prepare more dairy products

loans.name: Joseph Njuguna

texts.en:
Joseph bought his motorbike last year which he has been using to transport people from one place to another.  He is 28 years old, married to Elizabeth Njambi and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan well and in good time. He plans to use the money to carry out repairs on his motorbike and also renew his PSV license.

Joseph hopes to own a minibus in future which he will use in the transport business.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and renew his PSV license

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Erlinda wants to improve her income so she works hard to achieve it.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070030) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  

To make a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,100,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  

H. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & to use as working capital.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Nguyễn Thị (20201070030) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 3.100.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase inventory & use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 30 years old, married and has two kids. The borrower graduated from primary school. He will use this loan to develop his tailor shop and purchase various kinds of cloth and a sewing machine. The borrower has a good reputation in the market and has lots of customers. The borrower sells his cloth at a reasonable price to his clients.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine & cloth

loans.name: Arvin

texts.en:
Arvin M. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 21 years old. Arvin is single. To make a living, Arvin owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Arvin has been engaged in his business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arvin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arvin is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arvin from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Confianza Y Dignidad 2 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is one of the members of the Confianza y Dignidad 2 (Trust and dignity) Group, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic, where there are often drinking-water and electricity shortages. The population of this area is comprised of Dominicans and Haitian immigrants. Carmen's primary activity is to sell fruit and vegetables.

Carmen is the mother of four children, who live with her and their father. She tells us that she wants to build an additional room in her house. Her favorite activity is to take care of her children and be at her home.

Carmen is very excited to receive her 11th loan through Esperanza International. She has had her business for fifteen years, which she started with a small amount of savings she had and with her initiative to generate income and be useful. She plans to invest this new loan into purchasing fruits, cassava, plantain, banana, sweet potatoes. She will use the profits to save so she can finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy fruits: cassaba, plantain, banana, sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Kalosi

texts.en: Kalosi is a twenty six year old married man with a child, living in a rented house in Kamwenge Uganda. He dreams of building his own house. He sells second hand clothes and has been in business for two years amidst challenges of insufficient capital to meet the demands of his customers. Carlos needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: Buying second hand clothes for sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng P., 41, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs behind her house. She is married to Choum Sok, 45, who assists her in the business. The couple have seven children, all of whom are single. Three of her children are working in different jobs in the Phnom Penh City. To improve her trade, Heng P. is taking out her loan to purchase small pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño se encuentra en su segundo  ciclo.
La Sra. Rosa S. se dedica a vender kits (paquestes) de limpieza doméstica en su casa además de enseñar en horas de la mañana en la escuelita de su barrio.
Ella desea progresar y por ello se unió a este grupo a fin de recibir un crédito de la Fundación Paraguaya mediante el equipo de KIVA.
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño” (Divine Child) Committee is in its second loan cycle.

Sra. Rosa S. sells house cleaning kits from her home. In addition, she teaches at the neighborhood school in the mornings. She wants to progress, so she joined this group so that she could receive a loan from Fundación Paraguaya through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase powdered laundry soap, clothes brushes, detergents, and other items

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with a daughter, Diana. She lives in the industrial city of Zaporozhye. Margarita runs a clothing sales business, selling socks, pantyhose and sportswear. She owns 7 vending locations in the central market called ‘Angolenko’. Margarita has been in the trade for 12 years. Her gross income amounts to 60,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Margarita is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to pay customs clearance fees. Margarita purchases inventory wholesale in China for further re-sale in Ukraine. She then needs to import her merchandise into the country. Customs fees are high, and Margarita decided to request a loan to cover these costs. One of her future plans is to continue growing her enterprise, adding more vending facilities to the ones she already has.

loans.use: To pay customs clearance fee

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is 50 years old, married to Augustine and has three children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for resale. In the future, Lucy hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent building.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Manas

texts.en:
Manas, 26, is married and lives with his wife and a newly born daughter in Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife is currently unemployed and they have a below average standard of living. Manas began growing vegetables in 2006 and running a taxi service in 2008. 

They currently live in a ger, Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and he is building a house on a small plot of land that he owns. He learned farming from his father who is an experienced farmer in his area.  Manas sells the vegetables that he grows in addition to his taxi service business.  He is a hardworking  and polite person who says, " I am trying to finish my house which is being built now".  He is requesting a loan of 2,950,000 MNT to purchase seeds for his vegetable business and spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Mr. Ron M. (pictured here) is 61 years old and his wife, Mrs. Yeun Hin, is 52 years old. They live along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have eight children – four sons and four daughters. Four of the children are married and live outside the family home, three are garment factory workers and the other attends school.
Mr. Ron M. is a fisherman, while his wife is a lotus farmer. He is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase additional fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Asunta Sofia

texts.es:
Asunta es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, tiene 6 hijos (2 independientes).  Asunta tiene educación secundaria.
Viene  trabajando  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres años.  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta al por menor de productos lácteos-leche.
La señora solicitará  un  nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/ 400.00 nuevo soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar quesos y leche para luego venderlos a sus clientes, también cuenta que trabaja en la agricultura.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y obtener más ingresos.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las capacitaciones y las charlas.
texts.en:
Asunta is a member of the "Las Retamas" community bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno. She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has six children (two of whom are adults). Asunta has a high school education.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years. Her first loan was for 300 new "soles", money that she used in her business selling dairy and milk products at retail.

She will request a new loan in the sum of 400 new "soles" which will be used to buy cheeses and milk to then sell to her customers that work in farming. Her dream is to improve her business and obtain more income. What she likes about her community bank are the training and lectures.

loans.use: to purchase cheeses and milk.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez aprendió el valor del trabajo en el campo, desde entonces trabaja todos los días  desde muy temprano por la madrugada para ver sus cultivos. Principalmente cultiva papa, maíz, oca, entre otros productos. Siempre procura que la plaga de insectos no perjudique sus plantaciones, asimismo los fertiliza cada cierto tiempo para fortalecerlos. Luego de varios meses de espera puede ver recién los frutos de su arduo trabajo, que al ser vendidos, las ganancias le ayudan a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Parte de este trabajo, considera que el cambio de clima perjudica sus plantaciones, por otro lado el bajo precio que se ofrece de este producto en el mercado le molesta ya que no puede recuperar lo invertido. Aún así ha salido adelante optando por otros productos mas rentables como el trigo y el maíz,  es por eso que ha decidió mejorar sus cultivos y sembrar para en sus variedades así como habas, por ser productos más rentables. Es su crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP,  considera que trabajar en su banco comunal es una buena experiencia que le permite mejorar en el aspecto económico por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas para su siembra de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Flora, 44, lives with her husband and son in her own house.  Since childhood she learned the value of working the land.  Since then she’s worked every day from very early at dawn on her crops.  She grows mainly potato, corn and oca (a tuber), among other products.  She always tries to keep insect infestations from damaging her crops as well as fertilizing every so often to strengthen them.  After a period of several months of waiting she can begin to see the fruits of her hard labor which, upon sale, produce profits that help her meet household needs.

On one hand she feels that changes in the weather damage her plants and on the other hand the low market prices for these products bother her because she’s unable to recuperate her investment.  Even so, she’s gotten ahead by opting for other, more profitable crops, like wheat and corn. Because of this she’s decided to improve her crops planting more variety, like lima beans, because they are more profitable products.

This is loan #7 with MFP.  She considers that working with a communal bank is a good experience that allows her to improve her economic situation so she commits to be very punctual with her repayments.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure and seed for her potato and corn planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and potato and corn seed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sewing notions, motor oil, and liquid soap.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has one child.

Nabil has had a shop selling all kinds of chicken since 2010. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy a chicken grilling machine and a chicken cleaning machine.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is 49 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. Candelaria runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store. Candelaria has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for five years and also earns income from selling vegetables. Candelaria hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Annet has a business which sells firewood. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days every week. Annet sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of firewood. The main business challenges for Annet include seasonality and transportation. 

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van for easier transportation. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of firewood

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Dioubo a été créé le 12 juin 2009.IL est composé de femmes issues du même village.Leur principale activité est l'agriculture et la transformation des produits alimentaires en céréales.

Madame Seynabou est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 27 ans;est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.Sa principale activité est la culture du mil,de l'arachide et la transformation de l'arachide en pâte.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de ces activités pour l'avoir pratiquer depuis sa jeune enfance.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en qualité et en quantité suffisante de semences,pour bien préparer son champ de mil et d'arachide.

Son objectif est de participer aux charges de sa famille à travers la nourriture,la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dioubo was created on June 12, 2009. It is composed of women from the same village. Their main business involves agriculture and the processing of grains as foodstuffs. 

Ms. Seynabou is the group's official. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her main work is the growing millet and peanuts and the processing peanuts into peanut butter. She has good experience in these businesses because she has done it since she was very young. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on seeds of sufficient quantity and quality, so as to do well in preparing her field of millet and peanuts. Her goal is to help with family expenses, from food to healthcare, for her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Rehema's Group

texts.en:
Rehema‘s group is comprised of five hard-working young women. Rehema is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has three children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Rehema has a business selling food, which she has had for three years.  She has a small retail shop that sells sugar.  

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rehema hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.  In the future, Rehema hopes to build a house for herself. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business with capital that helped her buy four cows of her own.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Jestina. She is married and has 4 children, ages 15, 12, 6, and 3 years old. 

In 2005, she established her food sales business. She sales items such as palm oil, Garie, foofoo, and pineapples. She began her business because she dropped out of school and needed to engage herself to avoid being idle at home. Working 6 days a week and 6 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Jestina requires a loan in order to buy more local food stuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. 

In the future, Jestina plans to have a store on her own and support her children through their university education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food items for her business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a resident of Litein, South Rift, Kenya. Nicholas is aged 34 and has been in farming for 14 years, with one farmhand currently employed in his farm. He is married with four children aged between 10 and 2 years. His farm produces tea and milk which are sold locally. He gets additional income from his employment in a local factory.

Nicholas has requested a loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to pay for the construction of a zero grazing unit for his dairy cows. He says this will make better feeding for the dairy animals and help him manage the feed. He is optimistic the business too will be much better.

He is however stating that fluctuation in market prices and harsh weather conditions are the challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit for dairy cows

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Née  à Sikasso et âgée aujourd’hui de 33 ans, Assetou  est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont 3 garçons et 1 fille, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants aux logements sociaux ATTBOUGOU de Sikasso, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Assetou n’ayant pas la chance d’avancer dans les études, elle  s’est très vite initiée aux activités de commerce d’articles divers dont elle dispose une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où elle mène ses activités d’achat et de vente  de Cigarettes, bonbons, allumettes, Chewing-gum, lait en poudre, thé, sucre, etc il y a environ douze ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a quelque mois. Ainsi, elle est à son un premier qui lui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
 Elle compte acheter avec ce premier prêt,  2 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 5 paquets de Chewing-gum, 2 cartons de lait en poudre (en sachets), 5 gros paquets du thé, 1 sac du sucre, 10 paquets de bonbons, 20 paquets d’allumettes et quelques alvéoles d’œufs . Elle achète ses marchandises chez les commerçants grossistes de place avant de les revendre en détail au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée de voisins et surtout des jeunes..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce premier crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in Sikasso and now 33 years old, Assetou is married and a mother of four, three boys and a girl. She lives with her husband and their children in the Attbougou public housing of Sikasso, in one of the popular district of Sikasso (located in Mali's third administrative region).
Since Mrs. Assetou did not have the opportunity to advance in her studies, she very rapidly familiarized herself with the trade of various items and has had for about twelve years a shop in the front of her house. There she buys and sells cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing-gum, powdered milk, tea, sugar, etc. She is very much in demand thanks to the quality of her products.
To meet demand from a growing number of customers, she decided to join micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso a few months ago. She thus is on her first loan, which will allow her to increase her working capital in order to better satisfy her customers.
With this first loan, she is planning on buying two cartons of cigarettes from different brands, five cartons of chewing-gum, two cartons of powdered milk (in pouches), five large packs of tea, one bag of sugar, ten cartons of candy, twenty packs of matches and a few egg cartons. She purchases her merchandise form local wholesalers before retailing it for cash or credit to a clientele composed of neighbors, and mostly of young people.
With this first loan, she is planning on a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will mainly be used to contribute to the expenses of the family and to pay her loan's interests, with the remainder to be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous grocery items.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is from the village Mukhrani in the Mtskheta district. She is 43 years old and lives with her parents, who are retired. She is the only income provider in the family and agricultural activities are the main source of income for them. 

Maya has two milk cows. She produces and sells on average 40 kg. of cheese per month. She sells it to local dairy products retailers. Along with the dairy, Maya is also busy with her winery. She has a vineyard and produces wine, which is also sold locally. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 GEL (including the pensions of Maya’s parents). 

Maya requested credit to purchase two calves and feed for them. She will raise the calves during the winter and sell them by spring for a higher price. Maya will get additional income and will use it for purchasing new household goods, in order to improve the family's living conditions. Also part of the credit will be used for renovation of a small part of the house, as it is old and in bad condition.

loans.use: to purchase two calves and food for them and pay for house renovation services.

loans.name: Tamara Lucia

texts.es: Tamara tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. La experiencia que tiene con su negocio es de 4 años, la falta de empleo hicieron que Tamara buscara esta forma de sobrevivir. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior entre otros. Ella sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Tamara, 34, sells general merchandise.  She has four years’ experience in this business.  Lack of employment opportunities led Tamara to seek out this way of surviving.  The reason for the loan is to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics and underwear, among others.  She dreams with staying in business.

loans.use: to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics and underwear, among others.

loans.name: Mwanamize

texts.en:
Mwanamize is 36 years old and a  mother of one child.  She runs a motorcycle business in Kiembeni, Mombasa.  


She  was recently introduced to KADET LTD. She has been in this business for the last two years and it has been a success. This marks her first time borrowing to finance her business. With this loan she plans to buy spare parts and repair her motorcycle. 


The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and into the repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school. Her husband is a lab technician who contributes to the provision of their family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Saumu has operated a vegetable and fruits grocery for the past five years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to the market where she operates her business. She aspires to own a public transport motor vehicle one day.

With the Kshs 100,000 she wants to purchase more stocks of vegetables and fruits like bananas, onions, tomatoes and oranges for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it has fair policies.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruits like bananas, onions, tomatoes and oranges for her grocery business.

loans.name: Marcela Ivania

texts.es:
Marcela, se dedica a la venta de tostadas y de pupusas, ella vive con su madre, es madre soltera de un pequeño de dos años de edad; Marcela lleva 4 años dedicándose a la venta de pupusas y tostadas, el negocio lo aprendió de su madre y hoy en día es el medio de ingreso que tiene para sobrellevar la responsabilidad familiar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de pupusas y tostadas, lo que necesita es aceite, maíz, condimentos, plátano verde, estos son los productos que comprara, para mantener la disponibilidad y en un momento dado aumentar la producción.
El objetivo de Marcela es mejorar el negocio, a través del aporte de los préstamos, ofreciéndole a su familia una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Marcela sells tostadas and pupusas.  She lives with her mother and is a single mother of a little two-year-old boy.  Marcela has been selling pupusas and tostadas for four years.  She learned the business from her mother and today it’s her means of support to meet her family responsibility.

At present, she’s asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make pupusas and tostadas.  What she needs is oil, corn, condiments and green plantain.  These are the products she’ll buy to have stock available and increase production.  Marcela’s objective is to provide her family with a more stable life through the loans.

loans.use: to buy oil, corn, condiments and green plantain.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 27-year-old man from Kilgoris county. He is married to Susan and they have four children, age between 9 months and 6 years old. 

James runs a butchery. He has operated this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is taking his third loan from KADET Ltd. and will use it to buy a cow for slaughter.  

He will use the anticipated profits to diversify into farming. His hope is to own his own business premise and also to give his family the best living standards he can afford.

loans.use: To buy a cow for slaughter.

loans.name: Nubia Isabel

texts.es: Nubia emprendedora, tiene su propio negocio una pulpería desde hace tiempo la tiene con el apoyo de su mami logro establecerlo actualmente gracias a los préstamo ha realizado pequeñas mejoras en el negocio cambio de techo. Para este tiempo de fiesta se debe abastecer al negocio ya que son días de vacaciones y de elaboraciones de comida para sus clientes. Con este préstamo comprara mercadería de granos básicos, carnes (res, pollo y cerdo), enlatados, embutidos, bebidas, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros productos. El apoyo de la financiera ha sido importante para el desarrollo de su negocio y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Enterprising Nubia has her own business, a general store that she was able to establish and runs with her mother’s help.  She’s been able to make some slight improvements and replace the roof, thanks to the loans she’s gotten.  For this festive season she needs to stock her store, now that her customers are off work and preparing food.  She will use the money for this loan to buy merchandise such as basic grains, meats (beef, chicken, pork), canned goods, sausages, drinks, soft drinks, juices, among other things.  Financial backing has always been important for her business and quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Oyuntuya

texts.en: Mrs. Oyuntuya, age 47, works as a cook in a hotel located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been doing her job for over 10 years, and her customers are always satisfied. She lives with her husband and her nephew in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar. Her home is located 12 miles from her job. So she always has the problem of finding transportation to her job. Therefore, she decided to repair her old car, which has not functioned for two years. The car needs over 1,000,000 MNT in repairs to change the engine and other parts. She thinks that if she can easily get to her job, she can work normally, and it will influence her work efficiency. The loan she is taking will be used to purchase the necessary spare parts to repair her broken car.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary spare parts to repair her broken car.

loans.name: Ruti

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA 3”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruti; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia también se dedica a distribuir medicamentos a las diferentes farmacias del distrito de Urubamba, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y así poder mejorar la atención de su restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruti, 41, is a member of the “Sayhua 3” communal bank that’s located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  

She is married and has two children.  She alternates her daily chores with a restaurant business; she makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners.  She also distributes medicine to various pharmacies in Urubamba District.  Her dream is to expand to provide better service in her restaurant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients for food preparation like meat, chicken and vegetables at wholesale.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “TINKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Celia; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bazar, ella vende regalos, peluches y adornos y también la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de cuyes, la socia es su trabajo de bazar trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,y el negocio de crianza de cuyes lo realiza los días fines de semana, por medio de este negocio de bazar y crianza de cuyes saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su bazar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar regalos, peluches y adornos y también para comprar cuyes al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "TINKA".  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Celia; she is 53 years old, married, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities between her stationary shop -selling gifts, stuffed animals, and decorations- and breeding guinea pigs.  She works at the stationary shop from 8:00 a.m. till 7:00 p.m. and breeds the guinea pigs on weekends.  By means of the stationary shop and raising guinea pigs she manages to advance her children.  Her dream is to expand her stationary shop.  She requests the loan to buy gifts, stuffed animals, and decorations and also to buy guinea pigs wholesale.

She is happy about the loan and she promises to comply with the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy gifts, stuffed animals, and decorations and also to buy guinea pigs wholesale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a resident and a farmer in the Eldoret area of North Rift Kenya and has been in poultry farming for over four years. His eggs and milk products are sold to the local market. He is married with one child, age four. He currently employs one farmhand.

Paul has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy irrigation pipes. He says this will create his water supply that will make his farming easier and generate more income. He says he wants to expand his farming and make it his core business and main source of income for family upkeep.

He, however, laments the exorbitant charges from poultry feed dealers.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña  Joaju tiene el total de 10 integrantes, todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, de escasos recursos que formaron su grupo entre vecinas y amigas, actualmente ya están  en el tercer ciclo. 
Irene es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la cría de animales, como ser pollos y chanchos. Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, ya que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, no solo físico, sino también mental. Debe de estar pendiente las 24 hs. De los animales que tiene para que no les pase nada. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y con eso poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños y alimentos para estos y los demás animales que tiene. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues muchas de ellas en otras instituciones jamás la habrían recibido.
texts.en:
The Kuña Joaju committee has a total of 10 members. All of them are very hardworking and enterprising women with few resources. They started the group among neighbors and friends, and now they are in their third cycle.
 
Irene is one of the members. She raises animals such as chickens and pigs. She remarks that her work is very hard, since it requires a lot of physical and mental effort. She has to be on call 24 hours a day so nothing will happen to her animals. Her goal is to keep working and thus keep being able to help her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy small pigs and feed for them and the other animals she has. She is grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity she is receiving, as many of them wouldn't have received these opportunities in other institutions.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to raise and also to buy feed for the animals.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata habite au sud du Sénégal âgée de 40 ans mère de 5 enfants.La fille ainée fait la 3eme collège le 2em fait le cm2 pour entrée en 6em le 3em fait le ce1 et les jumeaux font le ci.Depuis 15 ans ,elle est dans le commerce d'habillement,elle se ravitaille au Mali et dans les grands marchés hebdomadaire pour venir revendre dans sa localité.Avec son commerce,elle épargne de l'argent supporte toutes les dépenses de sa faille et les frais scolaires des enfants.Fatoumata;loin de son mari,se bat toujours pour réussir dans sa vie.Elle a comme ambition être une grande commerçante pour faire le commerce à l’extérieure du pays comme Maroc,Doubail etc

loans.use: ACHAT D'HABILLES

loans.name: Parith

texts.en: A single man whose name is Parith, 19, is a university student living in Phnom Penh city. Recently, Parith selling clothes and works in a local company to earn his living and support his studying. He has been involved with this work for many months. For Parith, this is his first loan cycle with VisionFund and he will use his loan portion to pay the tuition fee of his bachelor degree in real estate field. He hopes that he can get a good job to earn a decent income after he graduated.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee of his bachelor degree in real estate field.

loans.name: Angel Asenov

texts.en:
Angel is a 29-year-old resident of Sliven, Bulgaria. Angel is a member of the Roma minority, also referred to as gypsies. He lives in the Roma neighborhood in a small, 2-room house without running water with his mother and brother.

For the past 15 years, Angel has worked in a bike shop in the center of Sliven tuning and repairing bikes. This year, Angel wants to start his own bike repair shop in the Roma neighborhood, "Nedeshda". Bikes play an important role for transport for members of the Roma community for two key reasons: 1) very few Roma own functioning vehicles and 2) public transport does not serve the Nedeshda. As such, the Roma without donkeys predominately get around by riding their bikes and walking.

The focus of Angel's business will be fixing punctured tires and tubes, broken chains and petals. The seed capital provided by this loan will be enough to cover the equipment he needs (welding tools, wrenches, screwdrivers, saws, hammers and a number of bike-specific tools), inventory (rubber, spare parts) and the modest renovation he needs to perform on the part of his house where he will have this shop (shown in photo).

loans.use: Investment in equipment and renovations to shop (shown in photo)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda has a grocery store. She wishes to add to her stock of merchandise in order to give better service and in that way increase her sales. She would like to request a loan of $800 in order to carry out her plan. She will be able to repay this credit in 12 months.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Yolanda tiene una tienda de abarrotes en la cual quiere agregar mas mercancía para Poder dar un mejor servicio y de esta manera incrementar la venta en su tienda. A ella le gustaría solicitar un préstamo por $800.00dllrs para llevar a cabo su proyecto y Poder pagar este crédito en 12 meses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Mrs. Alice A. is a 52 year old woman with five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She requests the above loan amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel is 28 years old and a single mother. Her husband left her a year ago and that motivated her to start and work on her own business and get ahead. She started 2 years ago with very little capital. Mabel runs her business from home.

In her business, she sells clothes and small household items as well as providing beauty services for women. She works every day from 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. Mabel has been able to maintain her business due to her dedication and good customer service.

She needs the loan to buy new products and a display case to better showcase the merchandise that her business offers. In that way, she can take advantage of the opportunity and increase her customers.

She lives with her son on a mixed structured house. Mabel hopes that with the loan, she can improve her business and living conditions and serve as an example of hard work for her relatives and neighbors in the area where she lives.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer.

Mabel tiene su negocio en el que vende ropa, artículos pequeños para el hogar y realiza trabajos de belleza para damas. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su domicilio desde hace 2 años. Su horario de atención es de 9 a.m. a 10 p.m. todos los días. Sin contar con mucho capital se decidió iniciar su propia fuente de trabajo. Lo ha logrado mantener gracias a la constante dedicación y buen servicio que ella ofrece a sus clientes.

Mabel necesita de un préstamo para poder comprar nuevos productos y una vitrina con la que mejorara la presentación y exhibición de la mercadería que ella ofrece en su negocio. De esta manera puede aprovechar la oportunidad de incrementar el número de sus clientes.

Mabel tiene 28 años es madre soltera. Su esposo la dejo hace 1 año motivo por el cual se dedico a trabajar y salir adelante. Tiene 1 hijo que es menor de edad. Su casa es de estructura mixta. Con el crédito aspira a mejorar su negocio y su condición de vida siendo un ejemplo de trabajo y superación para sus familiares y vecinos del sector donde habita.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise and products as well as a display case

loans.name: Rubí

texts.es:
Rubí has two children, and she is a very enterprising and enthusiastic woman. For the past four years she has been separated from her husband and has been looking for an income that will permit her to offer the necessities to her children. Rubí decided to start her own business selling clothes and shoes. Fortunately, he has succeeded in increasing the number of her customers and offering a greater quantity of products. It has not been easy for Rubí to get ahead with her children as a single woman, but the wellbeing of her children is what motivates her day after day.

In order to acquire merchandise to fulfill the requests she has from her clients, now Rubí needs a loan of $750, which she will repay in 6 months. Rubí trusts in the people who help those who need it most, and she is very grateful for the confidence and support you offer her in improving her life.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rubí tiene dos hijos, es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta. Desde hace cuatro años se separó de su esposo y en busca de un ingreso que le permitiera ofrecerle lo necesario a sus hijos Rubí decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa y zapatos, afortunadamente ha logrado incrementar su numero de clientes y ofrecer una mayor cantidad de sus productos. No ha sido fácil para Rubí sacar adelante a sus hijos ella sola pero el bienestar de sus hijos es lo que la motiva día con día.

Para adquirir mercancía y cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ahora Rubí necesita un crédito por $ 750 dólares que se compromete a devolver es 6 meses. Rubí confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y agradece mucho la confianza y apoyo que le brindas para mejorar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Koreta

texts.en: Koreta joined SPBD in order to receive financial assistance to help her run her sewing business, but it has also given her a chance to meet other ladies of her community. Koreta's husband died while their children were very young, and she has been raising 2 boys and 5 girls alone. She is sad about her loss, but her success has provided inspiration for other women not to be financially too dependent on their husbands. Koreta operates her sewing business 6 days a week and makes US$100-150. She uses the money for her children’s school fees and to otherwise support her family. Koreta is asking for a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase a new sewing machine, scissors, and threads for her business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine, scissors, and threads for a business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 27 years old, married, and has three kids. She is a very hard-working lady and her family owns a vegetable garden and plantation. She has applied for this loan in order to buy weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, and tools for her garden. Rita is thankful for the loans because it helps her to make ends meet, and she hopes to remain in the loan program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Hurshed

texts.ru:
Hurshed H. is 22 years old and married. He works at a large bakery which produces a large variety of cakes and pastries, but in his spare time he also sells household items and guitar items at the market. He would like to expand his inventory for the coming winter season, and for that he is requesting to borrow 2000 somni from Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Хуршед Хабибов, возраст 22 года , женат .Сам работает в кулинарном цехе по производству кондитерских изделий , но помимо этого он в выходные дни торгует на рынке хозайственными товарами и электро принадлежностями .Хочет увеличить ассортимент , для этого ему понадобилось 2000 сомони и он решил обратится в Микроинвест.

loans.use: expansion of inventory

loans.name: Munaku B(V) Group

texts.en:
Hanifah and Margret have a salon businesses. With the extra profits, Hanifah wants to construct a residential home. Adrian sells charcoal. Margret has a retail shop business while Annet sells raw foods in the market.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To add in business

loans.name: Bwase East B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joan N.. She is currently in the business of operating a drug shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Joan is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a newspaper vendor. She has 2 children who are 8 and 10, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Joan makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase more drugs and clinical equipment. Joan has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to buy more drugs and the loan was paid back on time.

Joan is joined in her small group by Prossy N. and Edith K.. Prossy N. has a business running a beauty parlor and wants to expand business. Edith K. is currently operating a business milling maize and wants a loan to purchase more maize.

loans.use: To expand drug shop business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Mary M.. She is a 58-year-old widow with five children who are between the ages of 28 and 37 years old. Mary owns a poultry business. She works seven days a week and 13 to 16 hours per day, and she is assisted by her sister. Mary has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase 300 chickens (layers). In the future, Mary plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Raising "kuku" is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you have probably heard the term "kuku" and you might be wondering who or what are "kuku"? In Swahili, "kuku" means chickens, and raising them for sale is a popular business in Tanzania for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital: you can start with just one or two kuku and either add more as your business expands or wait for them to (naturally) multiply! Second, kuku do not need a great deal of space or any special facilities so you can normally just let them run around your garden or compound. Third, kuku produce eggs while they grow, and the eggs can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. Mary is sure that there are many other reasons why raising kuku is so popular--she speculates that they may be friendlier or prettier than other animals--but she hopes you now have a better understanding of the popularity of kuku in Tanzania.

loans.use: To purchase 300 additional kuku (chickens) to raise and sell.

loans.name: Saribel

texts.es:
Saribel is a teacher at Manteles Verdes school.   She is married and she and her husband own a small piece of land where they plants crops like pineapple, yucca, malanga and papaya.  In the afternoon Saribel helps her husband with the crops and also works in the home.  She has a 8 year old daughter that is studying in the 3rd grade.  

Saribel started volunteering giving classes without earning any salary and has been an exemplary woman by helping her community bringing education to the rural children in her region. 

She requests a loan to build a bedroom in her house to continue improving it as she has been doing for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva volunteer.

Saribel es docente de la Escuela Manteles Verdes, es casada. Ambos poseen una pequeña tierra en donde simbran cultivos como piña, yuca, quequisque y papaya. Saribel por las tardes le ayuda a su marido en estos cultivos, además que se dedica también a su hogar. Tienen una hija de 8 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando el tercer grado de primaria.

Saribel inició dando clases de manera voluntaria, sin devengar salario alguno, ha sido un ejemplo de mujer ya que ayudo a su comunidad llevando el pan de la enseñanza a los niños campesinos de su comarca.

Requiere del préstamo para construir una habitación en su casa de habitación, y así seguir mejorandola como ya desde muchos años lo ha venido haciendo.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a bedroom in her house

loans.name: Vy Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Trịnh Thị Vỵ, 52 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 2 của Quỹ. Chị có 5 người con, trong đó 3 người con đầu đã lập gia đình, 2 còn đang đi học. Kinh tế gia đình còn nhiều khó khăn nên chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương. Sau vòng vốn đầu sử dụng thấy hiệu quả, vòng này chị Vỵ làm đơn xin vay 375USD mua thức ăn cho lợn, đồng thời mua thêm 1 lợn nái (giá lợn con hiện nay đang rất cao). Chồng chị là một cán bộ về mất sức nhưng anh nhận thêm nghề đan lát để hỗ trợ vợ trong việc hoàn trả tiền tuần. Tính cả lương hưu của chồng, thu nhập của gia đình chị Vỵ là 150USD/tháng. Nếu được vay vốn của Quỹ chị không phải lo mua chịu thức ăn gia súc với lãi cao nữa.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Ms. Vy Thi T., 52 years old, is a 2nd-year participant in the fund. She has 5 children, the oldest 3 of which are grown and have their own families, and 2 who are still going to school. The family is still encountering many financial difficulties, so she is participating in the Fund. After the first successful utilization of the fund, in this round Ms. T. is applying for 375 USD to buy feed for the pigs, and also to buy a female pig (currently the price of baby pigs is very high). Her husband is a veteran whose health has declined since returning, but he takes extra work weaving to help support his wife in the weekly bills and payments. Counting her husband’s pension, the family’s income is 150 USD/month. If she receives the requested loan from the fund, she won’t have to worry about buying animal feed on credit with high interest anymore.

loans.use: Buy pigs and food for them

loans.name: Sharifa Bakari's Maisha Zakhem Group

texts.en:
Sharifa B. (pictured first on the right at the back), age 32, is married with one son, 10 years old. She has a business of selling clothes which she began six years ago. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $85.

In the past Sharifa has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothes of different types for sale. Sharifa will share this loan with her sub-group members, who sell furniture, charcoal, drinks and have shops. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Agbohoédé

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tékonou, Mrs. Aghohoédé A. is married to a laundry worker with whom she lives in the village of Logodomé. She is the mother of two children and specializes in producing red palm oil. She buys palm nuts in bulk and uses them to make red oil, which she sells. But today, her desperate lack of money means that she can no longer produce as in the past. To stimulate her business and make the most of the current harvest, she is requesting a loan to buy some palm nuts. This will enable her to improve on the level of income she has today.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tékonou, Madame A. Agbohoédé est mariée à un blanchissuer avec qui elle vit dans le village de Logodomé. Mère de deux enfants, elle est spécialisée dans la production d’huile rouge. Elle achète les noix de palme en quantité importante avec lesquelles elle prépare de l’huile rouge qu’elle commercialise. Mais aujourd’hui, le manque cruel d’argent fait qu’elle n’arrive plus à produire comme naguère. Pour se relancer et faire face à la campagne actuelle, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des noix de palme. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de revenu qui est aujourd’hui.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe started the business because her husband works under contracts and sometimes he could be without work for several months and the expenses of the house couldn’t wait. She began in May 2005, but before this date she was already selling clothes and ceramics. A friend invited her to sell the cosmetics of the brand that she sells at present. Her friend told her that these products have a good profit. It’s then when she decided to do a demonstration at her house, she gathered her neighbors and she managed to have good sale that day and since then she has been doing well and now her goal is to become a coordinator of a group of salespeople. She is requesting a loan of $1000 that she will repay over a period of 6 months. She will supply all the orders that she has and keep her clientele happy by delivering the products in time and this way have a bigger profit.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Guadalupe inició el negocio porqué su esposo trabaja por contratos y a veces se quedaba sin trabajo por varios meses y los gastos de la casa no podían esperar. Comenzó en Mayo de 2005, pero antes de esa fecha ya se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y cerámica, cuando una amiga la invitó a vender los cosméticos de la marca que actualmente vende, diciéndole que dichos productos dejaban una buena ganancia, fue así como se decidío a hacer una demostración en su casa, junté a sus vecinas y logró hacer una buena venta esa día y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien y ahora su meta es llegar a ser coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras. Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para poder surtir todos los pedidos que tiene y tener satisfechas a sus clientas entregándoles oportunamente sus encargos y de esta manera tener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long N., 29, is a housewife cooking food and looking after the children. Her husband works making jars to sell around the village. Normally, he makes US$4.3 of profit each day. To make more jars, Mrs. Long has requested a loan of US$200 to purchase more cement. (Long's husband is pictured at his home).

loans.use: To purchase more cement

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Née à Kétao en 1974, Madame A. Béatrice est mariée et mère d’un petit garçon. Outre cet enfant, elle compte à sa charge deux autres personnes qui l’aident à vendre ses produits. La production du jus de mil est son activité quotidienne.

Après les mauvaises récoltes de l’année dernière, la mesure du mil devient très chère. Pour continuer à produire, elle sollicite un crédit  pour acheter assez de mil afin d’être à l’abri de la hausse continue du prix.

Par cette activité, elle aura réussi à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Kétao in 1974, Mrs. Béatrice A. is married and the mother of one small son. Besides this child, she is responsible for two other people who help her sell her products. Producing millet juice is her daily business.

After the poor harvests of last year, millet has become very expensive. In order to continue production, she is asking for a loan to purchase enough millet so as to be sheltered from price hikes.

By means of this business, she will manage to improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of millet to prepare the local drink

loans.name: Lomas  Del Consuelo Group

texts.es:
The Lomas del Consuelo Group is comprised of four entrepreneurial women from Guadalupe, Zacatecas, who joined together with the common goal of helping their families get ahead and offering them a better quality of life. They have a seamstress shop called “Emily”, and all four share a love for sewing given that it is a craft they learned from a young age. Aurelia was the founder of the shop, something she wanted to do for a long time, as it has always been her trade. She started 22 years ago sewing for friends and from there the idea was born to set up a sewing workshop. Juana María started in the shop three years ago, having been invited by the owner to join her in this activity. Esperanza started two years ago, becoming part of the business. Lourdes arrived at the shop three years ago as an apprentice, and she now makes her living sewing. These women need a loan of $12,000 MXN, to be repaid in six months, to buy new sewing machines so they can do their work more easily and of a better quality. With your help these ladies will get ahead!

Translated from Spanish by N Aviva, Kiva volunteer

El Grupo Lomas del Consuelo esta integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras de Guadalupe, Zacatecas, que se unieron con un fin en común sacar adelante a sus familias y ofrecerles mejor calidad de vida, ellas tienen un taller de corte y confección llamado “Emily” las 4 comparten además el gusto por la costura ya que es un oficio que aprendieron desde pequeñas. Aurelia fue la iniciadora de este taller tenia la inquietud de poner un taller de costura ya que este siempre ha sido su oficio. Comenzó hace 22 años haciendo costura entre sus amistades y de ahí nació la idea de poner el taller de costura. Juana María comenzó hace 3 años en el taller de costura por invitación de la propietaria del taller para tener una actividad. Esperanza comenzó hace 2 años formando parte de este taller de costura. Lourdes hace 3 años llegue al taller de costura como aprendiz y ahora ya gana un sueldo en la costura. Ellas necesitan de un préstamo por $12,000 que pagaran en 6 meses para comprar maquinas de coser nuevas y poder hacer su trabajo mas ágil y con mayor calidad. Con tu apoyo ellas saldrán adelante!!!

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Siddiqan M. Latif Group

texts.en:
I am Siddiqan and reside in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. I am 42 years old and married to M. L., who has a scrap business. He has 20 years of experience in this business. I have three sons. My husband and I are trying to give our younger son a good education, because he wants to become a doctor. I sew clothes and make embroidered dresses to order and share the income with my husband so that we both will be able to fulfill our sons wish. I’m applying for a loan to buy scrap (iron and plastic bottles) to expand my husband’s business.

I’ve some women in my group. Amna baji is requesting a loan to buy washing powder for her laundry. Irshad baji is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. Tabasum baji and Bushra baji each are requesting a loan to buy materials (beads and thread) for their decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the entire repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy scrap for her husband's scrap business.

loans.name: Central B1-Madina Group

texts.en:
N. Madina 29 is married with 4 children. Her husband is a mattress vendor in the city. Previously, she worked as a waitress, then 1 year ago, after saving some capital, she began selling Irish potatoes and matooke to customers in the Kikubwamutwe market. Every week she purchases an average of 10 sacks of Irish potatoes and 3 bags of matooke at the Owino market. A sack of potatoes goes for about Ush 55,000 from which she earns an average of Ush 15,000 as profit. Madina usually sells 1 bag of potatoes in 2 days.  

The loan will help Madina increase her stock of Irish potatoes and matooke. She has earned the loyalty of her customers by ensuring quality products and customer courtesy. However, Madina’s dream is to sell second hand clothes in the Owino market. She also aspires to support her husband in building a modern residence for their family and also to send their children to good schools.

loans.use: Purchasing more sacks of Irish potatoes and matooke.

loans.name: Lukman

texts.en: Lukman A. is 40-years-old and is married with three children. He sells yams both wholesale and retail to his customers in the Ayeye market, Ibadan, Nigeria. Yams are a major food commodity in Nigeria. The demand for his yams are high and he hopes to meet those demands by requesting a loan of $675 (N100,000) to purchase more of them to sell. He says thank you to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: N. is a 40 year old resident of Kompong Tom Province in Cambodia, where she owns a stall behind her house raising pigs for sale. For her other income, she also cultivates rice, and she has don both of these businesses for more than four years. She is married and is the mother of one child who is a lovely young daughter, and is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is a charcoal seller. In the past, N. usually hires a farm land from a villager for her rice farming. She now hopes to own a farm land; thus, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a plot of farm land.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean K. was born in 1959 and now lives in An Doung Samrith village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Heng Lo, is a teacher in the local school. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a cow breeder and the remaining is a farmer who helps with the plantation. Mrs. Sean K. is applying for a loan to buy a cart to use with an electric motor for transportation. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cart to use with an electric motor for transportation

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 32 years old and married with a child. She sells provisions and cosmetics. She has been in this business since 2004. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.en:
T. Tran, 69, lives in the town of Hưng yên. She is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising ducks for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 40 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2000, T. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund, used to purchase breeding livestock. T. is requesting a loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her eigth loan from TYM Fund. T. plans to use the revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married and has two daughters who are 19 and 13 years old. They live in Vasilyevka. Yuryi sells groceries from his little food store. His vending location is well known for good prices that are lower than market prices. Yuryi knows his customers’ preferences and always offers them only good quality groceries. He has been in the grocery trade for about 7 years. His business has been marked with consistent stability. Currently, his gross income is about 12,000 Hryvnia a month. 

Yuryi is running a neat small grocery store. He is hoping to invest a loan of 7,000 Hryvnia in additional merchandise which will help him increase his turnover capital eventually. Yuryi has a vision for the expansion of his trade and we believe it will be helpful in his entrepreneurial endeavors. The loan will help Yuryi to persist, take small steps at a time and achieve success which we think will be absolutely inevitable.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Roberto Isaias

texts.es: El señor Roberto Isaías M. , tiene la edad e 49 años , habita en el barrio La borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual es ama de casa y le poya con las actividades de la misma , ellos tienen tres hijos , ya todos casados , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , el desde hace treinta años, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , la afectación mas grandes que se le presentan son las plagas , el inicio esta actividad con su propios esfuerzos , los sueños de don Roberto es poder diversificar sus cultivos .Con el financiamiento obtenido lo va a invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y poder lograr una buena producción.
texts.en:
Roberto Isaías M. is 49 years old and lives with his wife in the La Borgoña neighborhood in the municipality of Ticuantepe. His wife is a housewife and helps Roberto with his work. They have three children, all of whom are married. His goal is to improve his family’s living conditions. He has farmed for a living since he was 30 years old. Roberto began farming through his own efforts, and his dream is to diversify his crops; his biggest challenge is pests. Roberto is going to use the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and supplies, which he will apply to his crops so that he can achieve a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural supplies and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Ni Luh Sumiarni

texts.en:
Ni Luh Sumiarni - (DNR.M-0690) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Ni Luh Sumiarni owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Luh Sumiarni has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Luh Sumiarni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Luh Sumiarni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Ni Luh Sumiarni is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Luh Sumiarni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Luh Sumiarni - (DNR.M-0690) merupakan 30 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia balita. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Sumiarni memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Sumiarni sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Sumiarni menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 - 600,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Luh Sumiarni bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Sumiarni meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli ternak indukan. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Sumiarni berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.
