*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Esther Teofila

texts.es:
Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas.
Esther es viuda, tiene 52 años y 7 hijos, Esther venD. golosinas en la puerta D. un colegio, actividad que realiza ambulatoriamente en un triciclo, además Esther prepara gelatinas, chupetes que venD. en el mismo lugar, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Esther necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa, azúcar y gelatina.
Los sueños D. Esther son construir su casa, tener una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the ‘Las Entusiastas’ Community Bank. She is a 52-year old widow with seven children. Every day she sells candy at a high school entrance from a pushcart; she also makes jello and popsicles which she sells at the same spot. Esther needs a loan of 900 soles to buy potatoes, sugar, and jello. Her dream is to build her own home, own a store, and have children with good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, sugar, and jello

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 36-year-old man. He is married but currently has no children. He lives with his wife, who is also a fish seller, in a rented apartment in their community. He trades in fresh fish, a business he has done for four years now. He takes stock of fresh from Kumasi and supplies to his customers. He said he buys on credit occasionally because he does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. He has a larger market share since he started the business. He needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. He requests for a loan to buy a fridge, and more fish to increase his stock of fish. This, he believes, will help him save much to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Hipatia De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Hipatia es la fundadora del Banco Comunal Nuestra Señora De La Luz de la ciudad de Manta, ella junto a otras socias pudieron lograr que se construya la iglesia lugar donde se reúne el banco, ella nos comentó que no fue nada fácil lograrlo pero con la ayuda de la Fundación  Espoir fue una realidad ese sueño.

En los actuales momentos la señora Hipatia se dedica a la costura (modista) desde hace 20 años, estudio en cursos, aprendió  además los primeros auxilios, como poder  inyectar, poner suero, tomar la presión,  a mas de ello se dedica a la venta de joyas elaboradas en plata .

Todo esto lo realiza desde su propia casa, no tiene necesidad de salir a recorrer con su mercadería pues ella tiene sus clientes fijos que le vistan.

Hace 10 meses ella enviudo y quedo en compañía de sus 4 hijos 3 de ellos profesionales, quienes han sido el apoyo ante la perdida de su esposo. 

Señora Hipatia esta convencida que es una todologa, ella comenta que se levanta a las 6 am para hacerle el desayuno a su hijo Roy el menor de los cuatros, este joven  esta a punto de ser un Ingeniero en Sistemas, eso la hace una mujer orgullosa de sus hijos, dentro de su hogar tiene a un Biólogo, un Ingeniero  en  Comercio Exterior y una Psicóloga, considera que  la mejor herencia que los padres les pueden dar a sus hijos es el estudio.

Hipatia es una mujer que le gusta trabajar no quedarse con los brazos cruzados por ello no descansa, ella muy segura de su trabajo y convencida que obtendrá el crédito que esta solicitando el mismo que lo invertirá en más  telas, sabanas, edredones y joyas. Dice que tiene muchos proyectos a futuro.
texts.en:
Hipatia is a founding member of the Our Lady of Light cooperative bank of the city of Manta. Together with other members, she achieved the construction of the church that is the location where their bank associates meet. She tells us this was no easy task, but with the help from Fundación Espoir, their dream became a reality. Currently, Hipatia works as a seamstress, an occupation she has carried out for 20 years. She took classes and also learned First Aid, how to give injections, IV fluids, take blood pressure readings; in addition to this, she also sells silver jewelry. She carries out all these activities from her own home. She doesn’t have to travel around with her merchandise, as she has regular customers that visit her. She became a widow 10 months ago, leaving her in the company of her 4 children, of whom 3 are professionals. They have been her support in the aftermath of losing her husband. Hipatia is convinced that she can do it all. She tells us she gets up at 6 am to make breakfast for her youngest son, Roy, who has almost completed his degree as a Systems Engineer. This makes her very proud of her children. In her home she has a Biologist, an Engineer, and a Psychologist, and she considers that the best legacy parents can give their children is a good education. Hipatia is a woman who enjoys working, and is never idle or resting. She is very secure in her work, and confident that she will obtain the loan she is requesting. She will use the funds to invest is more fabrics, sheets, comforters, and jewelry. She tells us she has many future projects planned.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, sheets, comforters, and jewelry.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix tiene 36 años, vive en casa de sus padres y aun no tiene planes de casarse, ni de tener hijos. Desde niño se ha dedicado a la siembra de plátanos, café y piña, pero lo que más le gusta es el café, porque en las épocas de cosecha puede acumular rápidamente dinero. Por tal motivo, después de la recolección se apresura en lavar y secar los granos, posteriormente alquila un carro para transportar el café hasta la empresa que le cotiza a un precio considerable, el cual le permite cubrir su inversión y obtener buenas ganancias. Mientras que los plátanos los vende en su misma chacra cada quince días; esa es la rutina laboral de Félix, además le gusta mucho su actividad, es por ello que lo realiza con mucha dedicación. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde ha demostrado ser un cliente muy puntal al pagar cada una de sus cuotas y se siente muy cómodo con todos sus compañeros de su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos cafetaleros.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Tossou Kokou

texts.fr: Cet homme a investi depuis 2005 le marché très prisé de la vente de boissons locales appelées « sodabi ». Il vend cette boisson dans son quartier Kégué à Lomé où il a beaucoup de clients qui lui sont fidèles. Cette activité lui permet surtout de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il reçoit même des commandes de la part des bars et restaurants de Lomé. Actuellement dans sa boutique les étalages sont presque vides ; c’est pour cela qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 30 bidons de Sodabi. Il compte sur sa maîtrise du matché pour vite rembourser le prêt dans les délais impartis. Il est célibataire et sans enfant.
texts.en:
In 2005, this man invested in the very popular market of selling a local drink called sodabi. He sells this drink in his district of Kégué in Lomé, where he has many customers loyal to him. This business enables him in particular to provide for his family. He even receives orders from bars and restaurants in Lomé. Right now, the shelves are nearly bare in his shop; this is why he’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 30 drums of sodabi. He is counting on his mastery of the market in order to repay the loan quickly within the given time frame. He is unmarried and has no children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa A. is a woman who has faith and determination to bring her family out from the spiral of poverty. She is 31-year-old and a mother to Mary Ann who is 7 years old and an elementary pupil. Her husband Allan is her business partner.
For more than two years already, they had been doing the fishing business. Fishing is one of the major sources of livelihood in their village since it is surrounded with lake. They catch fish trough fishnets. They sell the fish in their village and some are brought to the market. The business runs smoothly and it brings them enough proceeds to sustain the needs of them family.
Just recently, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with full of hope to have access to capital for her business. When she received her first loan, she carefully spent it in the purchase of fishing gears. Now she is about to received her requested loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for second-hand boat and bundles of fishnets for fishing purposes.
She is positive that she can reach her dreams slowly-by-slowly with the help of ASHI and trust of KIVA.  She really dreams of sending her only child to school until she finish her college and find job. She dreams of having huge fishing boat.

loans.use: To pay for second-hand boat and bundles of fishnets for fishing purposes.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is engaged in vegetable vending in their village.  She sells her products by roaming around their village and going from one house to another.  Having vegetables in their backyard helps her save more income. She hopes to maintain her business for it serves as their main source of income.  

Aida is requesting for a loan amounting to PHP8,000. This amount will be of great help to further expand her business.  She hopes that the lenders will support her business for her to achieve her dreams.  Through her business, she is also positive that their way of living will also improve and develop.  

Aida is 42 years old and lives in the village of Minallo, Naguilian, Isabela.  She is married to Wilfredo, 61 years old and works as a farmer.  They have four children and she is happy that they are all working.  She hopes that they will all be successful in life someday.

loans.use: Additional capital to maintain her retail business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita T., is a former KIVA client. She wants to request another loan to be able to support her small rice field. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to buy her family food and other basic needs. It also helps her pay the tuition and other school fees. Her family is totally relying on the size of the harvest that her farm will produce.  Currently, she tills a 1.5-hectare farm. She hopes that someday she will have a larger farm to support more of the family needs. 

She would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm and buy farming necessities to increase her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 48 years old and a resident of San Lorenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is married to Florante, who works as jeepney driver in their village. They have three children, two of whom are still studying. 

Elvira has owned and operated a canteen in her village for more than ten years. She sells different commodities such as snacks, drinks and junk food. She earns a net income of PHP 300 a day from her business, and she is glad that she can provide for the daily needs of her family.  

Elvira is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from KIVA lenders to maintain and further expand her business. With the loan, she can purchase additional items to sell, such as breads and other commodities that will appeal to her customers.  She hopes that her loan will be granted because it will surely help her business to grow, and through her business, she hopes to fund her children’s education all the way through college.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her canteen

loans.name: Shela

texts.en:
Shela R. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old. Shela is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Shela owns & operates a business in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  The main source of income from the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Shela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Shela is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Shela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah sells ice fish and foodstuffs. She also has a grinding machine that she uses to grind pepper in the market. With these combined businesses, she hopes to make more profit to enable her to support her husband to meet the basic needs of the home. She has been in this business for a long time.

Sarah lives in Badagry, Lagos state. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and ice fish to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice fish and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima is 35 years old and is the mother of five children. All of her children are in school from primary to junior high level respectively. To support her household, she sells cereals, like beans, maize, millet, rice and groundnuts, in the community market to her loyal customers. She says that sales of these products is very lucrative and the goods move fast. She has been in business for the last eleven years now, and has lots of experience selling. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities in the northern part of Ghana, and sometimes in the surrounding villages where she lives.

She is requesting this loan to increase her stock as we approach the Christmas festivities. She believes this loan will enable her to make a good income to support her family, especially their education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals like groundnut, rice, maize, millet and beans.

loans.name: Matile

texts.en:
Matile T. is 36 and married with 5 children (ages 11-months - 17 years).  She owns a business venture, 0.  Matile has many years of experience in this business.  Matile needs a loan of WST $1750 To purcahse paints, fabrics and an elei board. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 220 tala or US $92 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Matile joined SPBD.    This is her 3rd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Matile's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Matile T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.55 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purcahse paints, fabrics and an elei board.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina M. is from the village of Parog Parog, Solana, Cagayan. She is 62 years old. Josefina is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Josefina plants and harvests rice for sale. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 37,000 PHP from ASKI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy corrugated iron roofing, sand and gravel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn H. is a 33-year-old married woman with four children; three of them are students in the local school, and also help their parents with farming while the youngest one is only 3 years old. This couple lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. 

Mrs. Horn H. and her husband, Mr. Ken Tim, are farmers who own 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Aside from farming, Mr. Ken Tim is a motorbike taxi driver who can earn a little extra income to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to improve their family's living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Horn H. decided to ask for a loan to buy 500 ducklings to breed for duck eggs. This loan will increase her ability to improve the family's living conditions. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy 500 ducklings

loans.name: Tari

texts.en:
Tari M. is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family including her husband and three children. Her husband, Mr. Shyam M., works in a catering service. She has one daughter and two sons. Her daughter is studying in grade 12 and her sons are studying in secondary school. 

Mrs. M. set up her grocery store two years ago to improve the economic condition of her family. Her husband and daughter also help her in the shop. She sells different types of grocery goods such as rice, maize, cold drinks and various types of snacks. She requests a loan of 30,000 Nepalese rupees to buy grocery goods. She will also use this loan to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell fish, food condiments and palm oil.

loans.name: Si Se Puede! 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Carolina is the coordinator of her group Si se pueD.! (Yes We Can!) and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally — many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She lives in a simple structure as a single mother with her child.

Carlonia is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in purchasing more rice, sugar, coffee, yuca, bananas and plantains. She will use the profits to invest in a computer for her child to learn on. Her dream is save towards turning her small stand into a large grocery store and have a vehicle to move merchandise with. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: too buy Rice, sugar, coffee, yuca, bananas and plantains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly V. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 39 years old. Norly is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Norly owns and operates a service-based business and at the same time operates a retail store. The main source of income for the retail business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norly is just starting this business. In 2006, Norly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,500.00 Philippine pesos from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Norly is requesting a new loan of 5,000.00 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for the repair of her motor-cab. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Norly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the family's daily consumption and to support the education of her child. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her motor-cab

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy A. is from the village of  Talon Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Juvy is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Juvy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is a happily married woman with two children who attend school. Her spouse is a driver by profession and he contributes to his family's basic needs. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. She cites electricity as her greatest monthly expense. She has been operating her soft drink business for the last two years. Recently she was employed as a receptionist. In addition, she has a poultry business and also has rental houses as another source of income. Zainabu sells from home to her neighbors and potential customers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in the business. With the loan of Kshs 70,000, she wants to purchase a freezer for soft drink storage and chicks for her poultry business.  Her major goal is to have a poultry farm in the future. She decided to work with Yehu to get access to sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for soft drink storage and ten chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Eunice Atieno

texts.en:
Eunice Atieno A. has been selling cereal since 2006, a business she started after quitting chips-selling which didn't have a good turnover. She buys her stock in Kibuye on a daily basis since the business is still small and she has no storage facility for bulk quantities. She plans to expand the venture and to do so, she has applied for a loan worth KSH.10,000 from KMET-KIVA micro-finance initiative. She is optimistic that this will enable her to achieve her dream of operating a wholesale business.

She is 29 years of age, married and a mother of three children.

loans.use: To increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Zinc sheets, stone, blocks, sand

loans.name: Mrs. Sarath You Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eleven people based in Tonle village in Takeo province. They have selected Mrs. Sarath Y., aged 40, as their village bank president. They will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sarath Y. owns a general store in the local village where she sells groceries to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Bou TU. Kheng, is a soldier. He is also a farmer and owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband's field is infertile but she does not have enough money to address this. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sarath Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan she will hire farm laborers to grow rice. 

She is the mother of four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, two are enrolled in the local school and the youngest is one year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a 34-year old farmer and supplier of building materials in the Shanzu area. He is married and they are blessed with one child. His wife supports him in his work in the farm. Daniel has been in this business for the past four years he says that his monthly income is enough to support his family needs.

This marks Daniel’s second loan from KADET. With this loan, he would like to purchase dairy cows. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his child and also to improve his business. In the future. Daniel would like to be successful in life: become a leading supplier of building materials and to be a prosperous farmer.

loans.use: To purchase dairy cows.

loans.name: Juliet's Group

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 43 years old. Juliet is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juliet is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Juliet joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Damasco

texts.es:
El señor Damasco Z. tiene 62 años de edad, está casado con la señora Juana Medina, juntos tienen 2 hijos ya todos mayores.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 30 años, empezó trabajando en construcciones en una empresa de obras en la capital de la Argentina, ya que no habiendo nada que hacer por la zona en donde el vivía, tuvo que rebuscarse en otro país para poder salir adelante, después de 15 años regreso a Paraguaya, fue ahí donde le conoció a la que iba a ser su esposa, la señora Juana, inmediatamente ya se casaron y tuvieron hijos.  

Hasta el momento sigue trabajando en las construcciones, profesión que había aprendido fuera del país, el  préstamo solicitado es para la compra una mezcladora ya que esa herramienta es imprescindible para éste trabajo.
Agradece mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Damasco Z. is 62 years old and married. His wife's name is Juana Medina, and they have two adult children.

Damasco has been working in construction for more than 30 years. He started out with a construction company in the capital of Argentina as there was no work in the area where he was living. He had to move to another country in order to make any progress in life. After 15 years he returned to Paraguay where he met his future wife, Sra. Juana. They got married straightaway and had children.

Damasco is still working in construction, a job he learned to do outside the country. He plans to use the loan to buy a cement mixer as it is an indispensable tool for the work he does.

He is very grateful to Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with a son who attends school. He owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He operates a blacksmith business making the Kenya ceramic "jiko". This is a portable stove that uses charcoal as fuel. Therefore the challenge lies in improving the stoves that he makes and the lack of enough raw materials. Ali hopes to open a big workshop of blacksmith in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase used containers to make jiko's (charcoal burning braziers). He decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance and education on how to plan his future business.

loans.use: To purchase used containers to make jiko's (charcoal burning braziers)

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working in construction since 2003 and is talented at completing concrete blocks for home projects. He is thankful for his business revenue; it has allowed him to own his personal house and get married. He currently has a baby and needs to work hard to satisfy all of his family's needs.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al. to purchase additional tools needed to strengthen his business and produce more concrete blocks. In the future, he hopes to continue his work and is optimistic about the prospects for business growth in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 35 years old and belongs to the historic Pakistani city of Lahore. Lahore is the second-largest city of Pakistan. She lives there in a small house that consists of three rooms with her husband, brother, and four children. Three of her children are enrolled in a local school, while the youngest is one year old.

Her husband is a painter by profession and paints walls, ceilings, and houses on order. He makes deals with building and house owners and completes their work in the set time to earn an income for the family. Her brother is a scrap dealer. He operates a scrap shop in the market, and support Mumtaz financially through his earnings. Mumtaz supports her family by selling paper envelopes. She receives orders from different stationary shops and fulfills the orders on time. Besides her business, she has also proved herself to be a very good housewife, who takes care of her household responsibilities very well.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who will buy scrap, such as used paper and plastic bottles, for his scrap business and make more income by increasing his sales. Mumtaz is hopeful that investing her loan money in her brother’s business will make him stand on his own feet and that his income will also be increased. She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy scraps for her recycling business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy G. is from the town of Maular, Aloran. He is 33 years old and married, with 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Joy sells a variety of food products at his store. Joy has been engaged in his business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Joy is requesting a new loan, his third from GDMPC, for 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira, reside en Cacaopera, departamento de Morazán, junto a su familia que está conformada por su esposo, dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 12 años, ambos estudian, ella tiene 35 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace dos años, negocio que aprendió por la necesidad de obtener ingresos para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, las ventas las realiza de 7:00am a 5:00pm, con los vecinos de la zona y personas que transitan por el lugar.
Actualmente ella quiere realizar compras de mercadería para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para hacer la inversión en manzanas, bananas, uvas, sandias, con esta ayuda estará contando con mercadería para ofrece a los clientes y tener la oportunidad de vender más.
Las aspiraciones de ella es ver crecer el negocio, comprar un vehículo para vender a domicilio por varios lugares, y de esta forma ampliarse y tener mejores ganancias para crecer a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yanira lives in Cacaopera, in Morazán department, with her family: her husband and two children aged 8 and 12 who are both studying.  Yanira is 35 years old and she has been selling fruit and vegetables for two years.  She learned her business out of necessity.  She needed to earn some income to help her husband with their household expenses.  She makes her sales from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  She sells to her neighbors and people passing through.

Yanira would currently like to buy merchandise for her business which is why she is requesting a loan.  She will invest in buying apples, bananas, grapes and watermelons.  With this help she will have merchandise to offer her customers and the opportunity to sell more.

Yanira's aspirations are to see her business grow, to buy a vehicle so that she can sell door-to-door in some places and, in this way, to expand and make better profits with which she can support her children.

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: Betty  Wamboi

texts.en:
Betty Wamboi M. is a 29-year-old businesswoman. She is married to Titus and together they have three children. For the last three years, Betty has been selling clothes in Bamburi as her primary business. She also sells sausages to most of her customers who come to buy clothes.

This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to purchase more clothes to add to her stock. The anticipated profits have been directed to the expansion of her business. Her dreams and hopes for the future are to own a car and become a supplier.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence A. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, who are not currently in school. Florence has a business selling charcoal, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a plot of land. Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to protect herself from HIV/AIDS.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Macuitxochitl Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Macuitlxochitl. Que en el dialecto nahuatl el cual todavia se habla en esa zona significa: cinco flores). Y es el nombre del boulevard que esta en la entrada a dicha comunidad. Esta ubicado en Puebla en México. El grupo está conformado por diez integrantes. Esta foto fue tomada en la pequeña tienda de la señora Juliana A. P. quien es integrante del grupo. Tiene 46 años de edad no tiene estudios ni tampoco dependientes economicos, vive unicamente con su esposo, se a dedicado al comercio de frutas, verduras y abarrotes. Negocio que inicio hace 10 años. Solicita este prestamo para compra de mercancia. Sus clientes la prefieren por que los atiende amablemente y ahí encuentran lo que necesitan para preparar sus alimentos, también encuentran las frutas y verduras frescas a muy buen precio. Ella se siente muy contenta y comprometida ya que con este crédito va a poder invertir en su negocio para poder obtener más ingreso y así mismo más clientes y una mejor calidad de vida. Oservaciones, la señora que no se alcanza a ver bien se llama Maria Antonia V. M.
texts.en:
This group is called Macuitlxochitl which in Nahuatl, which is still spoken in this area, means Five Flowers.  That’s the name of the boulevard that’s at the entrance of said community.  It is located in the state of Puebla, México.   The group has 10 members and the photo was taken in member Juliana A. P.’s small store.

She is 46 years old and has neither formal schooling nor any economic dependents.  She lives just with her husband.  She went into fruit, vegetable and grocery sales, a business she started 10 years ago.

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise.  Her customers prefer her because she caters to them kindly and they find what they need to prepare their meals there.  They also find fresh fruit and vegetables at a very good price.

She feels happy and committed because the loan will allow her to invest in her business to obtain more income as well as more customers and a better quality of life.

(Observation:  the woman who can’t be made out too well is called María Antonia V. M.)

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunieron unas mujeres con el fin de  capitalizar su actividad y otras para emprender actividades productivas, les resultaron muy fructíferas  e interesantes por los beneficios brindados por el programa.
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Katupyry, actualmente se encuentran en el décimo quinto ciclo; en el ciclo anterior tropezaron con inconvenientes debido a que dos integrantes no cuplieron a cabalidad con el pago de sus cuotas pero con el esfuerzo de todas lograron recuperarse, el grupo está  integrada por 15 emprendedoras señoras, quienes ponen lo mejor de si para aumentar sus ingresos y brindarles lo mejor a sus respectivas familias. Todas las integrantes son luchadoras y han invertido sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades.
La sra. Gladys, la presidenta del comité, cada día sale a la madrugada de su casa para poder vender sus frutas a las amas casas, antes de que estas decidan ir al mercado, ella se acerca casa por casa, desea por ello poseer su pequeño puesto de venta, ya que todos la conocen por la buena calidad de sus productos. Necesita el crédito para comprar más frutas, a fin de venderlos y aumentar sus ingresos para realizar su meta.
texts.en:
In Paraguarí, women meet with the goal of capitalizing their businesses and undertaking productive business ventures. The result has been very fruitful and interesting due to the benefits brought on by the program. The group goes by the name Kuña Katupyry and is currently in its 5th cycle. In the previous cycle, the group ran into problems because two of its members did not fulfill their loan payments. However, with much effort they all managed to recover. The group is made up of 15 enterprising women who do their best to increase their incomes and to provide the best for their respective families. All the women are hard workers and have invested their loans in their individual businesses.

Gladys is the president of the group. Every day she leaves her house at dawn in order to sell fruit to housewives before they decide to go to the store. She goes house to house and wants to own her own stand because everyone knows her for the high quality of her products. She needs the loan to buy more fruit to sell so she can increase her income and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita F., from the village of Usocan, is 47 years old, married, and has two grown children. To make a living, Charita owns and operates a business making and selling dried foods in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Charita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 16,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used as working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This will be Charita's sixth loan from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Margarita L. A. casada, 50 años D. edad, 01 hijo; integrante como fiscal del grupo comunal "Los Girasoles".
Margarita L. vive en Palian que pertenece al distrito D. Uñas en la cuidad D. Huancayo.
Su actividad econòmica es el bordado D. trajes tìpicos D. la zona; ademàs D. esta actividad viaja todas las semanas a la zona D. Pariahuanca para comprar frutas D. temporada y los reparte al por mayor en el mercado modelo D. Huancayo.
Tiene una hija D. 13 años llamada Betsy, esta cursando estudios secundarios; y es por ella que Margarita lucha dìa a dìa para que no le falte nada y pueda darle una mejor vida a la que ella tuvo.
El crèdito otorgado seràpara comprar telas para bordar y asì poder cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
(En La fotografìa Margarita viste D. chompa color negro)
texts.en:
Margarita L. A., the acting treasurer of the “Los Girasoles” [The Sunflowers] group, is 50 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Palian, which belongs to the Uñas district in the city of Huancayo.

Margarita’s main business activity is embroidering the traditional clothing worn in the area. In addition, she also travels weekly to Pariahuanca to buy whichever fruits are in season. She then sells these wholesale in the Huancayo market.

Margarita’s daughter, Betsy, is a high-school student. Margarita works so hard so that she will lack nothing and will have a better life than her mother does. 

This loan will be used to buy cloth to embroider, in order to fulfil existing orders.

(In the photo, Margarita is wearing the black jacket.)

loans.use: to buy cloth to embroider

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family. Cecelia is single and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.
Cecelia is borrowing PHP 3500 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency. Cecelia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To pay for the purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Yucay,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; es soltero, la socia tiene 20 años de edad, el socio se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, el socio siembra maíz, verduras el socio según la época siembra todo tipo de verduras entre las que encontramos repollo, zanahorias, zapallo, y otras; el socio desea comprar fertilizantes, semillas y abono, el socio tiene su terreno y ahora en esta nueva etapa el socio desea invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abonos para sembrar nuevamente maíz. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y abono.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”. This bank is located in the settlement of Yucay, the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mr. Jose Luis. He is single and 20 years old. The member primarily works in agriculture planting corn and vegetables. Depending on the season, the member plants all types of vegetables including cabbage, carrots, squash and others. The member wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and manure. The member has his land and in this new season the member wants to invest in buying fertilizers and manure to plant corn again. The member is requesting this loan to buy fertilizers and manure.

The member is very thankful for the loan and promises to complete his payments on the loan in a disciplined manor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Josephine operates a transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPIRITU SANTO” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Norah. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de plásticos, venta de cebolla y escabeche, tejido, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado, cosméticos, macramé de mantas.

La señora Norah,  indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de plásticos que viene trabajando hace un año, mediante los viajes que realizaba al Desaguadero (frontera Bolivia Perú)  con su tía aprendió. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra mercadería (compra de plásticos) los que venderá el la feria 16 de Julio (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro
texts.en:
The “HOLY GHOST” group will start its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Los Andes.  The group is comprised of eight members, and is led by a management board headed by Norah.  The businesses that the members carry out are varied, and include the sale of: plastics, onions and escabeche (a typical dish of Bolivia), knitwear, food, blankets, fish, cosmetics and macramé.

Norah indicates that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two years, having joined the group by invitation of a promoter.  Currently, she has a business selling plastic products that she has had for one year.  She learned the trade through her trips to the Desaguadero (on the border of Bolivia and Perú) with her aunt.

The loan she is taking out now is for the purchase of plastic products that she will sell at the 16th of July Market (a commercial area in the city of El Alto) every day.  This means of work allows her to generate income to support her family; she lives with her partner and has six children.  

When asked why she likes working with Pro Mujer, she replies that it’s because she likes the savings.

loans.use: buy merchandise (plastic products).

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is 46, married and has two children. She worked as a nurse at the local hospital, but her wage was too low to cover her household expenses. 

In 2001, in order to find an additional means of subsistence, she decided to engage in cattle breeding business. She started with purchasing one cow and managed to enlarge number of her cattle to two horses, two cows and ten sheep. Now this energetic woman plans to raise her monthly selling of milk products (which is about  4.500 KGS) by purchasing more milk cows. For this reason, Gulnara has applied for a loan of 100.000 KGS. With the revenues, she plans further enlargement of her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Prouem

texts.en: Mrs. Prouem is a polite 37-year-old villager who lives in the Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are employed as local workers in a potato plantation. They typically generate revenues of US$5 each day and have been working in this career for over one year. They also depend on their four children who are employed in the same occupation. The other two children are still learning in public school. As their current house became old and narrow, they weren't able to enlarge their house because they lack the funds. Therefore, Mrs. Prouem would like to apply for a loan in the amount of $500 to be used to a plot of land for structure a new house that is larger than their present house.

loans.use: to a plot of land for structure a new house.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Mrs. Peou, 38, is a married woman and the mother of two children, both of whom are married and living independently. Her husband is Moeurn, 29, a local rice farmer and also fisherman. Mrs. Peou makes a living by selling fresh fish that she gets from her husband's fishing or from other local fishermen in and around her village, Baray district. 

From her fish-selling business, Mrs. Peou can make about US$ 2 each day.  Because some of her husband's fishing implements are broken or torn and this may affect her husband’s business activity, Mrs. Peou would like to request a loan to buy new fishing equipment, for example a boat, a motor, and nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment, for example, a boat, a motor, and nets.

loans.name: Ascension

texts.es:
Ascensión, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 13 años de edad, él es agricultor y albañil, tiene 30 años de estar sembrando maíz  y frijol, además trabaja la albañilería, aprendió por su padre y trabaja todos los días o dependiendo de la necesidad de trabajo.
Por el momento Ascensión necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en abono, insecticidas y fertilizantes, todos estos materiales para aplicarlos a la siembra, pues ayudan a crecer la plantación de maíz y frijol.
Él espera tener una cosecha abundante, generar ingresos para la familia y seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ascensión lives with his wife and three children who are 15, 14 and 13 years of age.  He’s both a farmer and a bricklayer.  He’s been farming corn and beans for 30 years.  He learned from his father and works every day or according to the work needed.

At present, Ascensión needs a loan to buy manure, insecticide and fertilizer.  He will apply all these materials to his crops because they help the corn and beans to grow.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest to generate income for the family and continue supporting his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide and fertilizer for his corn crops.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is 50 years old and is a married woman with two children aged 23 and 21. She earns a living through farming. Nimfa primarily grows rice to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Nimfa said she earns about 10,000 PHP per month from farming. Nimfa works hard to support her family and her children's education. 

Nimfa is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 25 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Carlos desde hace algunos años cuenta con un puesto en el mercado de Paijan, donde vende carne de pollo al por mayor y menor, tiene su propia clientela por vender un producto de buena calidad y con mucha limpieza, con los ingresos que obtiene puede solventar sus necesidades personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme  Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mayor cantidad de carne de pollo para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de sus clientes y con sus ganancias podrá pagar el crédito otorgado, también seguirá ayudando a sus padres económicamente en los gastos de la casa. Carlos es un hombre que desde joven empezó a trabajar para poder salir adelante en la vida y poderles brindar algunos gustos que desean sus padres.
texts.en:
Carlos is 25 years old, single, and lives in his parent's house, which has the basic utilities of water and electricity and is located in an urban area of the Paijan district in the department of La Libertad.  This is an area that is known for its farming, livestock production and tourism.

For a number of years, Carlos has had a stall in the Paijan market where he sells chicken meat at wholesale and retail.  He has his own customer base, because he sells good quality products that are very clean.  With the income he gets from this business he can cover his personal needs.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles to buy a greater quantity of chicken meat so that he can continue to satisfy his customers' needs.  With his earnings he will be able to pay off the loan and continue to assist his parents in paying for the household expenses.   Carlos is man who started to work when he was very young in order to get ahead in life, and so that he could provide his parents with some special items that they wanted.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of chicken meat to sell

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Azucena works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.  Azucena is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
Constitué de sept membres, les femmes du groupe BENKADI 5 sont toutes mariées  avec en moyenne 37 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MAARO, un village situé à environ 45 km de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième cycle prêt avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée par FATOUMA deuxième debout à droite, enfant au dos, est  le riz et l’arachide.               
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labours, acheter des intrants et des semences pour entretenir : 1,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village de LOUTANA et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100.000 FCFA en fin de campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi 5 is made up of seven married women. They are on average 37 years old and have an average of 6 children each. For the most part they live in polygamous families in Maaro, a village located about 45 km from Sikasso, 3rd administrative district of Mali.

They are working with micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. This is their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans were fully repaid. The crops grown by Fatouma, second from the right, standing, with a child on her back, are rice and groundnuts. With her loan, she plans to pay for plowing costs and to buy inputs and seeds for 1.5 hectares of land. After the harvest, the crops are sold at the village of Loutanna and at the Sikasso market to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 100,000 CFA francs at the end of the season. The profit will allow her to repay the loan and help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: As a married mother of 3 children, Josephine works hard to support her family.  She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by raising pigs, farming sugarcane and catering. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.  She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie, 43, is married with four children. She has a retail business selling a variety of products in her community.

Margie is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She dreams of someday having her own stall so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts and blouses for her store.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en: Ziad is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and only sibling. He has been working as a home painter since 2007. He works on a freelance basis, sticking with multiple projects. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase scaffolding and new equipment needed. He reports that these purchases will enable him to provide his services to more customers. In the future, he hopes to further expand his business and continue his work properly.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding and new equipment needed.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria had been patiently operating her sari-sari (variety) store business for almost ten years.  With her experience in retail business she has encountered many problems especially when crisis occurred and she allowed credit on some of the items in her store.  She wants to stock more grocery items but due to inadequate funds she is now asking for a loan to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell in her store. These additional items would help increase her sales.  She is asking an amount of P15,000. 

Gregoria is now 53 years old, married and has two grown-up children.  She usually earns P3,000 each month and uses it as revolving capital to continuously operate the business.  The rest of the income is used to pay electricity bills and pay for her family's daily meals.

In the future Gregoria hopes to earn consistent profits to save enough funds for her future expenses.

loans.use: to buy vinegar, cooking oil, sugar, milk, coffee and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married, 24 years old, and he describes himself as a hardworking business man. He has been charging batteries and selling car batteries for the past year to make a living. James has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he plans to renovate his business premises and also become successful in his business. He has requested a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy more batteries for resale.

loans.use: To buy batteries.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Revelacion En Dios Group

texts.es: Maria, Juana, Diana, Benita, Maria del Carmen, Hilda, Martha y Juan José  conforman el banco comunal Revelación En Dios. Estas personas quieren obtener el crédito para trabajar y poder incrementar el negocio. Maria Del Carmen se dedica a la  venta de  tamales rellenos y necesita comprar maíz, dulce, cuajada, azúcar y otros. Para  a si poder mantener a su familia ya que Maria del Carmen es una señora dedicada  a su trabajo. El desafío que enfrenta este banco comunal es que no tienen un capital suficiente  para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Maria, Juana, Diana, Benita, Maria del Carmen, Hilda, Martha y Juan José are the members of  the "Revelación En Dios" communal bank. They want to obtain a loan, in order to work, and to be able to increase their businesses.

María del Carmen sells stuffed tamales, and needs to buy corn, sweet filling, curds, sugar and other ingredients. This is so that she can support her family, as María del Carmen is a person who is devoted to her work.

The challenge the communal bank faces, is that they don't have enough working capital to keep their businesses going.

loans.use: To buy corn, sweet filling, curds, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Musonyole Group

texts.en:
Nganasa is the facilitator of the Musonyole group. Nganasa and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Nganasa and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Nganasa takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Nganasa had a very good maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Nganasa was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Nganasa will educate his children and save for future use. In 2012, the members of Musonyole group will each plant maize on between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora de 26 años de edad, es madre soltera con 2 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en el distrito de Pichari. Nora desde que se separó de su esposo trabaja muy arduamente por el bienestar de sus dos hijas, ella tiene una moto que todos los días lo da en alquiler empezando a las 6:00 AM y le devuelven a las 8:00 de la noche, ella cobra 25 nuevos soles diarios por el alquiler de la moto. Siento este monto un ingreso fijo por día que ella percibe, con ello Nora a partir de las 6:00 PM vende hamburguesas en la avenida principal del distrito de Pichari, negocio que le va muy bien. Nora está feliz, agradece a sus vecinos y familiares por que son ellos quienes la impulsaron a emprender este negocio de las hamburguesas. En un futuro desea contar con una casa propia donde ella y sus hijos puedan tener todas las comodidades así tener una vida feliz. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por el que Nora se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1500 nuevos soles desea invertir una parte en la reparación de su Moto y la otra en materia prima para la preparación de hamburguesas.
texts.en:
Nora, 26, is a single mother with two children.  They live in a rented house located in the Pichari district.  Since she separated from her husband, Nora has been working very hard for the well-being of her two daughters.  She has a motorcycle that she rents every day beginning at 6:00 a.m. that is returned to her at 8:00 p.m.  She charges 25 PEN per day to rent the motorcycle.  This amount being a fixed daily income that she receives, with it Nora sells hamburgers on the main avenue of the Pichari district after 6:00 p.m., a business that is going very well for her.

Nora is happy.  She is grateful to her neighbors and family members because they are the ones who encouraged her to undertake this hamburger business.  In the future she wants to have her own house where she and her children can have all the comforts and so have a happy life.  This will be her first loan with FMP, for which reason Nora is committed to making her payments punctually.

With the 1500 PEN she wants to invest a part in repairing her motorcycle and the rest in ingredients for making hamburgers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for hamburgers and to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 21 años es soltero vive con los padres y no tiene  hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Juan Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es comprar un terreno para seguir sembrando.
En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents.  They live in the Las Blancas settlement in the Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called "26 de Noviembre" and it is located in Las Blancas in Ventanas canton. The members of the communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Juan is a farmer. In particular, he grows corn, rice and pigeon peas. He makes his purchases in Ventanas every month and makes his sales in the market in Ventanas.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure like urea and, insecticides; which are what he uses the most to take care of his crops.  

The loan has helped him increase the family income.  It is also used for planting seeds and for supplies.

His dream is to buy a plot of land in order to continue sowing.

In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure like urea and, insecticides; which are what he uses the most to take care of his crops.

loans.name: Lutgarda

texts.en:
Lutgarda is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Lutgarda is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Lutgarda has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Lutgarda requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lutgarda has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lutgarda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rosa Alejandra

texts.es: Rosa está solicitando el crédito para culminar su carrera de Psicología, ella labora como docente de primaria.. En un futuro ella quiere trabajar en una ONG u hospital ayudando a niños, jóvenes y adultos con problemas de conducta. le inspiran sus padres por su fortaleza y dedicación al apoyarla en todo momento de su vida. Cree que todos los seres humanos tienen oportunidades en la vida, y espera poder lograr su sueño de obtener su título.
texts.en: Rosa is seeking a loan to finish her Psychology degree.  She works as a janitor in an elementary school.  In the future she would like to work for an NGO or in a hospital helping kids, teens, and adults with behavioral problems.  She is inspired by her parents for having the strength and dedication to help her at every moment of her life.  She believes that all human beings have opportunities in life, and she hopes to be able to realize her dream of getting her degree.

loans.use: to pay for classes she needs to graduate.

loans.name: Kerotai B Group

texts.en:
The Kerotai B of Nuru International consists of three farmers. It is based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Zacharia, who is raising his hand in the picture, is 23 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. He has been a member of this group since 2008. He is very excited about the 2014 long rains and he hopes to implement better farming methods to increase the farm yields.  

Zacharia is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, millet, and sorghum on his one-acre farm. He is optimistic that he will obtain enough food from the yields and sell the surplus to invest in a shop business.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai is 66 years old and married , and she has two children. She is a small-scale farmer and has been growing crops to sell for the last 30 years. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm, to enable her to harvest more farm produce to sell and thus make more profits to support her family.She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. Her future hopes are to improve her farming, make more income, and support her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm

loans.name: Joyce Njambi

texts.en:
This business is a member of Enkakenya Women Group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff

Joyce is married with 3 children. She was educated up to primary school level. She was later trained on livestock management. This enabled her to work on improving the cattle for marketing. She is also a devoted member of catholic church.

Traditionally the family has always kept cattle because it has a large area for grazing. Instead of keeping large herds of cattle, Joyce has turned to purchasing of good quality steers and rearing them for 6 months using modern improved methods. She later market the steers at Enkirgirri market at USD 205. Currently Joyce has only 3 steers out of 5 as two died out of prolonged drought.

loans.use: Given USD 450, Joyce will be able to purchase 3 steers and rear them for the market. She will also buy feeds and also graze them in her land now that the rains has come.

loans.name: Khalig

texts.en:
Khalig is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He works as the machinist. He has been rented a small garage where he repairs cars. He is hard working person. He married and has 2 children. He began his business 9 years ago and it allows him to support to his family. He is 26. In 2004 he borrowed $300 from Normicro spent this loan amount to buy some spaddles, putties and dyes. 
For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $500 and has bought the drying apparatus.
Khalig applies for a loan amount of $700 to buy finish-polishing bench and some dyes.

loans.use: To buy finish-polishing bench and some dyes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O. is 65 years old with five children. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She intends to use her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve on the business

loans.name: Toey

texts.en: Ms. Toey S. is 32 years old, married and a mother of three children.  Her children are in school. She lives with her husband and family in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a grocery stand from her home and normally makes around $2.50 in revenue each day. Her husband is a teacher and makes a meager income. In order to meet her clients' needs improve her grocery stand, S. is currently requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery products to sell at her stand. In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to expand her business with a variety of products to fulfill her clients' demand.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to sell at her stand

loans.name: Marjurie

texts.es: La Sra. L. se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos desde hace más de cinco años, con este negocio sostiene a su familia y en la actualidad está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos ya que se acerca la etemporada navideña y quiere comprar los artículos antes de que suban los precios y aprovechar también grandes descuentos que le están ofreciendo sus proveedores. Nos comentó tambien que quiere ivertir parte del dinero en hacerle arreglos al local para evitar que algunas personas le roben y que sus productos estén más seguros.
