loans.use: El crédito piensa invertirlo en la compra de electrodomésticos y para invertirlo en la seguridad de su local.

loans.name: Maximo Nicolas

texts.en:
My names is Maximo Nicolas P.. I have a small store where I sell beans, rices, vegetables, eggs, etc. I have had this business for 5 years. Ever since I left my old job I have dedicated myself to sales. I also sell vegetables in the streets in the morning. I am very happily married to my wife. The two of us help each other a lot in order to cover the expenses of our home. We are a couple of old people that are not given work. Thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein.

Mi nombre es Maximo Nicolas P., Tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de Frijoles, arroz, verduras, huevos, etc. Este negocio lo tengo hace 5 años. Desde que me corrieron de mi trabajo, me didico a la venta. Tambien vendo en las calles verduras por la mañana. Estoy casado vivo con mi esposa y los dos nos apoyamos mucho para poder cubrir gastos que tenemos en nuestro hogar, ya somos dos personas viejas que no nosdan trabajo. gracias por su ayuda

loans.use: Purchase of several products

loans.name: Atalani

texts.en: Atalani Samailia is 42 years old and married with three children. She is very good at baking cakes, pies, scones, donuts and buns. She applied for this loan in order to buy the ingredients needed for her mixtures and baking. Atalani delivers some of her goods to shops in the village but mostly sells in town where she is developing a great reputation. This is all thanks to the loans that she has received so far.  She hopes to remain in the loan program for a long time to come.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her bakery

loans.name: Bertilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertilda is 44 years old and finished elementary school. She has 6 children, 4 of which still depend on her. She lives in the small town of Palermo in the district of Chao in the province of Viru in the county of La Libertad. She dedicates herself to the raising of animals such as: turkeys, ducks, and chickens that she sells to people in her community as well as taking them to Trujillo to sell in the large market. She also a cow and two calves that are producing milk that she sells everyday to a large dairy product company in the country. In addition she plants corn and sells it to wholesalers in Viru and Trujillo. She is a member of the group “Las Luchadoras” (The Fighters), and they provided her first loan of 300 soles ($150) that helped her complete the sum to buy her first cow. With this loan of 700 soles ($250), which she will pay back in four months, she’ll buy fertilizer for the corn she has planted. Mrs. Bertilda dreams of buying more dairy cows in order to start a dairy farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Bertilda tiene 44 años de edad, estudio primaria completa. Tiene 6 hijos y 4 aún dependen de ella. Vive en el Poblado Menor Palermo del Distrito de Chao de la Provincia de Virú del Departamento de La Libertad. Se dedica a la crianza de animales como: pavos, patos y gallinas, los cuales luego vende a personas que van a comprar en su comunidad y también los lleva a vender a Trujillo, en el mercado mayorista, además tiene una vaca y dos terneras que está dando leche, la cual vende todos los días a una empresa grande de producción de lácteos en el país; también siembra maíz, el que vende a comerciantes mayoristas de Virú y Trujillo. Es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Luchadoras”, en este grupo obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles con los cuales completó el dinero necesario para comprar su vaca. Con este préstamo de S/.700 soles, que cancelará en cuatro meses, comprará abono para el maíz que ha sembrado. La señora Bertilda sueña con comprar más vacas lecheras y poner una lechería.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the land.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Born in 1976 in Havé Doumé in the Zio prefecture, Mr K. Anani is married and the father of three (3) children. A professional farmer, he finds that the soil has returned a poor profit. So he has decided to get a taxi bike and, with this, to be able to provide the necessities for the family. His woman, also a farmer, contributes very little to the family expenditures. An honest man, he has demonstrated good management of his affairs until now. To have a new bike and new fertile soil, he requests a loan of $1000. Thus will he be able to efficiently contribute to the improvement of the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1976 à Havé Doumé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur K. Anani est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Cultivateur de profession, il constate que la terre lui rapportait peu de bénéfice. Alors il décida de faire taxi moto et, avec celui-ci, il arrive subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Sa femme, cultivatrice aussi contribue très peu dans les dépenses de la famille. Honnête, il fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités jusqu’à ce jour. Pour avoir une nouvelle moto et de nouvelles terres fertiles, il sollicite un crédit de $1000. Il pourra ainsi efficacement contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a taxi bike

loans.name: Kyebando Central A(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Prossy K.. She is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and catering and is requesting a loan to open up a bigger restaurant. Prossy is 34 years old and married. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 17 and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Prossy hopes to be able to pay the school fees for the children.

Prossy is joined in her small group by Ketty N., Mariam N., Catherine N., and Caroline T.. Ketty N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase food warmers. Mariam N. is currently operating a business in charcoal selling and wants a loan to expand to bulk selling. Catherine N. operates a business of charcoal selling and wants to increase her inventory. Caroline T. is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add to her business.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
Candina, 41, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She only completed one year of school and she's never learned to read or write. She has 4 children, all of whom still live with her. She earns a living raising pigs and "cuyes" (a guineau pig-like animal that's a common food animal in Peru) and knitting bags, sweaters, etc., all of which she sells to customers in the Huamachuco region of Peru.

Candina joined the MMR after her neighbor, Peta, explained that she could borrow money there and she told us that the loan was a big help to her business. She then became a member of the San Borja community lending group. With this loan of S/.1000, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy roofing materials and beams to build a house on a lot that she bought recently. She's planned it for many years, but for the mountains where she lived before, not for La Libertad where she came with her husband and children for reasons they still don't understand. Her greatest wish is to finish building a house on the lot she bought in February.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Candina tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad - Perú. Solo tiene un año de estudio no sabe leer ni escribir; tiene 4 hijos el cual aun dependen de ella. La señora Candina se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, cuyes y al tejido de chalinas, bolsas, chompas y los vende en la parte de la sierra en Huamachuco lo reparte a su clientela que a conseguido.

La señora Candina ingresa al MMR por medio de su vecina la señora Peta que le explico como podía sacar crédito en esta institución, ella nos expresa que el préstamo le fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo prosperar en su negocio y de esa manera pudo ser parte del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja”. Con el préstamo de S/.1000.00 el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará eternit y bigas para construir su terreno que lo compro hace poco. La señora Candina desde hace mucho que tejía pero en la sierra ya que vivía allí hace tiempo que se vino a la costa por motivo de que ya no se comprendían con su esposo y sus hijos decidieron traerla a vivir a La Libertad. Su mayor sueño es terminar de construir una casa en el lote que compró en el mes de febrero.

loans.use: Buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es:
Teodolinda M. V. is 45 years old: she only completed primary school. She has three children all of whom are dependent on her. She lives in the district of El Provenir in the province of Trujillo in the department of La Libertad - Perú.

She started-up her business selling groceries, vegetables and clothes to wear, to sell in the various mountain villages of the region. Recently she has begun another business together with her daughter, which is the sale of pharmaceutical products.

She was invited by a friend to participate in the Community Bank “Dios de Bendición” (God’s Blessing) from which she obtained her last loan, which served to stock her business and to take advantage of the Christmas season. This went very well and she made a good profit.

With this loan of 1700 Soles, which will be repaid in 4 months she has decided to buy shelving and all types of medicine to set-up her new business with her daughter.

Her dearest wish is to have a vehicle for transportation, in which she would be able to share out their merchandise between different places.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teodolinda M. V. tiene 45 años de edad, solo estudió primaria completa, tiene 3 hijos y una todavía depende de ella. Vive en el Distrito de El Porvenir de la provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia con la venta de abarrotes, verduras y ropa lleva, a vender a diferentes pueblos de la sierra de la región. Recientemente esta iniciando otro negocio junto con su hija, es la venta de productos farmacéuticos.

Es invitada por una amiga a participar del Banco Comunal “Bendición de Dios” en el cual obtuvo un anterior préstamo, el cual le sirvió para surtir su negocio y para aprovechar la campaña navideña. Le fue muy bien ya que tuvo utilidades.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700.00 el cual pagara en cuatro meses ha decidido comprar andamios y todo tipo de medicina para emprender su nuevo negocio junto a su hija.

Su mayor sueño es tener un medio de transporte en la que pueda repartir su mercadería por diferentes lugares.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more stock for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase empanada ingredients and bulk clothing

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.ru:
Hurmat A. lives in the Gissar area. She works as a teacher at the high school number 8 of the Gissar region. Other than teaching, Hurmat has been engaged in the trade of fruits and vegetables for 25 years. She brings the goods, buying them from wholesale traders, and then she sells them at the Gissar market. To increase profit, Hurmat has decided to raise the commodity circulation by receiving a loan. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months. Hurmat is married and has five children. Since her husband does not work anywhere, it is necessary for Hurmat to work a lot to provide food for her children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Абирова Хурмат проживает в районе Гиссар. Работает учителем в средней школе № 8 гиссарского района. Кроме того уже 25 лет как она занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Привозит товар , покупая у оптовых реализаторов и продает на рынке «Гиссар». Для того , чтобы увеличить прибыльность Хурмат решила увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.Хурмат замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Муж нигде не работает поэтому ей приходится много работать для того , чтобы дети всегда были сытыми.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi B. was born in 1976 in Logodomé in the Vo prefecture. He is married and the father of two children. A builder by trade, he is also involved in other activities, such as storekeeping and stock farming. He wants to buy a motorcycle taxi to have an additional source of income. To do so, he is requesting a loan for a term of 16 months. Achieving this goal will enable him to provide for his family’s needs. 
Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer. 

Monsieur B. Koffi est né en 1976 à Logodomé dans la préfecture de vo. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Maçon de  profession ; il exerce aussi d’autres activités comme le commerce et l’élevage. Il veut acheter un taxi –moto pour avoir une source de revenu de plus. 

La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Mrs. Silvia belongs to the Teresa Ramos Communal Bank located on 28 D. Julio Street #302, in the Yarina Cocha District, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and her husband is a farmer. With the first loan of 300 soles ($125) that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling fish. She currently is still running her fish-sales business and has two boats. Two people are in charge of the boats and use them to fish in the rivers and then bring the fish to the Yarina Cocha harbor. With this loan of 2,500 soles ($875), which she will repay over 5 months, she will buy a new motor for one of her boats. Silvia is a woman very dedicated to her work, and has a strong desire to keep moving forward despite some difficulties that present themselves. She is working on forming a committee of women who can organize themselves better in the harbor where the fishermen dock.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Silvia, pertenece al Banco Comunal Teresa Ramos, ubicado en el Jr 28 D. Julio # 302, del Distrito D. Yarina Cocha del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, su esposo es agricultor. Silvia con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta D. pescado. En la actualidad continua con su negocio D. pescado, Silvia tiene 2 botes, en la cual tiene 2 personas a cargo D. ello que se encargan D. ir a pescar por los ríos y luego lo traen para venderlo al puerto D. Yarina Cocha. Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará un motor nuevo para su bote. Silvia, es una mujer muy entregada a su trabajo, además con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante pese a algunas dificultades que se le presenta por lo que dado a su desempeño en este negocio esta formando un comité D. mujeres para organizarse mejor en el puerto que desembarcan los pescados.

loans.use: Buy a motor for her boat

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., aged 35, is a true entrepreneur and has had a business selling sweet radishes since 2000 and makes $5 of profit per day. Her husband, Hong Hai, works picking radishes for his wife to sell. Cambodian people like radishes and normally they serve it with rice. Mrs. Sok would like to borrow from Kiva US$700 to purchase a motorbike to transport radishes to the market. This will reduce the cost that she spends every day on a motor-taxi.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport radishes to the market.

loans.name: Umukulthum

texts.en: Umukulthum has had a school in Zanzibar since 2004.  She is requesting a loan to put towards the school.  To supplement her income from the school, she also maintains a shop in her neighborhood.  Every day, Umukulthum works from 6:00am to 6:00pm and make a monthly profit of approximately $125.  She is 28 years old, divorced, and has two young children.

loans.use: To improve her school.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi G. est revendeur des habits prêts-à-porter à Wome, un village situé au nord-ouest de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 37 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Afin répondre aux demandes de la clientèle, il espère avec ce crédit s’approvisionner alimenter sa boutique.
texts.en:
Kossi G. sells ready-to-wear clothes in Wome, a village located to the north west of Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is 37 years old, married and the father of two children. In order to meet customer demand, he is hoping to use this loan to buy supplies for his shop.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun S. is 49 years old and raises pigs from her house in the Pursat Province. She can sell pigs for slaughter within three or four months and earns around $5 per day. She is married and has four children, one of whom is married and three of whom are single. Her husband is a lifting worker who lifts everything he can to earn an income and makes around $3 per day. To help earn money for the family, one of their daughters left home to work as garment worker in Phnom Penh. 

Because of the growth of her pig raising business, S. needs a loan to purchase more piglets to raise and more wood to use to repair her house. The loan will help to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and wood to make house repairs.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
El Sr. Esteban tiene 43 años y esta casado con la Señora Emilce Espinola y tiene dos hijos menores de edad.
El Sr. Esteban se dedica a la venta de mercerías y artículos para el hogar hace 10 años en varias ciudades como San Antonio, Guarambare, Ñemby, Limpio y otras ciudades aledañas a San Lorenzo. Las ventas y las cobranzas lo realizan el y su Sra. en forma semanal.
Anteriormente trabajaba con empleados que lo estafaron por ese motivo lo realiza de manera familiar y gracias a esto van creciendo comercialmente y lograron terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
Este crédito invertirá en la compra de sabanas y toallas.
texts.en:
Esteban is 43 years old, is married to Emilce Espinola and has two young children. Esteban has worked for the past 10 years selling haberdashery and homewares in a variety of cities surrounding San Lorenzo including San Antonio, Guarambare, Ñemby, Limpio and others. He and his wife make sales and collect payments on a weekly basis. Previously they had employees who swindled money from them, and for this reason they now operate as a family business. Thanks to this they have been able to grow their business and complete the construction of their home. This loan will be used to buy sheets and towels.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheets and towels

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en: Rukia N. is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian woman. She runs a shop at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam, which are very common in Tanzania. Rukia sells a variety of items in her shop, including serial crop products, which are very common and in high demand. Items like maize flower, wheat flower, sugar, groundnuts, cashew nuts, and cooking oil are consumed by customers on a daily basis. Rukia N. is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000. ($600) to buy additional stock.

loans.use: Buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam Y. was born in 1958 and runs a medium-sized farmland for growing potatoes. He started in the business with his wife in 2000, and they make around of $5 per day from his investment. They both live with three children who have left school and who help with their parents' business activities. They together reside in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Y. is applying for a loan as capital to start a new investment by buying beds to store and later to re-sell for a profit. The loan will allow them another income for the family's living. (Y.'s wife is pictured.)

loans.use: To purchase beds for resale.

loans.name: Cyrielle

texts.fr:
Née le 18 Mars 1985 à Cotonou la capitale économique du BENIN, G. Cyrielle est originaire de Porto-Novo la capitale politique du Bénin. Mère d'une fille de 4 ans scolarisée, Cyrielle a divorcé de son mari depuis 2 ans et a, à sa charge son unique fille. Cyrielle vit actuellement dans la maison de son père au quartier Dédokpo, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou qui fait corps avec le lac Nokoué. Cyrielle dispose d'une cabine téléphonique avec deux combinés téléphoniques. Cyrielle vend les cartes de recharges de tous les réseaux téléphoniques mobiles au Bénin. Cyrielle a encore ouvert une cafétariat. Cyrielle envisage faire aussi la pâtisserie. Car au niveau de sa caféteriat, la demande de ses clientes en  pâtisserie est forte. C'est dans cette optique que Cyrielle sollicite de crédit pour étendre ses activités. 
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l'Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born on March 18, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of BENIN, Ms. G. Cyrielle has roots in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Bénin. She is a mother with one 4-year-old daughter, who is in school. Cyrielle divorced her husband two years ago and supports her only child. Cyrielle currently lives in her father’s house in Dédokpo, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou that is squarely located on Lake Nokoué. She runs a telephone booth having two handsets. She sells recharge phone cards of all the mobile phone networks in Bénin. In addition, she has opened a cafeteria, where customer demand for pastries is strong. Because of this outlook, Cyrielle is requesting a loan to expand her businesses. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for micro-loan recipients.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an electric oven for pastries, some phone cards, and cans of evaporated milk

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa started a business selling clothes such as shirts and suits in 2005. She is now requesting a loan  of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Theresa is 54 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta L., 24, is married with one child.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and general public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 tala (~$120 US).  SPBD loans are Ruta’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy more equipment and chemicals for the business and also to improve her home.

loans.use: To purchase garden spray, bush knife, and insectide

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza
Vicenta es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Vicenta tiene una imprenta llamada Señor de Arequipa, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además brinda servicio de fotocopiado, enjicados y venta de útiles de escritorio.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de toner y tinta.
Los sueños de Vicenta son aumentar su negocio, que sus hijos estudien en buenos colegios
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the collective Banco Comunal Alianza. She is 43-years-old, married, and has three children. Vicenta runs a print shop called Señor de Arequipa, which she runs from a rented locale in the town center of Ayacucho. Her services include photocopying and laminating as well as the sale of office supplies. Vicenta needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy toner and ink. Vicenta’s dreams include expanding her business and sending her children to good schools.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toner and ink.

loans.name: Asunción

texts.es:
ASUNCION R. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” vive en Jr Inmaculada Nº 211, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 73 años de edad, 02 hijos realizados y con familia.  Su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera.

Inició el negocio de venta de comidas regionales, tales como juanes, tacacho, y pescado asado. Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compré una parrilla e insumos, como vive en una zona bien concurrida el negocio le va muy bien.

La buena atención y carisma que la caracteriza ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes y ha sido necesario incrementar su capital.

Con este préstamo de S/.2.000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en ampliar su negocio, comprará mesas, sillas, insumos para sus platos al por mayor y todo lo necesario para que su negocio se vea muy bien.

Dice que Manuela Ramos es la única Institución con la que trabaja por los bajos intereses que tiene y la facilidad que les da al obtener un préstamo. Gracias Manuela Ramos
texts.en:
Asunción R. M. belong to the Damas del Oriente (Ladies of the East) Communal Bank. She lives on Inmaculada Ave. in the city of Pucallpa. She is 73 years of age and has two children, all grown up and with families. Her husband works at harvesting timber. She began the business selling regional meals such as "juanes" (a regional dish of rice and meat, wrapped and cooked in a bijao or banana leaf), "tacacho" (grilled plantain) and grilled fish. With her first loan of 300 New Sols she bought a grill and ingredients. As she lives in a well-traveled neighborhood, the business has gone very well. Her good service and charisma has made for lots of customers and it has become necessary for her to increase her capital. This loan of 2,000 New Sols will be invested in expanding her business. She will buy tables, chairs and ingredients for her dishes wholesale, everything necessary to keep her business running well. She says that Manuela Ramos is the only institution that is working to provide low-interest loans and that makes it easy to obtain them. "Thank You, Manuela Ramos."

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Rahat Tariq Group

texts.en:
Rafia baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.

Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (oil, sugar and dry fruits) for her sweetmeat-making business.

Rahat baji, wife of Mr. T., has lived in a city named Lahore, Pakistan, for the past ten years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. She operates a clothes-sewing business to pay off the utilities.

Rahat baji’s husband has a dairy business. Presently, he has one buffalo at his house. He earns income by selling milk to the milk shops and sometimes in the community. Rahat baji is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Seela

texts.en:
Seela E., 54, is married with seven children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and village people four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala.

Seela has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack sprayer, chemicals, knives, a spade and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar Batmonh is a 27-year-old and lives with his wife and newborn daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. When Erdenebaatar got married recently, his parents let him and his wife have their own two-bedroom apartment and moved themselves to a ger (a traditional felt-walled tent) in the suburb of the city. 

Erdenebaatar runs a small motorcycle repair shop where he fixes motorcycles and sells various second-hand accessories.  His repair shop is very close to his home as well as the major paved road in the town that most of his customers use to visit to the shop.  He travels to Ulaanbaatar three to four times a month to get supplies for his shop. 

He would eventually like to expand his shop by offering more diverse services and products related to motorcycles. He also says that he works hard to make extra money with which he would like to build a new house for his parents. He says that his parents let him have their apartment and now are living in a tiny ger. He would like to give back to his parents as soon as he is financially able to accomplish it. 

He requests a loan to purchase more motorcycle accessories for his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Jesús Mi Proveedor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jesús mi proveedor esta integrado por David Antonio P. A., María Teresa Z. M. y Martha Argentina V. G.. Ellos son provenientes del municipio de Diriomo que se localiza en la parte sur central del departamento de Granada, sobre una meseta que tiene a poca distancia las faldas del volcán Mombacho.

El coordinador del grupo es David Antonio P. A. de 38 años de edad el comenzó hace siete años vendiendo leche que distribuía en la comunidad y en granada y su medio de transporte era una bicicleta. Actualmente el vende leche y tibio de leche que distribuye en su moto.

El ya ha trabajado con Adim lo que le permitió mejorar sus ventas pero de la misma manera necesita de mayor inversión para su negocio que seria  en la compra de leche y pinol para vender posteriormente. Para P. su mayor desafío es que su negocio crezca y lo que más desea es prosperar y que su familia este bien.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son María Teresa Z. M. de 17 años de edad quien tiene cinco años vendiendo pan en su casa y en las calles  y Martha Argentina V. G. de 24 años de edad tiene tres años vendiendo plátanos.

Este grupo ha trabajado con Adim lo cual le podemos asegurar que son trabajadores, con iniciativa y con muchos deseo de salir adelante pero lo único que los detiene es no tener los recursos necesarios para invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Jesus Mi Proveedor (Jesus My Provider) Group is made up of David Antonio P. A., María Teresa Z. M. and Martha Argentina V. G.. They are from Diriomo Municipality, located in the south central part of Granada Department, over a plateau near the base of the Mombacho volcano. The group's coordinator is David Antonio P. A., who is 38 years old. He started selling milk in his community and in Granada from his bicycle about seven years ago. Today, he sells milk and hot milk toddies (a drink made from cinnamon, milk, rum and sugar), which he distributes from his motorcycle. He has worked with Adim perviously, which allowed him to improve his sales, but he still needs to invest a larger sum in his business to buy milk and pinol (a corn/cocoa-based powder used to make drinks) to later resell. For P., his greatest challenge is expanding his business. His greatest desire is to prosper and to ensure the well-being of his family. The other group members are María Teresa Z. M., who is 17 years old and has been selling bread from home and on the street for the past five years, and Martha Argentina V. G., who is 24 years old and has been selling bananas for the past three years. This group has already worked with Adim, so we can assure you that they are hardworking, with initiative and a strong desire to get ahead in life. Their only limitation is the lack of necessary resources to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk and pinol (a corn/cocoa-based powder used to make drinks)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret sells sarongs and is also a tailor. She is 52 years old and a widow with seven children. She has been in business for the past ten years. She is requesting a loan amount of 50000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs  to sell

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il s’est lancé en 2006 dans le commerce des planches. Cette activité lui permet de réaliser de très bonnes affaires grâce aux relations qu’il a tissées avec plusieurs chantiers d’ameublement à Lomé. Il fait de telle sorte qu’en cas de pénurie de planches à Lomé, il en dispose toujours des réserves. C’est pour constituer une nouvelle réserve en stock qu’il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour commander 50 planches. Actuellement cet homme dispose d’un bon réseau de distribution pour vite rembourser son prêt. Son honnêteté fait que ses clients ont toujours confiance en lui ; il tient toujours ses engagements.

loans.use: Achat de planches

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena O. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 66 years old, married and has 11 grown children. Nena has owned and operated a sari sari, also known as a general store, for over five years. This is her main source of income and it produces approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to access their financial services, which would help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nena has successfully repaid a previous HSPFI loan in the amount of 11,000 PHP. Nena is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the Nena's fourth HSPFI loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 28 years of age and she is married to Melchor B., who is a driver, they are blessed with two children namely; Melvin- 8 years old, grade 2 in primary level, and Ma. Monica- 6 years of age, grade 1. They are presently residing at Baranggay San Francisco, Alicia Isabela, a rural and plain area, approximately four kilometers away from the national highway.
She manages a poultry business (cobb-raising) for almost three years, her net income is PHP 2,000.00 when she disposed after 15 days. She plans to avail a loan amount of PHP 4,000.00 for starting capital. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan immediately. She's been blessed with productive business, because of that she is thankful to those people who support and helped her.

loans.use: Additional capital in her Poultry business

loans.name: Nandivsuren

texts.en:
Nandivsuren B. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanzurkh district of Ulaanbaatar, the largest city and capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her oldest child currently attends university and her youngest is a high school student.

B. operates a meat-trading business at a small market in the city. She purchases a large amount of meat during the summer and fall and preserves it for sale in the winter when it is in high demand. She started her business in 1998, selling only goat meat, and has become very experienced in her trade.

Today, B.’s business is a very stable operation, and she hopes to expand in the future. Her dream is to one day open a meat-trading center to sell a variety of meat to the people of the city. She continues to support her family with her business and hopes to one day pass it down to her children.

B. is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase goat meat for her business, and to help her oldest daughter purchase her own ger.

loans.use: To purchase goat meat for her business, and to help her oldest daughter purchase her own ger

loans.name: Florfina

texts.en:
Florfina is an industrious mother and a loving wife to Tomas. One of her guiding principles is "patience is the key to success and productivity." She manages a hog-raising business. Whenever she sells a hog, her net income is Php5,000.

Florfina wants a loan of Php10,000 from KIVA lenders to purchase some hog feed and some hogs to raise. She is grateful because there are people who are generous to give financial assistance to the needy.

Florfina and Tomas are blessed with four children namely: Robert, 31 years of age, forestry graduate and now working abroad; Rona, 29, public school teacher; Rocky, 25, also working abroad; and Rose Ann, 22, working as a radio technologist. Florfina and her husband peacefully reside in the village of Calamagui San Pablo Isabela Cagayan. Florfina said that she's happy with what she has right now, because she feels a lot of contentment in her life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her hog-raising business

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es: José Daniel M. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Unión, junto a sus dos pequeñas hijas y su esposa. El posee una tienda en su casa de habitación, la cual esta ubicada frente a una escuela, lo cual contribuye a obtener mayores ganancias. José solícita un préstamo, ya que desea surtir su negocio y mejorar las ganancias, debido a que este es el único soporte económico que posee. José es una persona muy amable y responsable, el cual anhela brindarles una mejor vida a su esposa y a sus hijas y así mismo brindarles un mejor futuro a sus pequeñas niñas.
texts.en:
José Daniel M. is 44 years old, and lives in the La Unión region with his two small daughters and his wife. He has a store in his house. It is located in front of a school, which contributes to higher earnings. Jose is requesting a loan, since he would like to stock his store with merchandise to increase his earnings, given that this is the only economic support that he has. Jose is a very friendly and responsible person who is eager to provide a better life for his wife and his daughters, and also a better future for his small daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy perishable grocery products

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en: T. Hilder is 25 years old and married with three children. She runs a supermarket business. She is using the loan to purchase supermarket items such as soap, plates, drinks, sprays, and so on. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to upgrade to a large supermarket where she would sell almost every type of essential goods and appliances for a big profit return.

loans.use: To purchase supermarket items to sell.

loans.name: Amatista Group

texts.es: Margarita, Julian, Mery, Martha, Arminda, Marina, Claudia, Olivia, Fanny, Patricia, Nancy, Senaida, Rosmery y Frida, son las 14  integrantes del grupo Amatista, que tienen diversos negocios como la venta  de material de construcción, venta de chuño (papa deshidratada), venta de jugo de naranja, venta de ropa, atención de tienda de abarrotes y venta de comida. En esta época de fin de año desean mejorar sus ingresos y para ello necesitan un préstamo para comprar mercadería y seguir adelante en sus negocios. Así por ejemplo Fanny de 37 años vende jugo de naranja en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y necesita el préstamo para comprar naranja.
texts.en:
Margarita, Julian, Mery, Martha, Arminda, Marina, Claudia, Olivia, Fanny, Patricia, Nancy, Senaida, Rosmery, and Frida are the 14 members of the Amatista group. They have various diverse businesses, such as construction materials, chuño [dried potatoes], orange juice, clothing, grocery store, and food sales.

In this end of year season, they want to increase their profits, and for this they need a loan to buy merchandise and move ahead in their businesses. For example, Fanny, 37 years old, sells orange juice in various markets in the city of El Alto. She needs a loan to purchase more oranges.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus S. is from the village of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Venus is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Venus operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas, candies, shampoo, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits,coffee and other daily used products in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2008, Venus joined GDMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Venus is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Venus from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
